loans.name: Rossana

texts.es: Rossana R.  es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive n la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 40 años de edad, madre de dos hijos menores, se dedica a  la confección de prendas de vestir, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es  mecánico. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas” desde hace seis años, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad en sus pagos. El primer crédito que recibió le permitió invertir en la compra de prendas interiores para luego venderlos. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que le permitirá invertir en telas, hilos, elásticos para confeccionar blusas y todo tipo de prendas de vestir para venderlas a sus clientes. La meta de Rossana es llegar a tener un taller de costura bien implementado y seguir mejorando económicamente.
texts.en:
Rossana R. is a dynamic and collaborative woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 40, is the mother of 2 young children, and makes a living by making clothing. She has the support of her husband, who is a mechanic. She has been a member of the communal bank, "'Las Margaritas" (The Daisies) for 6 years, where she has always been characterized by being punctual with her payments. The first credit she received allowed her to invest in the purchase of undergarments to later sell. Currently she needs a loan of 1,200 PEN which will let her invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, and elastic to make blouses and all types of garments to sell to her customers. Rossana's goal is to have a sewing shop that is well-implemented so she can continue improving economically.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, and elastic to make clothing.

loans.name: Hajera Safy Group

texts.en:
This is Hajera Safy's group. This group is made up of three members. Hajera, in the middle, is the group leader. She is 40 years old. She is married with 7 children: four sons and three daughters. She is a weaver. Her oldest son, who is 30, supports her as well. 
These three members have requested a group loan of 30000 Afghani. Gullaly is the second member of Hajera Safy's group. She wants to take a loan for her husband's general store. Through its income, he supports his family members. With the loan, he will expand his business. The last member is Hadesa, who is a tailor. She started sewing clothes during the Taliban regime because they had lots of economic problems at that time. With the Kiva loan, she wants to buy a new sewing machine to start a business to support her husband and children.
They all would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis O. O. is 28 years old. He is married and has 2 children who are in school.

His business is situated in Kariobangi-Nairobi where he is a tailor, mainly making men's suits and trousers. Denis' customers are locals. He hopes to expand his business and become a big distributor of suits. His major challenges are the rise in prices of materials and the competition he faces. Many people in the area engage in the same kind of business.

Now, Denis is purchasing more materials to grow his business. He is hardworking and focused. He is requesting a loan to support these improvements and his business.

loans.use: Materials for making men's suits and trousers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Maria es casada, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Maria vende frutas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Señor de Arequipa, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además compra cacao en la selva ayacuchana y lo vende a intermediarios.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas.
Maria sueña con que sus hijos estudien y progresen, aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Hormigas (“Ants”) Communal Bank Maria is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. Maria works every day selling fruits as a traveling street vendor in the Señor de Arequipa market. In addition, she also purchases cacao in the Ayacuchan jungle and sells it to middlemen. Maria needs a loan of 1000 soles, and will use the money to invest in the purchase of fruits. Maria’s dream is for her children to study and make progress, and to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fruits

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie M. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Melanie is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a business selling firewood in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in further expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba K. lives in Freetown with her husband and four children. Her husband works as a security guard.

Kumba K. has been in business for ten years, selling watermelons, oranges and plantain. She supports her family with her business. Her desire to break out of the grip of poverty has been the driving force that has taken her through four loans with LAPO, SL. 

With her previous loan Kumba K. expanded her business by purchasing more watermelons, oranges and plantain to sell. She is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 leones to again purchase more watermelons, oranges and plantain. She hopes to realize her dream of educating her children.

loans.use: To purchase more watermelons, oranges and plantain

loans.name: Mayra Azucena

texts.es:
La Sra. Mayra Ríos trabaja como asalariada en el Hospital España de Chinandega como Enfermera encargada de pacientes con Infección  Renal Crónica (IRC). 
Ella va a utilizar este crédito para cubrir gastos universitaR. de ella ya que esta por recibirse.
Ella es madre soltera de un niño, pero gracias a Dios y a su trabajo ha podido salir adelante con el y darle una buena educación.

Este es el primer crédito que solicita con la Institución en el cual se siente agradecida con la Institución por darle la oportunidad de progresar y apoyarla en su necesidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra Ríos works as a salaried employee at the Spanish Hospital of Chinandega. She is a nurse who is charge of the patients with chronic renal infection.

Mayra will use this loan to cover the university expenses for herself that she is about to incur. She is a single mother with a son, but thanks to God, her work allows her to move forward so that she can provide him a good education.

This is the first loan she has requested from the Institution. She is grateful to CEPRODEL for giving her the opportunity to progress and supporting her in this need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for university expenses

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes N°8 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) comme son nom l’indique est un réseau de femmes qui s’activent  dans le commerce.  Il est basé à Grand Thiès et il a été créé depuis 1992 par Madame Maty Niakh l’actuel président du réseau. Cette présidente a eu cette idée  à l’issue d’une formation qu’elle avait bénéficiée  de l’ONG OXFAM à Thiès. Elle connait, ainsi, bien la gestion de groupe, entreprenariat …etc.  Les membres du réseau sont extrêmement dévoués et se rencontrent une fois par mois. Ainsi, après des frais d’adhésion au groupement, chaque membre est tenu de cotiser mensuellement 200 FCFA pour une caisse de solidarité.
Souhaitant se financer, elles décidèrent  d’adhérer à  U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que,  leur réseau se voit scinder en 19 sous groupes de 5 personnes  pour un meilleur profit des financements. Elles sollicitent pour une deuxième fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA par membre,  soit 500 000 FCFA par sous groupe afin de développer leurs diverses activités.
Cependant, les règlements sont versés à la présidente assistée par la trésorière du groupe, Madame Coumba S., pendant leurs réunions mensuelles et ces deux se chargent à leur tour de rembourser U-IMCEC. Ce réseau qui, dit la présidente, n’a qu’un seul et noble objectif : combattre la pauvreté dans les ménages. Actuellement, le réseau compte 19 sous groupes avec chacun une présidente et une trésorière.
Cependant Femmes Commerçantes N°8 est sous la responsabilité de Madame  Khady F.. Cette dernière est âgée de 42 ans et gère une boutique appelée maison bébé. En fait elle vend des habits pour bébés depuis 15 ans. Elle est célibataire et mère d'un seul enfant âgé de 20 ans à ce jour. Cependant Madame Khady F. admet avoir pris en charge les besoins de son enfant avec ses profits du commerce. Elle partage ce sous groupe Femmes Commerçantes N°8 avec Madame Rokhaya N., 53 ans et vendeuse de poissons séchés, Madame Fatou N. vendeuse de glace et de jus locaux, Madame Oumy M. qui fait le commerce ambulant de produits cosmétiques et de Madame Sokhna Aminata S.  qui vend elle aussi du parfum, et thiouraye (encens).
texts.en:
As its name suggests, Femmes Commerçantes is a network of businesswomen. It is based at Grand Thiès and was created in 1992 by Ms. Maty Niakh, its current president. She got the idea of forming the network after participating in a training session run by Oxfam at Thiès, in which she became familiar with group organization and running a business. The members of the group are dedicated to what they do, and meet together once a month. Over and above membership dues, each of them pays 200 FCFA a month into a group solidarity fund. Looking for financing, they decided to join U-IMCEC. The network is divided into 19 subgroups of five people so that financing can be better handled. Each subgroup has its own president and treasurer. They now seek, for the second time, a loan of 100,000 FCFA per member or 500,000 FCFA for each subgroup, to grow their various activities. The members repay their loans to the president and the treasurer, Ms. Coumba S.. They, in turn, are responsible for repaying U-IMCEC. According to the president, the group’s praiseworthy objective is to fight family poverty. Femmes Commerçantes N° 8 falls under the responsibility of Mrs. Khady F.. She is 42 years old and runs a shop named “Maison Bébé” (Baby House). She has been selling baby clothes for 15 years. She is unmarried and the mother of one child aged 20. She acknowledges that is the earnings from her commerce that enabled her to take care of her child. She is joined in the Femmes Commerçantes N° 8 group by Mrs. Rokhaya N., a 53-year-old vendor of dried fish; Mrs. Fatou N., vendor of ice cream and local fruit juices; Mrs. Oumy M., an itinerant vendor of beauty products; and Mrs. Sokhna Aminata S., who also sells perfume and thiouraye (incense).

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resupply merchandise

loans.name: Trina Mezhgan Group

texts.en:
Sosan is the daughter of M. G. H., and the leader of Trina Mezhgan group. She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children – two sons and one daughter. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, with her whole family, including her elderly parents. Sosan is a very hardworking woman. For more than three years, she has been running a tailoring business. Now she wants to buy a new sewing machine for her younger daughter and some clothes.
Sosan wants to thank all Kiva lenders around the world for supporting the poor in countries like Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her younger daughter

loans.name: Liliana Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la localidad de Junín un bello y paradisiaco cantón en la provincia de Manabí nos reunimos con las socias del banco comunal Junín del cual la señora Liliana forma parte del el y nos permitió conocer mas de ella, ya son 6 ciclos los que lleva en el bankito y esta muy contenta al trabajar con los créditos, porque aparte de ser una excelente madre y buen ama de casa también esta inmersa en el mundo de los negocios, y desde hace varios años tiene el negocio de las ventas de ropa como  medias , pantalones, blusas y todo para lucir bien en toda ocasión.

Ahora con este nuevo crédito la señora Liliana  hará un viaje hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil donde hace sus compras para el negocio, va hasta los grandes distribuidores de ropa e invierte todo lo que el dinero que recibe, por lo general viaja cada dos meses eso también depende de cómo se manejen las ventas, una vez traída la mercadería saca su puesto los días domingo en la feria del pueblo, el esposo le acompaña a pesar que el tiene su propio trabajo que es de ser agricultor los días que no esta en las siembras es el domingo y se lo dedica al negocio de su esposa.
texts.en:
In Junín, a beautiful and heavenly canton of Manabí province we meet with the members of the Junín communal bank. Liliana is a member and she allowed us to learn a bit more about her. She has been a member of the bank for six cycles and she is very happy to work with the loans because, besides being an excellent mother and good housewife, she is immersed in the business world: she has had a clothing sales business for several years where she stocks hosiery, pants, blouses and everything else needed to look good for any occasion. Liliana will use this new loan to travel to Guayaquil where she will purchase stock merchandise for her business; she will visit the large clothing distributors and will invest all the funds she receives. She usually makes this buying trip every two months depending on how good sales are. Once she brings the merchandise she sets up her sales stand at the town’s Sunday market. Her husband keeps her company although he has his own occupation. He’s a farmer but his day off from farming chores is Sunday so he dedicates it to his wife’s business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted women's clothing.

loans.name: Ramona Asuncion

texts.es:
Al estar trabajando junto a la Fundación Espoir la señora Ramona ha podido surgir en el mundo de las ventas de la cual ha sabido obtener gran experiencia en este campo.

Nuestra socia que pertenece al Banco Comunal 22 de Julio en la parroquia Picoaza se dedica al comercio, su actividad se basa en la venta de productos naturales, además vende lotería  recorriendo en el centro de las ciudades de Portoviejo y Manta, actualmetne mantiene una relación  de 14 años con el padre de sus 3 hijos, cuenta la señora Ramona que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas durante estos 5 ciclos que lleva de socia.
Con este nuevo crédito la señora Ramona invertirá en sus negocios y a la vez compartirá con el esposo el  dinero del crédito  pues el también necesita invertir algo de capital en el negocio de las legumbres, trabajo que lo ha sabido mantener por varios años. El  sueño de nuestra socia se basa en poder ver realizados a sus hijos y  poder darle un techo en que vivir. 

Con el nuevo crédito podrá incrementar su negocio, tiene que hacer la entrega de varios pedidos de los productos naturales quiere que su negocio cada día sea mas rentable.
texts.en:
Working with [the field partner] Fundación Espoir, Ramona has risen in the world of sales and gained a great deal of experience in this field. Ramona is a member of the "22 de Julio" Communal Bank in the Picoaza district. Her business is based on the sale of natural products, while she also sells lottery tickets around the city centres of Portoviejo and Manta. She has been in a relationship for 14 years with the father of her three children. Sales have been going very well throughout the 5 loan cycles she has undertaken. With this new loan, Ramona will invest in her business and will share the money with her partner, as he too needs capital to invest in the vegetable business he has held for several years. Ramona's dreams are based on seeing her children do well and being able to provide a home for them. With this new loan, she will be able to grow her business, paying installments on orders of natural products. She wants to see her business become more profitable every day.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 'Omnilife' natural products

loans.name: Teola

texts.en: Teola R. is from the village of Villaramos. She is 44 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Teola owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Teola joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Teola is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth P., 39 years old, is a married woman from the town of Sta. Josefa. She has 3 young children. She is a farmer and has been planting rice for over five years now. She sells her harvest at her town's market. Her husband helps her maintain their farm. She also runs a sari-sari store located at their house. She sells vinegar, sugar, and other daily basic needs her neighbors usually look for. 

Lilibeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Lilibeth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa, D. 61 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía D. su esposo y sus 2 jóvenes hijos.Durante el día realiza dos actividades, por las mañanas ofrece productos D. belleza (D. diferentes marcas), y por las tardes prepara bebidas (mate y café) y bocadillos (budines, queques y alfajores). En éste negocio trabaja junto con su hijo, quien también  ofrece a sus amigos D. unas cabinas D.  Internet, ubicadas al costado del negocio. Se siente muy satisfecha con las ganancias que obtiene D. las dos actividades; aunque a veces siente impotencia  D. no surtir a sus clientes, con mayor cantidad D. productos D. belleza, y pierD. así varias oportunidades D. venta. Para mas adelante lo que más desea, es ampliar ambos  negocios y comprarse una vitrina para exhibir mejor los productos D. belleza que ofrece en su casa.Es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP,  y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además esta  al pendiente D. las cobranzas y los depósitos a  realizarse, ya que es la líder D. su grupo.Clarisa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. variedad D. productos D. belleza, para atender las diversas solicitudes D. sus clientes, D. esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Clarisa (61 years old) lives in her house with her husband and two children. During the day, she works two jobs; in the morning she sells different brands of beauty products, and in the afternoon she prepares and sells drinks, like mate and cafe, and snacks, like puddings, cakes and alfajores. In this second business, she works together her son, who offers the use of computers for Internet alongsiD. the food sales. Clarisa is very satisfied with the income she makes from both her jobs; yet sometimes she feels helpless when unable to supply her customers with larger quantities of beauty products, which loses her some sales opportunities. What Clarisa wants more than anything is to be able to grow both her businesses in the future. She wants to buy a glass case to showcase better the beauty products she offers for sale in her home. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. She always keeps an eye out for payments and deposits to fulfill, and she is the leader of her lending group. Clarisa plans to invest the solicited money in the purchase of various beauty products so she can better attend to the diverse needs of her customers. By doing so, she hopes to continue moving forward in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beauty products to increase available merchandise

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 21 years old and married with two children. The first one is 5 years and the last one is 2 years old. Christine is a businesswoman as is her husband. This family works hard in order to get everything the family needs. Christine has a business selling the various styles of the shoes. Christine has 10 years of experience working from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day except on Saturday.

Christine is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business. With this expansion, she will be able to earn more profit, which is the target of everyone in the business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING GROCERIES FOR HER STORE AND COFFEE SHOP

loans.name: Aidee Maria

texts.es:
Aidee de 40 años, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive en una zona periurbana con sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera. 

Realiza su trabajo sola para poder mantener a su hijo, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aidee is 40 years old, and she sells Yambal brand products (a company that engages entrepreneurial women to make their own private sales). She lives in a suburban region with her two children. She is a single mother. She works to be able to support her chidlren. She starts from very early in the morning, selling her products to her neighbors and her friends. She sells perfumes, skin creams, deodorants, etc. This loan will be invested in the purchase of Yambal brand products such as perfumes, skin creams, deodorants etc. In the future she hopes to finish building her house and she wishes to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and skin creams.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola de 29 años, vende bebidas y comida en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. 

Inicio vendiendo bebida desde que su esposo la abandono para poder mantener a sus tres hijos, le presto a un amigo un congelador y compro barias pacas de bebidas, poco a poco con esfuerzo también comenzó a vende comida. Trabaja en ocasiones con ayuda de la mama para tener tiempo para sus hijos.     

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas y carnes para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener bien constituido su negocio para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Paola, 29 years old, sells drinks and food from the front of her house. She lives in the Paraiso of Guayaquil, a mountainous area on the outskirts of the city. She began to sell drinks to support her 3 children when her husband abandoned her. A friend loaned her a freezer, and she purchased various bulk packs of drinks. Little by little, with much effort, she also began to sell food. On occasion her mother helps her; she then has time for her children. With this loan she wants to buy drinks and meat for her business. Her goal is to have her business well-established so that her children can have a brighter future.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of drinks and meat

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas M., 41, is a professional silk weaver, making US$2 of profit every day. She is married and has four young children living at home to support. 

Her husband is a moto-taxi driver. On average, he is able to make US$2 of profit a day as well. 

Meas M. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Teofila; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta y compra de carne de vaca y cordero, ella vende en el mercado de Izcuchaca desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ganados y corderos al por mayor.


 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the community bank named "Ricchary Antena". The community bank is located in the district of Izcuchaca of the province of Anta in Cusco. 

Teofila is 39 years old and she is a single mother of 3 children. Her business is the buying and selling of beef and pork meats. She sells in the market of Izcuchaca from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is able to support her children through this business and she wishes to expand it. She requests a loan to purchase livestock in wholesale. 

She is grateful to all of those who will contribute towards her dream and she is committed to the payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase livestock in wholesale.

loans.name: La Gran Amistad (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Gran Amistad está formado por 9 mujeres y 2 hombres quienes con sus diferentes actividades diarias ayudan a la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y así brindarles un mejor futuro. La mayoria de los miembros de la banca comunal viven el la parroquia de Cumbe, que es conocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, en su mayor parte su gente se dedica a la agricultura que es para su consumo y cría de animales, muchos salen a la ciudad a trabajar en diferentes actividades.

La Señora Rosa M. vive en la comunidad del Salado en la parroquia del Valle pero asiste a las reuniones a la parroquia de Cumbe,  una amiga le ha invitado a formar parte de este grupo, este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal.
Nuestra socia se dedica a la Agricultura, cultiva verduras y hortalizas  en tierras que le han prestado para que las haga producir, todos sus productos los vende los días sábados en un merado de la ciudad, esta en este negocio hace 7 años. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a tejer ponchos, carteras, etc., las que vende a sus compañeras de la banca comunal y amigas. 
Doña Rosa tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijas de 14, 12, 9, 7 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija  estudia en el colegio y sus cuatro hijas  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven cuidando una casa.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para la fertilización de las tierras. Su meta es cerrar con mallar el terreno para que animales vecinos no le dañen sus cultivos.

La Señorita. Graciela L. vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, pero es oriunda del Cantón
Sigsig, vive en casa de su prima pero independiente, es soltera y tiene 18 años de edad, Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y fue invitada por su prima a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres. 
La Señorita Graciela trabaja en la atención de una panadería, labora desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, esta actividad  la viene realizando hace 2 años de lunes a domingo.
 
Con el dinero de su crédito va a iniciar en el negocio de criar pollos. Su sueño es emprender con su propio negocio y llegar a tener un local de venta de electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
The Gran Amistad (Great Friendship) communal bank is made up of 9 women and 2 men who, with their different daily activities, help the economic stability of their homes and in this way they provide for themselves a better future. The majority of the members of the communal bank live in the Cumbe parish, which is known for its natural beauty. Most of its habitants make a living in the agricultural sector, which is for their own consumption and for raising animals. Many leave the city to work in different activities. 

Mrs. Rosa M. lives in the Salado community in the Valley parish, but she attends the meetings of the Cumbe parish, as a friend of hers invited her to be part of this group. This is the second loan that she has taken out as part of the communal bank. This group member makes a living in agriculture. She cultivates vegetables and garden produce in land that has been loaned to her to cultivate it. She sells all of her products on Saturdays at a market in the city. She started this business 7 years ago. In her free time she also makes a living sewing ponchos, wallets, etc. She sells them to the members of the communal bank and to her friends. Rosa is 33 years old, married and has 5 children, ages 14, 12, 9, 7, and 6. The oldest child studies in high school and the other four children study in a city school. Her husband is a bricklayer. They don’t have their own house. Where they live, they are caring for another’s house.

The loan money will be used to purchase fertilizer for the fields. Her goal is to close off the land plot with a wire fence so that the neighbors’ animals don’t damage her crops. 

Miss Graciela L. lives in the Cumbe parish, but she is originally from Cantón Sigsig. She lives in her cousin’s house, but independently. She is single and 18 years old. This is the first loan that she is taking out with the communal bank and she was invited by her cousin to form part of this group of women.

Miss Graciela works at the counter of a bakery, and woks from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. She started this job two years ago, and works Monday through Sunday. 

With the money from her loan she is going to start a business raising chickens. Her dream is to launch her own business and to eventually have an electrical appliances store.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chickens.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan P. is from the village of San Fermin, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Joan is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Joan owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing rubber bushing in the local community. Joan has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Joan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Joan is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Joan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Maura Germania

texts.es:
Maura vende comidas rápida en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Inicio su negocio para cubrir los gastos de su familia y ayudarle a su esposo. Comprando carnes, papas para hacer la comida rápida inicio su negocio desde la parte delantera de su casa. Poco a poco comenzó a tener clientela ya que era conocido por el sector donde vive. Vende papas fritas, hamburguesas, hot dog y trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, pollos para hacer mas comida rápidas. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio para que sus clientes se sientas a gusto comprando.
texts.en:
Maura sells fast food in front of her house. She lives in a peripheral neighborhood called Paraíso de la Flor, which is characterized by its unpaved streets and mountains. 

She began her business to cover her family’s expenses and to help her husband. She buys meats and potatoes to make the fast food in front of her house. She sells french fries, hamburgers, and hot dogs. She works from 6:00am to 9:00pm.

With the loan she will buy meats and chicken to make more fast foods. In the future, she would like to expand her business space so that her customers can be more comfortable when they buy from her.

loans.use: To buy meats and chicken

loans.name: Miraida's Group

texts.en:
Coal has been a very important part of energy sources in Kyrgyzstan. The government is planning to increase the mining of coal, in order to decrease the dependence on imported oil and gas from other countries. However the small output does not meet domestic needs. 

Miraida R., 22, is a resident of a small coal mining town, Tashkomur. She has raised and sold cattle for almost two years. Despite the fact that she’s only 22 years old, Miraida makes good use of her business. Her husband is a coal miner. The family used his salary to purchase 4 sheep in 2008. They say the biggest challenge was starting the business, but later they became accustomed to the business atmosphere. The monthly proceeds from business is only 7,000 soms. This amount is far from their wishes. In the future the they plan a larger family and to create good conditions for their children. Miraida would like to get a loan to purchase 5 more livestock animals for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy K., 45, is a farmer. K. is married and lives with her husband and eight children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Her husband is a skilled carpenter who earns an income of USD $3.00 per day. The family has to spend USD $58.00 on food, USD $3.00 on electricity, and USD $4.00 on other necessary expenses every month. 

K. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use her profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva field partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Sinceridad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sinceridad, incia su cuarto ciclo con 17 socias, las cuales tiene diversoso negocios, como es el caso D. Maria, tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Maria tiene un carpintería con su esposo, confeccionan: puertas, ventanas, balcones, atienD. pedidos, el año pasado le fue bien hizo trabajos para L. instituciones públicas D. L. región. Solicita un prestamo apra L. compra D. thiner, goma y laca. 
A Maria le gustan las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal porque se práctica el compañerismo entre las socias del Banco Comunal, aprenD. mucho D. las capacitaciones que recibe D. su promotora.
Su sueño es ahorrar para comprar máquinas para implementar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: The Sinceridad ["Sincerity"] Community Bank is starting its fourth cycle with 17 members who have diverse businesses. Maria, age 41, is married and has 4 children. Maria has a carpenter's shop with her husband. They make: doors, windows and balconies. They take orders. Last year they maD. orders for local public institutions. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of thinner, rubber and lacquer. Maria likes her Community Bank meetings because the members are friends. She learns a lot from the training that she receives from the captain. Her dream is to save to purchase machines for her business, and for her children to be professionals.

loans.use: the purchase of thinner, rubber and lacquer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman living in Lebanon with her husband and 2 school-aged children. In addition to her husband’s income (he works as a taxi driver), she represents the second income source for the family. After having 15 years of experience in the hairdressing field, she decided to work as a hairdresser from her house. She hopes to expand her business, especially so that she can build a good business reputation.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional cosmetics products since she wants to offer her clients more beauty services so she can attract a maximum number of clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics products

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Juana Paula tiene 47años. Es una señora con un gran espíritu emprendedor. Vive en su propia casa con 6 sus hijos. Todos los días su trabajo comienza desde muy temprano porque tiene que realizar la compra de sus productos y además empezar la elaboración de sus platillos. Desde hace 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad que es la venta de comida. Ella comenzó con una gran variedad de platillos para ofrecer a sus diferentes clientes. Ahora ella recurre a Fundación León 2000 para facilitarle un financiamiento que será utilizado para capital de trabajo y así comprar frutas, verduras, aceite, carnes, gaseosas, jugos, entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Juana Paula is a 47-year-old woman with an enterprising spirit. She lives in her own house with her 6 children. Every day, her job starts very early in the morning because she has to purchase her products and start making her dishes. She has been selling food for the last 18 years. She started out with a great variety of dishes to offer her patrons. She now turns to Fundación León 2000 for a loan that will be utilized as working capital so that she can buy fruits, vegetables, cooking oil, meats, soft drinks, juice, and other goods.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Sot Y. is from the province of Kompong Cham.  Since 1998, she has made a living by growing rice on her own farmland. She usually generates a profit of about $2.50 each day to help support her family. Sot Y.’s husband is a local farmer as well as a classical musician, who performs with two children in ceremonies around the community. The couple has three children. Sot Y. would like a loan to pay for repairs to her old house. She used to hire a few domestic workers to repair the house.

loans.use: To pay for repairs to her old house.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Clara; La socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia  es conviviente; la socia tiene 5 hijos de (18,17,15,11,2) años de edad; la socia trabaja en artesanía, la socia realiza bellísimos trabajos en textil ería, también produce chompas de alpaca, la socia hace adornos y también surte su negocio con todo tipo de cerámica;  alternando a este trabajo la socia tien una parcela de terreno en la cual produce, maíz, papa, la socia desea el crédito está vez para poder invertir en la compra de materiales para los textiles, en lana de alpaca y en la compra de cerámica para surtir su negocio, ella vende todos los días en el mercado artesanal.
La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales.                                                                                                                                                          
La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the "Nueva Victoria - Chinchero" ("New Victory - Chinchero") communal bank, located in the district of Chinchero, province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

Clara is 38 years old and lives with her partner. She has 5 children aged 18, 17, 15, 11 and 2. She works in the crafts sector. She makes beautiful textile pieces as well as alpaca sweaters. She makes ornaments and also provides her business with all types of ceramic pieces. On top of this she owns a plot of land that produces corn and potatoes. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of materials for her textile pieces, alpaca wool and ceramic pieces for her business. She sells her goods every day at the craft market. Clara is happy with the loan and is committed to repaying it in the agreed time.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of craft materials.

loans.name: Misha

texts.en:
Misha A. was born in 1969. He lives in the village of Tsovagyugh, in the Sevan area, with his wife and his 13-year-old son. Misha has engaged in animal breeding since 1990. With his wife’s help, he raises cows, calves, sheep and chickens. Thanks to his income from farming, Misha provides for his family’s needs. 
Misha needs a 350,000 AMD loan to buy one more cow for his farm.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for his farm

loans.name: Jose Reyneri

texts.es:
José, tiene 36 años de edad, reside en San Rafael oriente, departamento de San Miguel, su familia está conformada por su esposa  y dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad,  José es agricultor tiene 15 años de dedicarse a los cultivos de maíz y frijol, trabaja todos los días de la semana y está próxima la temporada donde el trabajo se intensifica por motivos de la siembra a la llegada del invierno.
Él necesita realizar las compras de los materiales agrícolas, también arrendar el terreno donde se dispone a sembrar, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le cubra estos gastos y poder llevar a cabo la siembra, ya que esta asegurándose con anticipación del terreno y de sus materiales.
Su objetivo es sacar a su familia adelante, a través del trabajo que sus hijos se formen académicamente.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and lives in east San Rafael in the department of San Miguel with his wife and two children, ages 8 and 5.  He is a farmer who has been raising corn and bean crops for 15 years.  He works every day of the week, especially now with the approach of the planting season because of winter.

José needs to buy farm supplies and pay for rental of the land he will be planting.  He is requesting a loan to cover these costs to ensure he has the land and supplies ahead of time.

His goal is to provide for his family and, through his work, make sure his children receive a good education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for land rental

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Inecio

texts.es:
El señor Inecio tiene 63 años de edad, está casado con la señora Delfina Cardozo de 64 años de edad, tienen 2 hijos, viven en un barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Itá.
El posee 2 camiones con los que realiza servicios de flete en la ciudad de Itá y alrededores, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 21 años, gracias a su excelente trato y servicio posee una clientela muy bien formada.
Sus hijos aún viven con él, uno de ellos lo ayuda en su negocio manejando uno de sus camiones y la otra hija es estudiante, los ingresos económicos que obtiene a través de esta actividad es lo que permite que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de salir adelante y construyan un camino de vida digna, sin andar por los vicios o delitos como otros tantos jóvenes.
El solicita el crédito a Kiva para poder comprar cubiertas nuevas para sus vehículos, ya que es muy importante para su negocio el mantenimiento correcto de ellos, pues es su medio de trabajo y lo ayudaría a continuar con su actividad.
texts.en:
Inecio is 63 years old, he is married to 64 year old Delfina and they have 2 children. They live in a very well know neighborhood of the city of Itá.
He owns 2 trucks with which her runs a freight service in the city of Itá and the surrounding area. He has been doing this since he was 21 years old. Thanks to his excellent service and treatment of his customers, he has very good client base.
His children still live with him, one of them helps him in the business driving one of the trucks and the other girl is a student. The income that he makes from this work is what enables his children to have the opportunity to be successful and create dignified lives, without walking the path of vice or crime like so many other young people. 
He is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy new tires for his vehicles as it is very important for his business that he maintains his trucks well - this is his work tool and enables him to continue his activity.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 30 years old, married, and four children between the ages of 10 and 20 years old. She has three years of experience selling sorghum in her market. Jacqueline is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more sorghum to sell. With this profits, she will build a house for her business and reinvest in her enterprise in order to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 31 years old and the married father of four lovely children. He lives with his family in Mitume, which is located in the outskirts of Kitale town. Shadrack is a dairy farmer and for the past seven years has also had a shop where he sells milk. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Shadrack is requesting his sixth loan with KADET LTD to buy a refrigerator to preserve his milk for a longer time. He will use the income from his loan to repay the loan and also to save for the future. Shadrack plans to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to preserve milk

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Zoila is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.  Zoila has a food shop that sells afritada, caldereta & chicken adobo.
She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like vegetables, spices & meat. Zoila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Zoila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like vegetables, spices & meat

loans.name: Lowella

texts.es: Lowella de 31 años es la propietaria de Miscelánea Lowella , ubicada en el barrio El Romance de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde  vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 10 años. En su negocio tiene vitrinas en las cuales exhibe los productos que vende de contado y acredito,  como ropa, cosméticos, variedades y papelería en general. Su negocio comenzó con un pequeño préstamo que obtuvo de un amigo, luego de su actividad ordenada fue creciendo paulatinamente,  hasta que adicionó vitrinas  para ordenar sus mercancías y protegerlas y con ello ha logrado incrementar su clientela.  Este es su  tercer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará tarjetería, papelería, cosméticos y ropa para niños encargada y son de mayor rotación en su sector. Desde que ingresó a esta organización su vida ha cambiado de manera muy positiva, pues gracias al incremento de su negocio, apoyado por esta organización,  ha logrado la adquisición de su vivienda en muy poco tiempo.  Ahora su sueño se concentra en trasladarse a ella y mas adelante convertir su negocio en un gran almacén que venda todos los productos que requieran sus clientes. Mientras todo esto ocurre, Lowella se esmera en continuar sosteniendo una rentabilidad no menor de 37% y rotando sus cuentas por cobrar cada 26 días y en lograr una financiacion suficiente para lograr muchos de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Lowella is 31 years old and owns a store called "Miscelánea Lowella" which is located in El Romance neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla.  She lives with her partner and her three children who are aged between 6 and 10.  In her business, Lowella has display cases where she displays her products which she sells for cash and on credit.  She sells clothes, cosmetics and stationery products.  She started her business with a small loan from a friend and her business grew gradually.  She added display cases so that she could organize her merchandise and protect them.  As a result, she has managed to increase her customer base.

This is Lowella's third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy cards, stationery products, cosmetics and children's clothes.  She has orders for these and they have a good turnover in her area.  Since she joined our organization, Lowella's life has really changed for the better as, thanks to the increase in her business and with the support of the organization, she has managed to acquire her own home in very little time.  Now her dream is to move into her home and, in the future, turn her business into a large store where she is able to sell all the products that her customers need.  While all this is happening, Lowella takes care to continue maintaining a profitability of no less than 37% and an accounts receivable turnover period of 26 days.  She hopes to make enough money to achieve many of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy cards, stationery products, cosmetics and children's clothes

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 31 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-age children.
Jenifer works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She sells fish in the local community every morning. She has been running this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,500 in this business. Jenifer has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional fishing nets. Jenifer has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Jenifer hopes to purchase a fishing boat and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.fr:
Client age de 45 ans, marie et pere de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 11 mois et 22 ans.Par manque de soutien pour faire des etudes  secondaires et universitaires, il se lance dans la fabrication et  commercialisation des gateaux.Ses recettes font en moyenne 20.000fr par jour.

Vue la forte demande sur le marche , l'octroi du pret permettre de renforcer le stock de 2 sacs de 50 kg  farine, 50kg de sucre, 25l de bidon d'huile , 10kg de margarine, palettes des oeufs, de la levure et levure chimique.
Il a l'intention de beaucoup epargner a partir des benefices afin de construire une patisserie de grande surface, tres entreprenant , il fait face a la scolarite de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This customer is 45 years old, married and a father of four kids aged 11 months to 22 years old. Because of a lack of support to pursue high-school and college-level education, he started baking and selling pastry. His daily sales average 20,000 XAF.
Given the market's strong demand, granting the loan will allow him to strengthen his stock with two 50-kilo bags of flour, 50 kilos of sugar, a 25-liter jerrycan of cooking oil, 10 kilos of margarine, egg cartons, yeast and baking powder.
He plans on saving a lot of the profits to build a large size pastry shop. He is very dynamic and provides for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of flour, 10 kilos of margarine, a 25-liter jerrycan of cooking oil, 50 kilos of sugar and egg cartons.

loans.name: Marlene Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marlene, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad y tres de  16, 14 y 8 años, uno de los mayores estudian en Universidad, dos en colegio y el ultimo en escuela. El marido de dedica a la pesca. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace más de tres años y le gusta porque con los créditos le ayuda a su marido.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual además de dedicarse a la pesca también se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, el trabaja todos los días ya que dos días a la semana sale de pesca y los otros días se dedica a comprar pescado a pescadores de su zona para luego entregarlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta las playas a comprar el pescado para luego llevarlos a los mercados de Portoviejo y de  Manta. Lleva más de 20 años dedicado a esta profesión de comerciante y a la pesca desde mucho más tiempo.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado.

Sus sueños son tener un trabajo y así poder ganarse algo propio.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita in the Portoviejo canton, we find a place known Los Arenales. Every two week s the members of the Nueva Generación [New Generation] credit group meet. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.  

Here we meet Marlene. She is 44 years old and is in a common law marriage with five children. Two of them are adults and three are 16,14, and 8. One of the older ones is in college, two are in college, two in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been in She has been in the credit group for three years and she likes it because she helps her husband with the loans.  

She is taking out the loan for her husband's business. In addition to fishing, he also buys and sells fish. He works every day, since two days a week he goes fishing and the rest of the time he buys fish from area fishermen and delivers it to merchants who come to the beaches to buy fish and take it to the markets Portoviejo and Manta. He has been a merchant for more than 20 years and a fisherman for much longer. 

This loan is to buy fish.

Her dreams are to have a job and thus earn something of her own.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Francisco, está conformado por las señoras Angélica y Yolanda van a comprar con su préstamo puercos vivos para matarlo y vender la carne por kilo, la señora Graciela va a comprar ropa interior para dama y caballero, la señora Julia va a comprar catálogos y surtir sus primeros pedidos de zapatos. La señora Angélica tiene 36 años de edad ella es casada tiene tres hijas todas están estudiando una en la preparatoria y dos en la primaria, ella tiene su negocio de venta de tortas y refrescos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar puercos y vender carne de puerco, tortas y refrescos, ella inicio su negocio hace 8 días con un préstamo de su mama compro los insumos para elaborar las tortas, ella aprendió porque hace 20 años vendía tortas y ahora inicio otra vez el negocio, ella aprendió a elaborar las tortas cuando era soltera trabajaba en una torteria, su negocio es importante porque le genera ganancias, conoce a más personas, ella se siente orgullosa cuando sus clientes le dicen que están sabrosas las tortas, las ganancias una parte la utiliza volviendo a invertir y otra parte para ir ahorrando, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio vender taquitos de carnitas y lo piensa lograr con el préstamo. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por darnos la oportunidad de prestarnos y vamos a echarle ganas al negocio y no les vamos a fallar".
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called “San Francisco” and consists of the following women: • Sras. Angélica and Yolanda will use their loans to buy live pigs to slaughter and then sell the meat by the kilo. • Sra. Graciela will buy undergarments for women and men. • Sra. Julia will buy catalogs and inventory to fulfill her first orders for shoes.

Sra. Angélica is 36 years old, married, and has three daughters who are in school. One is attending a preparatory school and the other two are enrolled in elementary school. Angélica has a business selling sandwiches and soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to buy pigs so that she can sell pork, sandwiches, and soft drinks. Angélica started her business eight days ago with a loan from her mother and used the money to buy supplies for making sandwiches. She learned how to make and sell sandwiches 20 years ago and now she is restarting the business. Angélica learned how to make sandwiches when she was single and working at a sandwich shop. Her business is important because it generates income. She knows many people and is proud whenever her customers say that her sandwiches are delicious. Part of her earnings will be reinvested while the rest will go to savings. She plans to expand her business by selling pork taquitos and use the loan to achieve this goal.

The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “Thank you for giving us the opportunity to obtain loans. We plan to take our businesses forward and not fail.”

loans.use: to buy live pigs to sell as pork and for making sandwiches.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La señora Celia es madre soltera, que ve por el bienestar de su único hijo que ya es mayor de edad y estudia en otra ciudad una carrera universitaria. Como es sabido dar escuela a un hijo no es nada fácil ya que se llevan gastos y demasiados esfuerzos, sobre todo que Celia sea sola. Pero esto no le impide a la señora ofrecer a su hijo un mejor estudio para que se alguien en la vida y pueda tomar mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Celia hace años trabajo para un hospital de gobierno como asistente medico y por los años laborados fue jubilada de esta manera es como percibe ingresos para sostener los gastos. A Celia ahorita se le complica ya que entra el nuevo ciclo escolar lo cual necesita pagar las colegiaturas, comprar útiles escolares y estancia en el lugar donde vive su hijo.
texts.en:
Celia is a single mother, who looks out for the well-being of her only son. He is now an adult and is pursuing university studies in another city.  As we know, putting a child through school is not an easy thing, since this involves costs and and a lot of effort; especially since Celia is on her own.

But this is not preventing her from offering her son a better education so that he can be someone in life, and have better work opportunities.

Celia worked for years in a government hospital as a physician assistant, and for the years she worked, she was granted a retirement pension.  This is how she receives income to pay expenses.   Celia is having a difficult time right now, since the new school year is starting, which means she needs to pay tuition fees, buy school supplies and pay for her son's accommodation in the place where he is living.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Nelvy Brunel

texts.fr:
Cliente de 27 ans, marie et père d’un enfant de 3 ans. Quand il perd son père en classe de troisième, il arrête ses études par manque de moyens.
En 2002, il se lance dans la vente de la friperie. 
Sa stratégie est  d’acheter des ballots de fin de séries, des tenues a la mode ,  des pantalons et  culottes en jeans  qu’il trie et vend en détail au marche , ses ventes sont de 30.000 a 60.000 frs par jour et a l’intention de beaucoup épargner pour atteindre ses objectifs.
Avec l’expérience acquise, il a pour ambition d’ouvrir une boutique d’habits prêt a porter.
texts.en:
Nelvy Brunel, age 27, is married and the father of a three-year-old child. He lost his father when he was in 9th grade, and had to interrupt his studies due to a lack of financial means. In 2002, he started selling secondhand clothing. His strategy consists in buying bales of discontinued items, fashionable clothes, trousers and jeans, that he sorts and retails at the market.

His daily sales amount to XOF 30'000 to 60'000 (ca US$ 60 to 120) and he intends to save a lot to reach his goals. Thanks to experience he acquired, he intends to open a ready-to-wear store.

loans.use: to buy bales of secondhand clothing, jeans, skirts and trousers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese curd, cracklings, oil and condiments to make pupusas.

loans.name: Claudia Melissa

texts.es:
Claudia es una chica muy trabajadora, vive sola, es soltera y no tiene hijos, sus padres son muy pobres y por tanto ella se independizo a muy temprana edad para salir a adelante, actualmente vive en una cuarto pequeña en "anticretico" ( anticretico, es un tipo de prestamo o transacción, en el cual la persona que da en anticretico su casa, recibe un dinero que esta siendole prestado mientras el preste su casa, normalmente el que recibe el dinero lo usa para comercio o para invertir en otras cosas) 
Ahora bien, claudia esta ampliando el anticretico por que le estan brindando una habitacion extra para que pueda vivir mejor, con mas espacio. Para este motivo es que ella solicito un prestamo a nuestra institucion que es financiada por Kiva, a la vez ella esta muy agradecida a "Kiva" por este apoyo que le brindan.
Ella quiere seguir trabajando muy arduamente por que quiere ahorrar para comprarse un terrenito para hacer construir un dia su propia casa.
texts.en:
Claudia is a very hard-working girl.  She is single, lives alone, and does not have any children.  Her parents are very poor and so she started living independently at a very young age, in order to get ahead in life.  She currently lives in a small room 'en anticrético' ('anticrético' is a type of loan or transaction whereby the person who provides their house 'en anticrético' receives a sum of money which they are loaned while the other person is 'borrowing' their house.  Normally, the person who receives the money uses it for business or invests it in other things).  

Claudia is increasing her 'anticrético' because they are providing her with an extra room so that she can live more comfortably, with more space.  For this reason, she requested a loan from our institution, financed by Kiva.  She is very grateful to Kiva for the support that they are giving her.  She would like to continue working very hard because she would like to save up and buy a small plot of land so that some day she can build her own home.

loans.use: to increase her 'anticrético' agreement

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo es transportista, es casado el  y su esposa la señora Elena tienen cuatro pequeños hijos y viven en casa propia en la zona de Valle de las Flores que esta ubicada a treinta minutos del centro de la ciudad, el sr. Ricardo tiene dos movilidades vagonetas, él trabaja con una de ellas en transporte público y la otra la entrega a un chofer quien también trabaja en transporte pero le entrega al sr. Ricardo renta diaria. El sr. Ricardo trabaja como chofer desde hace veintisiete años, comenzó a trabajar como asalariado y actualmente ya tiene sus dos movilidades,  su esposa Elena vende verduras, pero por el momento solo esta realizando labores de casa ya que hace poco tuvo su cuarto hijo. El sr. Ricardo es una persona muy responsable y puntual ya que en el tiempo que trabaja con préstamos de emprender demostró buena actitud y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas, en esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo de dinero para la compra de llantas y una radio de comunicaciones para una de sus movilidades.
texts.en:
Señor Ricardo works in transportation. He is married, and he and his wife, Señora Elena, have four little children. They live in their own house in the Valle de las Flores district, which is located thirty minutes from the center of the city.

Señor Ricardo has two vehicles. He works with one of them in public transport, and he turns the other over to a driver who also works in transportation but who pays Señor Ricardo a daily rent. Señor Ricardo has worked as a driver for twenty-seven years. He began working as an employee, and now he already has two vehicles. His wife Elena sells vegetables, but for the moment she is doing only housework since she recently had her fourth child. 

Señor Ricardo is a very responsible and punctual person, since in the time that he has been working with loans from Emprender he has shown a good attitude and has been punctual with his payments. At this time he is applying for a loan to purchase tires and a communications radio for one of his vehicles.

loans.use: to buy tires and a communication radio.

loans.name: Tobokel's Group

texts.en:
Tobokel, 65, is a leader of this group. She is the proud mother of four grown children. Despite her age, Tobokel remains one of the most active, energetic and motivated farmers in the community of Tup village. 

In her lifetime, Tobokel has achieved many accomplishments, the most significant of which is building the largest household with land, generous for crops, and tens of heads of livestock. Tobokel, together with her husband and one of daughters, is currently gathering crops. She looks forward to selling the harvest at a good deal. Household chores and crop gathering make up her entire day. She is considered to be quite experienced in the financial management of her business, therefore, she  believes in repaying the loan on time, with no violations. The purpose of the loan is to buy livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 42 years old and married with 4 children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Jessica has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF.  She has run a sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns an income by retailing rice.

Jessica aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a 30-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for five years amidst challenges of price flactuation due to the current inflation in the country. His personal goal is educating his children and his business dream is a wholesale shop.

Peterson wants a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Jitegemee Shg Group

texts.en:
Amos is the facilitator of the Jitegemee SHG group. Amos and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Amos takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to have additional maize profits to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Amos had a very good maize yield, harvesting 5 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Amos was only able to harvest 1 ½ bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Amos and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Amos will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Jitegemee SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Amos is pictured with his group members, and the person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sobir

texts.ru: Собир кредитуется в организации уже четвёртый год. Ему 39 лет, он отец троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка и помогает Собиру ухаживать за скотом. Собир кроме откорма скота имеет свой ларёк по продаже говяжьего мяса. Убой скота он делает сам. Получаемых доходов вполне хватает на жизнь семьи, поэтому он благодарен нашей организации за предоставленную возможность ему расширить свой бизнес. За четыре года кредитования он на разу не нарушил условия погашения кредита, поэтому организация с полной уверенностью выдает ему очередной кредит.
texts.en: Sobir has been obtaining financing from our organization for the fourth year now.  He is 39 years old and is a father of three children.  His wife is a homemaker and helps Sobir with caring for livestock.  Besides fattening up livestock, Sobir has a retail stand, where he sells beef.  He himself butchers the livestock.  Received income is quite sufficient to support the family, and this is why he is grateful to our organization for the provided opportunity for him to expand his business.  Sobir has not once violated the loan repayment terms throughout the four years of financing, and this is why the organization provides him with this next loan with full assurance.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: El Progreso 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Santa is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, El Progreso (Progress) 4 & 5, and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Santa and her husband live in a batey with their four children. A batey is a small, rural community built by a sugar company to house their field workers. Santa has a successful business selling clothing to her community and others nearby. This is her sixth loan with Esperanza International, and she is planning to invest it by purchasing more merchandise and increasing her inventory for the Christmas sales. 

Santa has made one of her dreams come true: to sell her merchandise in other communities. Her business has been prosperous over the three years she has taken loans out from Esperanza. Santa's greatest challenge is to provide for her children so that they can start college after they finish the school year. Santa thanks you for lending!

loans.use: to buy clothing, such as jeans, blouses, T-shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.ru:
Максуде 69 лет, замужем, воспитала восьмерых детей. Максуда- пенсионерка и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода, Максуда начала свой бизнес  в животноводстве. Стартовав с начальной суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS), Максуда смогла развить свое хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в 10,000 сом (KGS). Также, семья Максуды занимается полеводством, выращивая на 2 га орошаемой земли картошку, кукурузу и люцерну, получая сезонный доход от продажи урожая .  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Максуда обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овцематок. Доходы Максуда планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем  - провести свадьбу младшего сына.
texts.en: Maksuda is 69 years old, married and raised eight children.  She is a retiree and started her animal husbandry business to provide a source of additional income.  Starting with an initial sum of 15,000 som (KGS), Maksuda was able to grow her business to yield a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS).  Also, Maksuda's family is involved in farming and grow potatoes, corn and alfalfa on two hectares of irrigated land; thus, earning a seasonal income from sales of the harvest.  In order to further develop her business, Maksuda requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase ewes.  She plans to invest the profits into a further increase of livestock headcount and,in the future, to hold a wedding for her youngest son.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 11 y 9 años de edad, todos estudian en escuela. Su esposo ebanista.

Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el cual tiene taller de ebanistería en su casa, allí el transforma la madera en bellísimas obras tales como muebles en todas las formas y modelos que quieran sus clientes,  puertas, camas, entre otras muchas cosas. El trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes que siempre lo visitan por la calidad de los productos que ellos entregan y en el dia indicado es por eso que su esposo tiene buena clientela y por lo cual nunca le ha faltado trabajo en los 15 años que tiene laborando.

Con este crédito va  comprar, clavos, pega, laca, madera y otras materias primas para elaborar sus obras. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque es muy fácil conseguir los créditos.
 
Con el anterior crédito que recibió de  parte de Kiva ella se lo dio al esposo, el cual compró madera y otros materiales. Gracias a Dios ha tenido bastante trabajo su marido en el taller y esto les ha dejado muy buenos ingresos. Con lo cual ha mejorado su estabilidad económica y familiar. En lo que se refiere a los pagos tuvo un atraso  y esto fue porque uno de sus hijos enfermo pero luego cancelo todo.

Su sueño darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora ("Our Lady of Help") communal bank meets in the Sequita parish in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí province. It is full of hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita's people are honest and know only how to work and dedicate themselves to their families.

In this place we meet Gloria, 30 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has three children aged 9, 11, and 13, all students. Her husband is a cabinetmaker.

She is taking out the loan to help her husband, who has a cabinetmaking workshop in his house. There he transforms wood into beautiful works such as every kind of furniture his customers want, doors, and beds, among many other things. He works based on orders from his customers, who always come to him due to the quality of the products he delivers to them on the day he promised. This is why her husband has a good clientele, and why he has never lacked for work in the 15 years he has been working.

With this loan they are going to buy nails, glue, shellac, wood, and other raw materials to make his products. This is Gloria's third cycle in the communal bank, and she likes it because it is very easy to get the loans. 

She gave the previous loan she received from Kiva to her husband, and with it he bought wood and other materials. Thanks to God, her husband has had plenty of work in the shop, and this has given them a very good income. With it, they have improved their economic and family stability. Regarding repayments, she was once late because one of her children was sick, but then she paid off everything.

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase nails, glue, shellac, wood, etc.

loans.name: Honoria

texts.es:
