La  señora Honoria es una señora amable y agradecida con la vida, se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace tres años.
Es madre soltera tienen hijo por quien trabaja día con día para darle una  mejor educación y se lo agradezca en día de mañana.
Tambien se dedica a lavar ropa y playar.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compara de: royal, harina, huevos, manteca y mantequilla.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla día a día  para que pueda seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Honoria is a kind woman who is grateful for life.  She has been selling bread for three years.
She is a single mother that has a son for whom she works day and night to give him a better education and she is thankful for him in the future.
She also washes clothing.
She asked for the loan to buy: baking powder, flour, eggs, lard, and butter.
She gives thanks to the foundation for helping her day after day so that she can continue with her business.

loans.use: get supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN VI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zagnanabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SALI deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115.000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Lake Side Women's Group

texts.en:
The group is located in the outskirts of Kampala near the shores of Lake Victoria. 

Usually people that live along lake shores are faced with poverty and poor sanitation and generally are at risk of catching several diseases. However, Mohammed, in conjunction with the local area leader, mobilised and sensitized the residents, so that with the help of loans from UGAFODE, those challenges can be overcome.

With the loan, Mohammed believes he will be able to buy fresh fish directly from the fishermen.  This will save him the cost of buying from third parties who inflate the prices. This will boost his income, and he will be able to provide enough food for his family and send his four children to better schools, as well as meet the other needs of his family comfortably. (Mohamed is pictured at the back in front of the door)

He feels a great achievement, having mobilised his community members a step away from poverty.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a resident of Militar,Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, is married,with five children.

She operates a retail business where she sells coffee,seasoning mix,soap,and other items. She is in this business for
six years.She have many competitors but she is confident to have more sales. 

She plan to improve her family living condition by selling more items, hence she availed another loan to purchase more items for her business after she had already  fully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her business

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan request submitted by the twenty-five members of the women’s tontine Waag Baax, represented by Aïssatou N..  The Waag Baax group has long managed a communal microenterprise specializing in the crafting and sale of the batiks and other vibrant hand-dyed cloth for which Senegal is well known.  Aïssatou and her associates have a loyal clientele base as well as considerable money management and sales experience.  The loan will be used for the expansion of their dying business, including investments in the purchase of materials (cloth, dyes), equipments (larger pots and vats, gloves) and transportation of the finished goods to market. 

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group.  Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines.  Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities.  Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members.  However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income.  This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities.  Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Expansion of cloth-dying business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ester would like to buy a high-grade dairy cow

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa is a 56-year-old working mother who grows nonu (Indian mulberry) for a living. She sells the fruit to local merchants, who dry it and make juice out of it. Nonu is used in health cures and the treatment of numerous illnesses. Her earnings help her put her two youngest children through school.

loans.use: Purchase of string and fertilizer and salaries for laborers

loans.name: Dau Thi

texts.en: Mrs. V. is 35, and she has 3 children aged 9 to 14. Her husband is a fisherman and, together with 8 other men, is usually out to sea for 8-10 days. Since income from fishing is unstable, V. opened a small store in her house to sell foodstuffs and cosmetics. She will use the loan to buy more goods. Last year she was elected a TYM Center Leader.

loans.use: buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Mr. Silvestre Caceres is 34 years old, single and the owner of a small butcher shop and grocery store. Due to financial circumstances, he was unable to pursue a college degree, but he made a decision to move forward with his life regardless of the circumstances. He started out with a small stand where he sold fast foods, such as hamburgers, hot dogs, empanadas (meat-filled turnovers) and soft drinks. With much sacrifice, he was able to buy a lot and build a modest house where, after a few years, he opened a small butcher shop and grocery store.

Today he has many clients who buy from him because of his good service and low prices. Silvestre would like to continue to expand his business, where he sells, among other things, sweets, candy, meats, dairy products, vegetables and soft drinks. He is requesting this loan to purchase items like rice, sugar, coffee, flour and canned goods at wholesale prices, which will allow him to generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Silvestre C. tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y es propietario de un negocio dedicado al rubro de la carnicería y despensa. Por cuestiones económicas no pudo seguir una carrera universitaria, pero a pesar de ello el decidió seguir adelante. Empezó con un pequeño kiosco donde vendía diferentes tipos de comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, panchos (hot dogs), empanadas y gaseosas. Con mucho sacrificio compro un terreno y edifico su casa, y luego de varios años pudo abrir en su casa su propia despensa y carnicería.

Hoy día cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes, por el buen servicio, y precios bajos. Silvestre desea seguir creciendo. Entre los productos que vende podemos citar, golosinas, carne, lácteos, verduras, gaseosas, etc. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mercaderías al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, café, harina y productos enlatados, pues de esta forma conseguirá mejores descuentos que lo ayudará a aumentar su ganancia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, such as rice, sugar, coffee, flour and canned goods, at wholesale prices

loans.name: Viviana Marcela

texts.es:
Viviana is a loving wife and mother of five children. She has learnt to give the best of herself in her daily tasks for her family´s well being. Despite a paralysis which affected her for fifteen days which left her inmovilized in bed, she is fighting back. Luck is seemingly not on her side though, as her husband has been diagnosed with a hernia which is incompatible with his work on the family plot of land. He is in a lot of pain which sometimes forces him to rest in bed for days at a time.

Viviana and her children have taken on agricultural tasks which her husband can´t do at this time. She has looked at the projected harvest and has decided to increase the surface planted to create more produce and obtain greater benefits, so her husband can have an operation to remedy his illness.

Let´s help this mother of five children purchase more seeds with the hope that she and her children can increase the harvest to help them get through this situation.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

Viviana es una amorosa esposa y madre de cinco hijos, aprendió a dar todo de sí en su diaria labor y a su familia lo mejor que tiene y puede dar a pesar de los duros momentos que tuvo que afrontar a raíz una parálisis que le afectó por más de quince días y la dejó postrada en cama sin poder movilizarse.Sin embargo para ella no termina esta pena con su recuperación; su esposo hace poco empezó a tener dolores muy fuertes y cuando acudió al nosocomio de su localidad le detectaron una hernia que no le permite realizar más sus labores agrícolas y hay momentos que el dolor se agudiza y lo conduce a la cama por largos días..Sin embargo observando estos hechos los hijos de Viviana decidieron aunarse a las labores que realiza su querida madre con el propósito de procurarle bienestar y menos preocupación a su enfermo padre, los apuros económicos por los que están atravesando no han disminuido sus esperanzas ni fuerzas para seguir soñando con un futuro mejor. Es por ello que luego de analizar su situación y realizar la proyección anual de su cosecha ha decido incrementar la siembra de sus productos con el objetivo de operar en corto tiempo a su querido compañero con las ganancias que obtenga de la comercialización de su siembra.Hagamos posible que esta madre incremente su siembra y las esperanzas de sus pequeños hijos que han decidido acompañarla durante esta larga travesía.

loans.use: Seed purchase to optimize the harvest

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
Mr. Milciades B. works in the fabrication of women’s intimate apparel along with his wife. They have been working in this field for more than 14 years.

They began with a family sewing machine, but currently they have three industrial sewing machines. They make more than two hundred items per week which they distribute in the capital. They are suppliers for different stores in various cities, and their business is going very well.

Milciades wants a loan in order to purchase raw materials like fabric, thread, bra straps, etc. in order to continue producing in large quantities since demand is increasing positively.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Milciades B. trabaja en la fabricación de ropas interiores para dama con su esposa hace ya más de 14 años.

Ellos comenzaron con una máquina de coser familiar, actualmente tienen tres máquinas de coser industriales y fabrican más de doscientas prendas por semana que distribuyen en la capital. Ellos son proveedores de diferentes tiendas en varias ciudades, y les va muy bien con el negocio.

El señor Milciades desea el préstamo para poder adquirir materia prima como telas, hilos, breteles, etc. para seguir produciendo en grandes cantidades ya que la demanda crece positivamente.

loans.use: Purchase raw material like fabric, thread, bra straps, etc.

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en: Tolibjon N. lives in B.Gafurov rayon; he is married and has 2 children. Tolibjon N. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and recommends himself as a serious and highly motivated client. Loan sums are permanently increased to those who show business stability and an income increase. He is a mechanical engineer and tractor driver. Mr.N. has a wide business including livestock raising and selling and milk production. He wants to purchase a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and dairy goods production (to supply to bazaars). It is planned to include to the assortment the following milk products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curds, etc. Now Mr.N. requires a loan of 1,800 TJS (US$525) for a horn pedigree bull and pedigree milk cow purchase, which will allow him to increase significantly the family income and further business development.

loans.use: horn pedigree bull and pedigree milk cow purchase

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Caroline E.. She is married with four children, ages 1, 5, 8, and 10. In 2007 Caroline established a business selling fish and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru:
Abdujalil K. Abdumurodovich lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 36, married and has 4 children. He has a High School education. He is a farmer. He owns a piece of land which he uses to grow wheat. When the wheat is ready, he grinds it into flower. Abdujalil keeps a portion of the obtained flower for his family and sells the rest on the market. This business provides for the family financially for the entire year and supplies affordable flower to the local markets. Abdujalil plans to use the money from the loan to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer. He has been in this business for the past 5 years.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Курбонов Абдуджалил Абдумуродович проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 36 лет. Женат имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается землиделием. Имеет участок земли, который засеивает под пшеницу. После получения урожая перемалывает пшеницу в муку. Часть оставляет своей семье ,а часть выносит на рынки. Этот бизнес дает годовой доход его семье, а так же обеспечивает рынки продуктом первой необходимости- мукой, по доступным ценам.Планирует получить кредит для покупки семян и удобрений. Занимается этим видом бизнеса около 5 лет.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, a young entrepreneur of 25 years old, lives in Waspan North with her husband whom she married at a young age, her husband took her from her parents when he was 21 and she was only 13. They have 2 children, one is 12 and the other is 5, this has made her mature fast because she is in charge of her husband and her new family, 10 years ago her mother left her the business that consisted of a small neighborhood store. With her husband, they are able to maintain this store and it grows bit by bit. Since her husband works as a typographer in a printing company they have plans to start their own printing business and to grow the store. She requests a loan to invest in her small business and to purchase grains and hygiene products.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth, joven emprendedora de 25 años de edad, vive en Waspan Norte junto a su esposo con quien se caso a muy temprana edad, su esposo se la robo a sus padre a los 21 años de edad y ella tenia apenas 13 años. Procrearon 2 hijos uno que hoy tiene 12 años y el menor de 5 años de edad, esto llevó a la joven a madurar de manera rápida ya que debía hacerse cargo junto a su esposo de su nueva familia, hace 10 años su madre le dejó su negocio que consistía en una pequeña pulpería en vista que se fue a trabajar fuera del país. Junto a su esposo lograron mantener esa pulpería y hacerla crecer poco a poco. Siendo que su esposo trabaja como Tipógrafo en una Imprenta tienen planes de montar su propia Imprenta y hacer crecer mas la pulpería. Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio de perecederos y compras granos básicos y productos de higiene para surtir la venta.

loans.use: To purchase products and grains.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula se dedica la venta de cosméticos, empezó hace 2 años ayudando a una amiga después Ella compro los catálogos y empezó a vender por su cuenta entre familiares y vecinos. Emprendió esta actividad ya que necesitaba de un ingreso extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo Esther saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Evdokiya

texts.en:
Evdokiya is a small business owner from Melitopol, Ukraine. A widow, she lives with her daughter and granddaughter. Evdokiya sells women’s clothing from a little kiosk at the busy central market in Melitopol. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having been in business for about 15 years. Her typical monthly income is around $400.

Evdokiya has requested a loan of 4000 Ukrainian Griven to purchase a supply of summer clothing to sell in her kiosk. She has been a client with HOPE Intl-Nadiya Ukraine since 2002 and has developed a reputation as a responsible borrower. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with operating a successful business.

loans.use: Purchase summer clothing inventory

loans.name: Zenaido

texts.es:
Zenaido is married and has two children, one that is 20 years old and one that is 10 years old. His wife is a housewife. He began his business to pay the expenses of the house, as well as the hospital and medical expenses from a car accident that his son had, and to pay for the repairs to the car. So that he would not get off track with the expenses of the house, he decided to get extra income to help and that is how, 8 years ago, he began his grocery store and moved himself forward.

He is asking for a loan of US$975 that he will pay in 6 months in order to buy merchandise and offer better service to his clients. With your help, you will contribute to the growth of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Zenaido es casado y tiene 2 hijos de de 20 y 10años, su esposa es ama de casa. Inicio su negocio para solventar los gastos de su casa ademas de los gastos hospitalarios y atencion medica de un accidente automovilistico que tuvo su hijo y para pagar las reparaciones del carro ,sin desbalancearse con los gastos de casa, decidio conseguir un ingreso extra para ayudarse y fue asi como, hace 8 años inicio su tienda de abarrotes y poco ha salido adelante.

El solicita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo contribuiras al crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Please Delete Group

texts.en:
Veronica Kasaba is 32 and a mother of one.  Her son is nine years old.  She operates a cooking stand while her husband works in the city.  She has operated this stand since 2003, working weekdays and Saturdays from 6am to 8pm.  Veronica earns a monthly income of 100USD.  

With a loan from Kiva, Veronica hopes to increase her capital in order to purchase more inventory.  She would thereby be able to serve more people and earn a higher income.  She has taken three loans out from Tujijenge previously, and successfully paid back all of them.

Veronica is the group leader of the Basara group.  There are 19 other members in the group.  Each member guarantees the others, thereby ensuring the repayment of the entire loan in full.

loans.use: Increase inventory and capital to help expand.

loans.name: Princesa Juana

texts.es:
Princesa Juana was born in the region of Ccollipuyo in the District of Ilave. She is 34 years old and married with five kids. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school. She lives in the community of Pusuyo District of Ilave for five years now, because her husband is from here.

She is a member of the Community Bank Gregoria Apaza, community of Pusuyo, District of Ilave, Province of Collao - Puno. With her first loan of 300 Soles, she bought four little sheep and four laying hens. She has always been dedicated to raising cattle and sheep livestock.

Thanks to the training and education that she received a year and a half ago through the Community Bank, in which she learned to make embroideries in fabrics (craft work), she is now dedicated to raising cattle and making embroideries.

With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in four payments, she will buy one bull to fatten up with 1300 Soles and more cloth and wool for embroidering with the other 200 Soles.

Her greatest longing is to construct her home in the city of Ilave, because she already bought her lot, so that her kids can study better and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Princesa Juana nació en la parcialidad de Ccollipuyo, Distrito de Ilave , tiene 34 años de edad, casada tiene 5 hijos , estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria, vive en la comunidad de Pusuyo Distrito de Ilave hace quince años, porque su esposo es de dicho lugar .

Es socia del Banco Comunal Gregoria Apaza, comunidad de Pusuyo , Distrito de Ilave, Provincia del Collao - Puno , con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró 04 ovejas pequeñas, 04 gallinas ponedoras, ella siempre se dedicó al engorde de ganado vacuno y ovino.

Gracias a la capacitación que recibió hace un año y medio a través del Banco Comunal en donde aprendió hacer bordados en bayeta ( artesanía ), ahora se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno y bordados.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles lo cual pagará en cuatro cuotas, comprará 01 toro para engorde con S/. 1,300.00 y con S/. 200.00 Nuevos Soles comprará más bayeta y lana para bordados.

Su mayor anhelo es construir su casa en la ciudad de Ilave porque ya compró su lote, para que sus hijos puedan estudiar mejor y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy one bull. Buy cloth and wool.

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: Reyna habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe de la ciudad de Managua, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos que están estudiando, asisten a la escuela por la tarde, y por la mañana ayudan a su mama a cuidar los cultivos.  Su esposo  trabaja en servicios de seguridad y siempre está pendiente que a su familia no le falte nada. Doña Reyna trabaja en la agricultura y también es comerciante, tiene quince años de estar trabajando las tierras, ya que ha sido una de las principales fuentes de ingreso para mantener a su familia. Conoce mucho de hortalizas por que sus padres también se dedicaban a esta actividad. El préstamo solicitado es para mantenimiento del cultivo, comprará abonos orgánicos y así poder obtener una cosecha de muy buena calidad. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos puedan heredar el mismo gusto por las tierras que ella tiene, y así puedan seguir con esta actividad de cultivos de hortalizas.
texts.en:
Reyna lives in the town of Ticuantepe in the city of Managua. She is married and has four children who are studying. They attend school in the afternoon and in the the morning they help their mom care for the crops. Her husband works in security services and is always working so that his family does not lack anything. Doña Reyna works in agriculture and also is a trader, and she has been working the land for fifteen years and it has been one of her main sources of income for raising her family. She knows the crops very well because her parents were also dedicated to this activity. The requested loan is for maintenance of the crops; she will buy organic manure fertilizer and this way be able to attain a harvest of very high quality. Her biggest dream is that her children can inherit the same love for the land that she has and continue this activity of cultivating vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy organic manure fertilizers

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, a sus 22 años, es un padre de una hermosa niña, el y su esposa se dedican a veces a la compra y venta de ropa y en otras veces a la agricultura.  Realiza diversas  actividades, para generarse ingresos económicos adicionales a los de su chacra, en temporada de siembra cultiva café, plátano, etc., esta vez ha sembrado caigua, con la finalidad de cosechar en temporada de verano, donde tendrá buen precio. Y a veces aprovecha de llevar algunas prendas para vender a las personas cercanas a sus tierras. 
La dificultad ahora, son los precios de los abonos, pero a pesar de todo le gusta sembrar, cultivar todo tipo de productos, conoce en qué temporadas se debe sembrar para sacar provecho del precio en el mercado.  Luis por el momento vive en la casa de su suegra, por ello es que trabaja con mucho esmero para adquirir su propio hogar, y más adelante adquirir su propia movilidad para que lleve al mercado lo que produce.  El invertirá en siembra de caigua, después de 5 meses recuperará su capital y pueda ganar el doble, en enero cosechará y venderá hasta febrero, temporada de buen predio de este producto.
texts.en:
Luis, at 22 years old, is a father of a beautiful daughter. He and his wife make a living buying and selling clothes at times and by farming at other timers. They take part in various activities to generate extra income for their small household, and during the planting season they cultivate coffee, bananas and other products. Currently Luis has planted a regional vegetable called caigua with the goal of harvesting it when it can fetch a good price. Sometimes he takes some clothes to sell to the people in the areas surrounding his lands. The difficulty now, however, is that the price of fertilizer is high, but he still enjoys planting and harvesting all kinds of products, and he knows what season to plant which product to make the most of it in the market. At the moment Luis lives in the house of his mother-in-law, so he works arduously so he can acquire his own place and later his own vehicle so he can transport his products. With the loan, he will invest in cultivating caigua, and in five months he can double his return. He will harvest it in January and will sell it through February, the ideal time to sell this product.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in cultivating caigua, a regional plant that will fetch good prices at the market.

loans.name: Sokhum's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhum C. is a group leader of four who are all living in Khnong village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectar plot of land where she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Srey Vin, is a pig breeder. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it and he is asking  for a loan to buy one more pig for  breeding. Mrs. Sokhum C. is 43 years old and the mother of six children. Two of her children are construction workers while the remaining four are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy one more pig for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophan C. lives in Kork village in Kampong Chhnang province.  She is a vegetable seller in the local market.  Her husband, Mr. Sor Chhean, is a rice middleman. 

Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it.  Thus, Mrs. Sophan C. decided to request a loan to buy more rice to re-sell.  She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. 

She is 49 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another has emigrated to work in Malaysia, and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more rice to re-sell.

loans.name: Anixa

texts.es: Anixa tiene 30 años, es madre de 2 hijos y otro que viene en camino, vive junto a su conviviente quien la apoya en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace 3 años y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer mucha gente y dar un trato amable al momento de atenderlos. Además le es rentable porque gracias a este negocio y a su carisma cuenta con una gran clientela que la aprecia mucho. Lo más difícil es no contar con un local adecuado para la venta de sus productos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado tiene el propósito de ampliar y construir un kiosco para su negocio, además de comprar más productos para surtirlo adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Anixa, 30, is the mother of 2 children with another on the way. She lives with her parter who completely supports her work. She has operated a business selling groceries and everyday items for 3 years. The things that she likes best about the work are meeting lots of people and providing fast and friendly service to her customers. She makes money thanks to the business and her own charisma which draws in an appreciative base of customers. The difficult thing for her is not having a shop from which to sell her products. This is Anixa's second MFP loan. With this loan, she will expand and build a kiosk for the business. She'll also buy more products to better stock the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosk for grocery business.

loans.name: Sofia Nawula  ‘S Group

texts.en: Sofia is the leader of her 5 member loan group. She is a 34 years old and married with 3 young children. All of her children go to school. She resides and rents a two room house which she shares with six people. They have electricity and no piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day and has tea. She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works in Makerere at the Kikoni market near Kampala city. Sofia works seven days a week. Sofia sells to an average of 25 customers a day and sells to many people in retail and sells whatever is available for resale. Sofia has been in this business for two years. Sofia's monthly expenses include rent for accommodations and also daily market dues. She wants to buy more vegetables for resale purposes.

loans.use: to buy more Vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Boun

texts.en: E., 42, is living in a medium-sized stone house in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She is a homemaker and she cooks delicious meals and cares for the children. She now has two children and is married to Saret, 47, who works as a staff member for an association and currently gets a salary of $200 per month. The family's living conditions are not so comfortable due to their house lacking furniture; therefore, E. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase furniture to decorate their house.

loans.use: To purchase furniture to decorate their house

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
La señora Bacilia A. C., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con 5 hijos, posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años e inició su negocio de comercialización de abarrotes al por mayor y menor con un préstamo inicial de 300 soles, que invirtió para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo en su negocio en el distrito de Desaguadero. 
En el momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para poder aumentar su capital, invirtiendo en comprar 5 quintales de azúcar, arroz y otros para su negocio, con el compromiso firme de cumplir con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bacilia A. C. belongs to the "El Comercio" communal bank in the district of Desaguadero, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is 43 years old, married with five children, and has completed her primary studies. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for four years. She began her retail and wholesale grocery selling business with an initial loan of 300 soles, which she invested in working capital for her business in the district of Desaguadero. Now she needs a loan of 3,000 soles to increase her capital, purchasing five quintals of sugar, rice and other goods for her business, with a firm commitment to complete her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase five quintals of sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is 37 years old. She is divorced and has one child. She lives in Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells wheat and rice porridge in the streets of the community in which she lives.

Rice and wheat porridge are enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. She boils the porridge in a big pot and sells it by hawking (selling door-to-door). She has been in this business for four years with no regrets. She said it is far better than being idle and begging for bread.

Through her hard work, demand for her food has increased, making it difficult to meet the demand. She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients, such as wheat, rice, sugar, and milk, so that she can prepare more porridge to meet the daily demands of her customers.

Her picture was taken while she was selling. She would appreciate your support. She belongs to the village bank called "Yesu Abusua Kuo," which means "God’s Family."

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, wheat, sugar and charcoal etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 45 years old and is divorced without a child. She has sold bags of groundnuts for a long time. She is requesting for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more bags of groundnuts to sell. Ruth is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en:
M. Zarif is a farmhand. He learned to grow different kinds of vegetables from his parents. Now that Zarif has his own family, he works his hardest to increase his yield to support the needs of his children well. Zarif is 30 years old and has 2 children. He wants to send them to school. His harvest is what he depends on for the future of his family. Almost all of it is saved for family consumption, while the remainder is sold in the market by his wife. Zarif is requesting a loan of $800 US. He will use the loan to buy the necessary fertilizers and seeds for his crop. His loan will truly give Zarif an increased yield. In this way, he will have more to give to his family. Be an important part of the wellbeing of this humble family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the outer reaches of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: The purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Aerkinjin

texts.ru: Турсунов Эркинжин-молодой человек 26-ти лет,женат, детей пока не имеет. Эркинжон- старший сын в семье и поэтому, чтобы помочь своим родителям решил заняться откормом и купля-продажей скота.Он имеет опыт в сфере животновдства, так  как помогал своему отцу откармливать крупно-рогатый скот. На полученный кредит он расчитывает купить дойную корову, чтобы иметь дополнительный доход для своей семьи.Кроме того он работает колхозником в колхозе «Гулистон».
texts.en:
Aerkinjin T. is a young 26-year old man, who is married and does not yet have children. Because he is the oldest son in his family, he decided to become involved in livestock feeding and sales to help his parents. Aerkinjin has experience in the animal husbandry field because he used to help his father feed cattle. Besides this business, he works as a farmer at the Guliston collective farm. Aerkinjin plans to use this loan to purchase a dairy cow in order to have additional income for his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Than

texts.en: M. Than, 29, runs a grocery store in her village. She makes a daily profit of $1 per day. She lives with her husband and her three children who are all school aged. Her husband, 28, buys cows at the nearby villages and resells them for a small profitable price. Hence, she has made a decision to take a loan of $800 from KIVA to expand her husband’s business by buying more cows to resell. If she succeeds in her business plan, she will be able to afford for all of her children to study at a university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to sell.

loans.name: Janjol

texts.en:
R. Janjol is a successful father and dedicated husband. He is married and has 7 children. Janjol has a good reputation. He is a very good family man so he loves his family and wants a good future for them. Janjol began a small grocery store 11 years ago with his savings. He was assisted by his son (pictured) who helps him with serving his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Janjol is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.        

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Parveen Amanat Group

texts.en:
For the past 15 years Parveen baji, the wife of A., has resided in Borewala, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. For over three years her husband has delivered a variety of items including fruits and vegetables on his cart, his charges set according to destination. Parveen baji is a very caring lady, arising very early each day with her husband to prepare a breakfast for him. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart for her husband because the old cart has become rough and rotted.

This loan consists of two additional people: Jamila baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Riffat baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell.

The funds for this group loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Parveen baji is seated in the middle in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita N. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Conchita is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Conchita owns a business making and and selling specialty food called binangkal in the local community. Conchita has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items for sale. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items for sale

loans.name: Dela Cruz

texts.en:
Dela Cruz S. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Dela Cruz is separated from her spouse and has 4 adult children. To make a living Dela Cruz makes and sells specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dela Cruz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dela Cruz is requesting her first loan which she will use to purchase raw ingredients she needs to make her products. Dela Cruz plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Looking Town #1 Group

texts.en:
Looking Town #1 is a group of 5 borrowers led by Famata K.. They live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia. 

Fatama is 35 years old and single, and she has 3 children, ages 10-20. All of her children are in school. Famata was unable to attend school, although she enjoyed it, because the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Famata’s sells clothing, including slippers, shirts, pants, and underwear that she buys wholesale in nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for 3 years and is successful because of her people skills. She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory of clothing, which sell well in the rainy season. Her dream is to expand her business so that, one day, she can have the biggest table in the central market and ultimately her own permanent shop. With the profits from her business, Famata dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: Purchase slippers, shirts, pants, and underwear

loans.name: Living Waters Group

texts.en: Abena is fifty – nine years old. She is widowed and has seven children. She lives with her some of her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Abena is a trader. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Living Waters. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To bu y stock

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthea Ork Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people who are all living in Niel village, Takeo province, make up the village bank loan. Mrs. Chanthea O. is a village bank president; she has been selected the members. They all will use the loan in different ways. She sells frogs and fish in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Rin Theara, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Now Mrs. Chanthea O. is asking for a loan to buy piglets, pig food, and fertilizer to support the rice field. She is 24 years old and the mother of a child who is too yoU. to wO. or study. 

Six members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy piglet, pig food, and fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix G. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 57 years old. Felix is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Felix sells fish that he raises in a fishpond.  Felix has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Felix joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Felix is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional equipment and feed. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Felix from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for materials & labor to put up a fence around her house

loans.name: Kuñakuera Katupyry Group

texts.en:
This Women's Entrepreneurial Committee uses their loans to purchase clothing, beverages, meats, sausages, breads, herb, oil, sweets, vegetables, fruits, ingredients for pastries and baked goods, confectionery, dairy, haberdashery, sewing items, yarns, fabrics, scissors, vegetables, fruit, cleaning supplies, etc.

Maria Elizabeth M. sells milk, investing her loan to buy better feed for her cows, so she can have higher quality and more milk and offer more to her customers. 

Hilaria D. has a pantry, and has invested her loan in the purchase of general merchandise such as sugar, herbs, milk, beverages, etc. so that she can offer good variety of merchandise to her customers. 

Maria M. S. sells clothes and is investing her loan to buy a greater variety to satisfy the demands of her customers. 

Francisca Teresa A. is dedicated to the sale of beverages, investing her loan to buy  drinks in bulk, to be able to offer a variety of cold drinks to her customers. 

Gilda B. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus. 

Silvia Ramon O. has a pantry, so invests her loan to purchase more merchandise to have greater variety to goods to sell.

Birin A. D. R. sells milk, investing her loan to buy better feed for her cows, so she can have higher quality and more milk and offer more to her customers. 

Isidora M. M. sells ice cream, and is using her loan to invest to buy more ice cream and other products such as beverages and candy to sell along siD.. 

Antonia G. R. has a pantry, so invests her loan to purchase more merchandise to have greater variety to goods to sell.

Mirna C. D. C. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus. 

Rosa Estela F. sells vegetables, investing her loan to buy vegetables wholesale to make a greater profit. 

Graciela F. Concepcion sells clothing, investing her loan to buy a greater variety for different seasons to satisfy the demands of her customers. 

B. C. Carolina sells clothing, investing her loan to buy a greater variety for different seasons to satisfy the demands of her customers. 

Marilena Espinola D. F. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus.  

Denise Maciel Barreto sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus.  

Monica R. sells food, investing her loan in buying ingredients to offer her patrons a better variety of food and more diverse menus.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to resell

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
T. Maruf is 47 years old and married, with three children between the ages of 22 and 14. Maruf manufactures, by order, carved wooden doors, window frames and partitions in the national oriental style. He has been in this business for twenty years. During that time, Maruf became a real expert in his business and has a lot of clients. Because of this, his business is very successful and brings in a stable and significant income, allowing Maruf to improve the living conditions of his family. Now Maruf has a large order for window frames and doors, so he is requesting $1500 to purchase the wood products and materials he needs for his manufacturing. Maruf is counting on your help, and he expresses his gratitude to everyone for supporting him.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase materials and wood products for manufacturing window frames and doors.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.fr:
Mme. Fatma S. sollicite son premier crédit pour investir dans son activité principale: le commerce de tissus et crèmes.  Elle a épousé le métier du commerce par le biais de sa soeur qui l'a élevée.  Elle vendait à Sandaga (le grand marché de Dakar) et puis à Gorée (un autre marché de Dakar).  Mme. S. explique qu'elle aime surtout l'indépendance financière dans le secteur.  
Elle est divorcée et mère de deux enfants, âgés de 9 et 12 ans.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatma S. is requesting her first loan to invest in her business: sales of fabric and creams. She started out in her business following her sister's occupation because she was raised by her. She sells in Sandaga (the large market in Dakar) and in Goree (another market in Dakar). Mrs. S. indicates that she loves being financially independent.

She is divorced and she is the mother of two children, aged 9 and 12 years old.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase textile fabrics and creams.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
La Sra. Arminda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Breo”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 63 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.
Arminda, se dedica a la venta D. panes y dulces,  lleva 08 años ejerciendo este tipo D. actividad, se encuentra ubicada en su propia casa en un lugar muy bien acondicionado.  
Arminda, como le dicen D. cariño, poco a poco, fue ahorrando y haciéndose muy conocida por sus clientes, que hoy en día son clientes fijos en su puesto. 
Actualmente, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa, por el trabajo que realiza, su esposo le ayuda repartiendo los panes a los clientes, moradores y amigos.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, comprará ingredientes e insumos como: harina, azúcar, manteca,  sal y saborizantes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. una nueva vitrina, para exhibir sus productos.
Arminda, agradece bastante, al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional y a otras mujeres como ella, que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Arminda belongs to the community bank "El Breo" in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the department of San Martín. She is married, 63 years old, and is the mother of three children who still depend on her.

Arminda sells breads and sweets. She has been in this business for 8 years and works from a well set-up location in her own house.

Arminda, as she is affectionately called, was saving money little by little and making herself very well know to her customers, so that today she has customers who are very loyal to her.

Currently, she is continuing with this same business and is very proud of her work. Her husband helps her deliver the bread to her customers, residents, and friends.

With this loan of 2,000 soles ($725), she will buy ingredients and supplies such as: flour, sugar, butter, salt and flavorings. She will also invest part of the money in buying a new counter to display her goods.

Arminda is thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the unconditional support they give to her and to other women like her who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread-making supplies

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
In 2001, Raul D., 46, started to sell goods in his village. He has a sari-sari (variety) store. Aside from selling goods, he also a small poultry operation and a small piggery. He is married and has two children. His eldest child is 8 years old and currently an elementary pupil. 

He would like to grow his business. He hopes to receive a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos with Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. He will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell.

loans.use: To obtain additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Khoja Abdul Matin Group

texts.en:
This is the two-member K. Abdul Matin group, led by 43-year-old Nadeya, the mother of six children, all attending school. She wants to take a loan for her tailoring business in order to buy necessary resources.

K. Abdul Matin, a hard-working man who aspires to a comfortable life and educated children, is seeking a loan for his metal shop.

They have requested a group loan of of 20,000 Afghani with which they can expand their businesses and better support their families and make a better future for themselves.

loans.use: To buy new machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Rayda es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Rayda vende cosméticos por catalogo que ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito. Además Rayada vende otros productos por campaña.
Rayda necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos.
El sueño de Rayda es tener una empresa de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Rayda is a member of the communal bank "Kuskanchik" which means "All Together" in Quechua. Rayda is married, 35 years old, and has four children. Rayda sells cosmetics by catalog to her family and friends. Most of her sales are on credit. Rayada also sells other products by campaign. Rayda needs a loan of 600 soles to invest in the purchase of notebooks. Rayda's dream is to have a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy notebooks.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
T. Nickson, 65 years old and married, is a farmer based in Nyabitete, Rukungiri. He is married with four school-going children.

Nickson has a long track record in the agriculture business, spanning a period of over fifteen years. In this period, he says lots of challenges and pitfalls have crossed his way. For example, he says the lack of funds to pay laborers and to buy good quality manure has been a constant problem. However, he believes that with the loan, some of these problems will be history. 

With persistence and hard work, Nickson’s business has seen the light of day to up to now. He is hoping to improve on his only dependable source of livelihood with this loan. With it, he will be able to mulch his plantations and provide more manure for them.

loans.use: To mulch and buy more manure for his plantations

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma E. is from the village of Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Gemma owns and operates a business providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Gemma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, es casada y madre de 6 hijos, de las cuales viven con su última hija y su esposo en su casa propia. La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de potajes típicos de la selva, cerca al mercado de su distrito. Ella tiene varios clientes fijos, quienes la esperan los fines de semana para deleitar la exquisitez de sus tacachos (plátano frito con carne de cerdo), que son  muy solicitados por sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el contacto con la gente, es así que lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad, sin embargo el estilo de cocinar precariamente cerca de la cocción de los alimentos, le es más incomodo. Pero sabe que gracias a ello, puede cubrir la educación de su hija. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y seguirá siendo muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, puesto que desea tener nuevos préstamos, asimismo se le considera un compañero muy responsable dentro de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos perecibles para facilitar la preparación de sus potajes.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and she is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She is married and the mother of 6 children; she lives with her youngest child and her husband in their own house. She sells traditional soups from the jungle, near the market in her district. She has many loyal customers who wait for her on the weekends to delight themselves with her exquisite tacachos (fried plantains with pork meat) which are in demand by her customers. What she likes most about her job is interacting with the people, and for this reason, she’s been doing this business for 10 years; however, the way in which she prepares food precariously close to the cooking fire is discomforting to her. But she knows that thanks to the business, she can pay for her daughter’s education. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP and she will continue to make her payments on time since wishes to have more loans; also, she is considered a responsible member in her community bank. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy perishable products to facilitate the preparation of her soups.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products to continue preparing food.

loans.name: Marivic's Group

texts.en: Marivic T. is from the town of Burgos, Ramon. She is 38 years old and is the group leader of this five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marivic T.’s Group. Marivic is married and has one school-aged child. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling fish balls and other dimsums (Chinese cuisine where dishes come in small portions) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over sixteen years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Marivic plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hebert

texts.es: Hebert, de 37 años, vive en la casa de sus suegros, junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos.Se dedica a  la distribución de pescados, chorizos, langostinos (productos marinos) que luego de comprar y acomodarlos en la acopiadora en su carro, los  distribuye a todos los mercados del sur de la ciudad. Tiene varios clientes,  que saben de la prontitud  de las  entregas, y lo esperan ansiosos en sus puestos,  para recibir  y solicitar  los próximos pedidos. Ya  lleva 7 años realizando esta labor  y considera que su mayor dificultad, es cuando su carro sufre averías en pleno trabajo, pero trata de solucionar el problema lo más pronto posible. Para el futuro desea comprarse otra movilidad más moderna, para continuar ofreciendo lo mejor a sus clientes.Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y seguirá siendo puntual como siempre. En su grupo, es un integrante responsable y  muy querido por sus compañeras de crédito.Hebert tiene planeado  invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  llantas para su carro y de ese modo seguirá  trabajando productivamente como hasta hoy.
texts.en:
Hebert, 37 years old, lives in the home of his parents-in-law with his wife and two sons. He buys fish, sausages, and prawns—seafood—that, after properly storing them in his car, he distributes to all the markets in the south of the city. He has several customers who trust the promptness of his deliveries, and they wait for him eagerly in the market to receive and place orders. He has done this work for 7 years. Hebert's main difficulty arises when he has car trouble in the middle of work, and he is trying to fix this as soon as possible. In the future he wants to buy a more modern vehicle in order to continue offering his clients the best. This is his fifteenth loan from MFP, and he will continue to be punctual as always with repayments. He is a responsible bank member and is well-liked by his peers. He plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of tires for his car. This way he will be able to continue working productively as he always has.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of new tires for his car

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Simorn S. is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in Saom village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Hakk Horn (shown with her in the photo), are farmers who own 1.10 hectares (2.75 acres) of land they use to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mrs. Simorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm.

Aside from farming, Mrs. Simorn S. is also a congee (a type of rice porridge) seller while her husband is a construction worker. With these businesses, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Jamida

texts.en:
N. Jamida is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kinoni in the Masaka area of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is young and not yet in school. Jamida has a business selling bananas in bulk in Kinoni. She has had this business for approximately one year. Jamida’s business serves the local community by providing an affordable source of food for many people.

To help expand her business, Jamida is requesting a loan of 200,000 in Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used towards buying more stock of bananas for resale. Jamida hopes to sell more product, and generate increased profit in order to provide more income for her family.

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and to improve their prospects for the future. It targets a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance organizations. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and to give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: Towards buying more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 61 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijas.Desde hace 3 años se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos y artículos para el hogar. Su negocio esta ubicado  en el mercado principal de su ciudad, y ya tiene gran cantidad de clientes que le compran frecuentemente por los buenos precios que ofrece. Sus clientes potenciales son mujeres jóvenes y público en general, que gustan de la variada mercadería que oferta. Recuerda como años atrás solo su hija la apoyaba, y en la actualidad  se ha independizado en este negocio, y le resulta muy rentable, aunque debe dedicarle la mayor parte del día.  Le gusta la comercialización porque le genera buenas  rentas;  ya que siempre anhelo vender este tipo de productos. Para el futuro tiene planeado adquirir 2  vitrinas para exhibir  mejor sus productos, y de esta manera espera  generarse mayores ganancias.Es el  décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, además se siente muy satisfecha del trabajo responsable  que desempeña  su grupo, pues conoce a todos los integrantes y sabe que son personas  trabajadoras como ella.Felicita tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería (productos cosméticos y artículos para el hogar), para abastecer mejor todos los  pedidos solicitados por sus  clientes.
texts.en:
Felicita, who is 61 years old, lives in her own house together with her husband and 3 daughters. For the past 3 years she has been selling cosmetics and household items. Her business is located in the main market in the city, and she already has many customers who frequently buy from her, thanks to the good prices she gives them. Her client base is young women in particular, and the public in general, who appreciate the variety of her merchandise. Felicita recalls how, with only her daughter to help her, she built up her business and her independence. It is now very profitable, although she has to dedicate most of her day to the business. She enjoys marketing her products because it delivers a good profit; she loves selling this type of product. In future she plans to buy 2 display cases to display her products better, and hopes that this will increase her income. This is the 10th loan Felicita has had with [field partner] MFP, and she vows to make her payments on time. She also says she is very satisfied with the group's performance and their responsible approach to their work, because she knows all the members and knows that they are hard-working people like herself. Felicita has plans to invest the money she is seeking in the purchase of additional merchandise, to better meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her business

loans.name: Leocadie

texts.en:
Leocadie is 27 years old and married with three children who are 2, 4 and 5 years old. Leocadie struggles by in life selling a variety of jewelry. She has been in this business for about seven years. The hours of her business are from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

Leocadie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. This loan will allow her to expand her business by adding the sale of modern jewelry. With this additional jewelry, Leocadie will hopefully earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability of the business as well as her family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Exodo Alejandro

texts.es:
Labora para Matecsa como guarda de seguridad, es acompañado con 3 personas a su cargo 2 niños en edad escolar y su compañera de vida, se encarga en la empresa de la vigilancia del lugar resguardando los bienes de la Institución.
Durante he tenido créditos con CEPRODEL, he logrado dar una mejor comodidad a mi familia y poder asegurar a mis hijos durante el día y la noche ya que en este país lo más importante es asegurar la vivienda, por el peligro y la delincuencia.
Por tanto agradezco a CEPRODEL, por su apoyo a mejorar mis condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Exodo works for Matecsa (a company that produces metal construction materials) as a security guard. He has 3 dependents: 2 school-aged children and his life partner. In his company he is in charge of monitoring the premises, guarding the assets of the institution. Over the time that he has taken loans with CEPRODEL, he has managed to provide better comfort for his family and make his house more secure during the day and night for his children, since in this country there is a risk from crime. For this reason he is grateful to CEPRODEL for their support, which has enabled him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make improvements to his house; to buy construction materials

loans.name: Francisco Rene

texts.es: Francisco René tiene 65 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de leña, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar de la manera más humilde. Pues no es el primer financiamiento que solicita es para mejorar sus condiciones del negocio, pues es muy importante ofrecer los productos que sus clientes le solicitan. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de leña para suplir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco René is 65 years old. He sells firewood for a living, and he has done this for more than 6 years, because he has always liked working in the most humble way. This is not the first financing that he has asked for, it is to improve his working conditions, as it is very important to offer the products that his customers ask for. He is asking for this loan to purchase firewood to meet the demand of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. is married and takes care of five dependents. She has no educational background.

Efua sells soap, bread knives, bowls and panties at Elmina. Her husband is a prison officer and she uses the income generated from her sales to help her him take care of her family.

Efua will use the loan to purchase more of her goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to establish a shop for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more of her goods to sell

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida lives in a small city in Punjab called Kasur. Kasur city is famous in Pakistan for its leather industry. She is 29 years old, married to M. S., and has been living in the area of Kullay Walla since her marriage. She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both are very young, less than 2 years old. 

Her husband has a dairy business. Currently he has three buffaloes at his home and he gets milk from them to sell through his milk-shop. His shop is located in the market where he deals with good number of customers every day and makes good earnings. He is the only breadwinner for his family and by holding this status he always tries to put a step ahead to improve the financial conditions of his family. 

Last year, from his profit he bought a buffalo and increased the milk-productivity of his business. Now he has a plan to buy another buffalo so he can steadily grow his business to a large scale one and provide improved living conditions for his family. 
 
Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to buy another buffalo for her husband’s dairy business.
