She is confident that her husband will make good use of the loan and the productivity of milk will be increased by purchasing another buffalo, so that will increase his sales and income also. She is a new loan applicant and hopes to build a long-term relationship with Asasah.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, D. 51 años, vive en su casa propia a lado D. su esposo Luis D. 53 años y D. su última hija, pues los 2 mayores son independientes. Para esta empeñosa mujer no hay nada imposible, es por esta razón que logró sacar adelante a sus hijos y construyó su amplia casa D. material noble. En la actualidad alquila habitaciones y departamentos, por lo que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Siempre esta en la búsqueda D. nuevos negocios y comercializa ropa, zapatos, carteras y todo tipo D. accesorios para dama. Ella misma se considera una “mil oficios” pues manifiesta que en esta vida el que se queda no progresa, y por eso no deja D. laborar en lo que se le presente, pues desD. muy joven fue emprendedora. Para el futuro ya tiene planeado instalar una tienda D. venta D. ropa y calzado en algún centro comercial D. su zona y calcula que obtendrá generosas ganancias. Es el 14 avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Juana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. cantidad D. mercadería en ropa para dama que necesita pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir y espera aumentar sus rentas.
texts.en:
Juana, age 51, lives in her own house along with her husband Luis, age 53, and their youngest daughter. Their two oldest children live independently.

Nothing is impossible for this tenacious woman. This is the reason that she succeeded in helping her children get ahead and in building her own solidly constructed house.

Currently, she rents out rooms and apartments, through which she obtains regular earnings that allow her to help her husband with the household expenses. She is always on the lookout for new businesses and sells women’s clothing, shoes, purses, and all types of accessories. She considers herself as having “1000 skills” since she declares that in this life she who stands still does not progress. That’s why she doesn’t turn down any work that presents itself to her. She has been enterprising since she was very young.

For the future, she already has plans to open a clothing and shoe shop in a commercial center in her area and estimates she will obtain generous profits. This is her fourteenth loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her installments on time since she doesn’t want to disappoint the people who have maD. possible the investment which will permit her to continue working on progressing. Juana has plans to invest the loan in the purchase of an inventory of women’s clothing that she needs since she has several pending orders to fill and hopes to increase her profits.

loans.use: To acquire more clothing in order to fill pending orders.

loans.name: 020307-Bac Son-Hoang Phu Group

texts.en:
Gioi C. T. (19) is a 49 year old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Gioi is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 020307-Bac Son-Hoang Phu (020307-Bac Son-Hoang Phu).

Gioi is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Gioi operates a family member's business venture in the food sector making and selling food. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Gioi has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Gioi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gioi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Gioi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Bich P. T. (4) is a 48 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
2.  Diep L. T. (20) is a 26 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
3.  Lan N. T. (21) is a 54 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
4.  L. N. T. (1) is a 53 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
5.  Huong T. T. (7) is a 36 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
6.  Chien L. T. (39) is a 51 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Gioi C. T. (19) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Gioi là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 020307-Bac Son-Hoang Phu (020307-Bac Son-Hoang Phu).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Gioi thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 25 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Gioi kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2008, Gioi đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Gioi đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Bich P. T. (4) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
2.  Diep L. T. (20) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
3.  Lan N. T. (21) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
4.  L. N. T. (1) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
5.  Huong T. T. (7) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
6.  Chien L. T. (39) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Gregory Kiplimo

texts.en: Gregory K. is 41 years old, married, and has four children, ranging in age from eight to 16.  He is from Vihiga.  Gregory has a livestock rearing business that he has been doing for the past five years. He is applying for his sixth loan from KADET and has a good credit history. He will use the money to buy three bulls to raise and sell later. His profits will be used to repay the loan and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Gregory hopes to establish a dairy milk cooling plant in the future.

loans.use: To buy three bulls to add to his stock

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
El Sr. Paulino   de 40 años de edad  vive en la Localidad de el Torno hace 3 años oriunda de departamento de Santa Cruz, Su Actividad es la  venta de material de construcción  hace 2 años en su domicilio y también entrega los pedidos que tiene a domicilio a pedido del cliente.
                                                                                                              Su Estado civil esta casado hace 6 años con la  señora Sonia  su  actividad es la venta  de fruta en la localidad del torno, tienen  tres  hijos que se encuentran actualmente estudiando.                                                                                                                                                                                                                  El  señor se siente muy agradecido con nuestra entidad financiera por confiar en el  porque necesita  comprar material de construcción ya que  tiene  muchos pedidos de material y necesita abastecer su deposito para satisfacer las demandas.
texts.en:
Señor Paulino is 40 years old. He has lived in the Torno district in the department of Santa Cruz for 3 years. For two years his business has been selling construction materials. He makes sales from his home and also delivers orders to his customers' homes, at their request.

He has been married for 6 years to Señora Sonia, whose business is selling fruit in Torno. They have three children who are in school.

Señor Paulino is very thankful to this financial institution for the confidence they have shown in him. He needs to buy construction material since he has many orders for material and needs to stock his warehouse to satisfy his customers' requests.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Хайдарова Насиба проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 22 года. Не замужем. Образование среднее. Работает на рынке Дехкон. Арендует торговую точку, где продает парфюмерию и разную мелочь. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Nasiba H. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 22 years old and single.  She has a high school education.  She works in the Dehkon market.  She rents a shop where she sells perfume and different knick-knacks.  She has been doing this work for ten years.  She is taking out a loan to increase the variety of goods she carries.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods she carries

loans.name: Mrs. Hing Chreb Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hing C. has been selected as the the village bank president in Krang Chamraeun village, Takeo province.  There are 10 members of this bank and they will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living conditions. Mrs. Hing C., a mother of two children who are students, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family and she also weaves silk at her home. Her husband, Mr. Thol Ek, is a construction worker. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Hing C. wants to expand. She  is requesting  a loan to buy more silk for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Rosa Yolanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 51 años de edad, es casada  pero en la actualidad está separada, de esa relación tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, con ella vive una nieta de 10 años que es su vida y que estudia en escuela. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 años y le gusta la forma como se trabaja en el Banco.

Tiene una carreta en la cual vende alitas de pollos asadas, cueritos y fritadas, también vende bolos, colas y tostadas trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 9h00 frente a una escuela  y desde las 15h00 hasta las 18h00 en su casa, nos cuenta que lleva varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y que tiene muchos clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar productos necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "Av. Del Ejército" community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees".

Here we meet 51 year-old Rosa.  Rosa is married but currently separated.  She has four children who are already grown up.  She lives with a 10 year-old grandchild who is her life and who is studying at elementary school.  Rosa has been a member of her community bank for five years and she likes the way it works.

Rosa has a cart from which she sells roasted chicken wings, fried pork rinds and 'fritadas' (a traditional fried pork dish).  She also sells cakes, colas and 'tostadas' (fried tortillas).  She works every day from 6.30am to 9.00am opposite a school, then from 3.00pm to 6.00pm from her home.  She tells us that she has been in this business for several years and she has a lot of customers.

Rosa will use this loan to buy the products she needs to make her food.  Her dreams are to own her own home since she currently rents.

loans.use: To buy chicken, pork, oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.en:
Muhiddin is 38 years old and lives with his wife and six children. From a young age he demonstrated a talent for agriculture. Muhiddin has always tried to be very responsible and very content with his farm work. When he finishes caring for his crops, he goes to help his father, because he wants to repay his father’s efforts. What his father likes best out of the whole agricultural process is the marketing, because he always hopes to get a good price for his crops. But once he gets to the market, he gets a little clumsy and sometimes loses track of the accounting. Muhiddin always tries to help him out with this. 

The loan Muhiddin now is asking for is to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his varied crops. The loan will greatly improve Muhiddin’s income and his family's living standards.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Zonia Maribel

texts.es:
Zonia, D. 31 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, vive con su esposo y su hija, se dedica a vender ropa americana (segunda mano), este negocio es variante y Zonia cuando las ventas van mal instala verduras y aprovecha a ofrecer otro producto al mismo tiempo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo que necesita para comprar ropa americana, con esta ayuda su negocio estará más surtido, los clientes podrán escoger mejores prendas D. vestir.
Zonia espera con el negocio mejorar su condición económica, ayudar y cubrir las necesidades D. su familia.
texts.en:
Zonia, age 31, lives in the Jiquilisco department of Usulután with her husband and daughter. She sells second-hand American clothing for a living. Her business varies because when sales are down, she offers vegetables at the same time.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase American clothing. With this help, her business will be better stocked, and her customers will have a wider selection of apparel to choose from.

Zonia hopes to improve her financial status with this business, to help out and to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Nzioki

texts.en:
Nzioki is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

She has operated a cereals business for the past four years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Nzioki faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to purchase a posho mill (grinding machine for maize) in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 36 years old and has five children between the ages of 3 and 18. All of the children except the youngest are currently enrolled in school.  She rents a portion of lakeside property from the government, which she in turn rents out to fishermen who want to fish within that area.  Angelique’s husband is a fisherman who sells the fish he catches. Angelique and her husband have had this business for four years, which has allowed them to pay for their children’s school fees. With the profits, Angelique intends to build a house on a piece of land which she already owns.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Clenda

texts.en:
Clenda is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya.  Clenda is 24 years old and married with two children ages 2 and 4 years.  She has been in the farming business for six years and employs one farmhand. She sells her milk to the local market. 

She has requested for a loan of 25,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable her to pay school fees for her child. Her primary challenge has been lack of enough animal feed. She hopes to acquire at least 4 dairy cows in the next five years.
She would like Juhudi to help her look for quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marta's Group

texts.es:
Doña Marta A. G. D. M., es una señora casada, tiene 59 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 5 hijos, se dedica a los oficios domesticos del hogar y tambien a la crianza D. cerdos, cuenta con 3 años D. experiencia en este oficio, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que se dedica a realizar oficios D. jornalero. 

Doña Marta deciD. orgaizar un grupo, para solicitar un préstamos que le servirá para la compra D. cerditos y alimento para los mismos,paa que cuando crezcan pueda ella venderlos y recuperarsu inversion y obtener su ganacias. Las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades como: crianza D. cerdos, crianza D. pollos y al cultivo. Esperan que con el prestamos que hacen logren mejorar sus ingresos y ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta A. G. D. M. is a married woman. She is 59 years old and she did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has 5 children and she dedicates her time to the care of the home and she also raises pigs. She has 3 years' experience in this business. She has her husband's support. He is a farm hand.

Marta decided to organize a group in order to request loans. It will help her purchase piglets and feed for them. when they have grown she offers them for sale and she recovers her investment and she obtain her profits. The members of this group have different businesses, such as: raising pigs, raising poultry, and agriculture. They hope that with this they will be able to improve their earnings and their profits.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and livestock feed

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.en:
Asia Y., is in her late thirties and married with four daughters. She has been running a food vendor business for one year. She works from 6.00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Asia's 1st motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  She hopes for a loan to increase her food stock by buying sacks of rice, wheat flour, a backet of cooking oil and a sack of backing four. Her dream is to one day open a shop called tabletop, which will sell dry food, fruit and vegetables.

Asia will share this loan with her loan group "Nazareth", which has a total of 13 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their motisha loan. 

In the picture, Aisha is 1st on the right.

loans.use: to increase her food stock by buying sacks of rice, wheat flour, a backet of cooking oil and a sack of backing four.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 27 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 3 years old. Alice has four years' experience and she employees one person to help her. 

Alice has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more bananas to sell. With the additional profits from this, Alice plans to buy a field and build a comfortable house.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ataya Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 31 mai 2007. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. L'activité principale des membres est le petit commerce. 

La dame, debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe est responsable du groupe. Elle mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle est détentrice d'une cantine à la gare routière où elle vend des produits cosmétiques (lait de corps, pommade pour cheveux, parfums etc.) Elle pratique cette activité depuis un an.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux approvisionner sa cantine en produits cosmétiques. 

Son objectif est de renforcer sa cantine en marchandises, augmenter son niveau d'épargne, et de participer à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on May 30, 2007. It consists of 14 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is retail.
The lady standing on the far right in the photo wrapped in a scarf is the head of the group. She is married and a mother of five.
She runs a cafeteria at a bus station where she sells cosmetic products (body lotion, hair pomade, perfumes, etc.). She has been doing this for a year.
Her new loan will allow her to stock up her cafeteria with more beauty products.
Her goal is to increase the merchandise in her cafeteria, to increase her savings, and to help pay for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is from the city of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 57 years old. Nena is married and has six adult children. Nena owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food & daily use products in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery products to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with 1 boy who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills, school fees and clothing. 

For the past 4 years, Florence has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation and high competition of from other retail shop businesses. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop  in the future.

With a loan of Kshs 20,000 Florence wants to purchase bundles of sugar, wheat flour and salt. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of sugar, wheat flour and salt.

loans.name: Edelborgo

texts.en: Edelborgo is 57-year-old married man who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He is a farmer and has been growing rice for 30 years already. According to Edelborgo, his recent income from the farm is 3000 PHP per month. Edelborgo wants to improve his earnings and he works hard to achieve it. He is requesting the loan to fund his farm. He plans to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs with his loan. Edelborgo hopes for this loan to help increase his harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Eugenia Auriola

texts.es:
Eugenia Auriola tiene 30 años, es soltera vive con la  hija de 17 años, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Eugenia Auriola se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca, ademas se dedica a la crianza de aves. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos y alimentacion para las aves, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es sewguir trabajando y ayudar en la educacion a la hija.

Le gusta visitar a los padres que viven en Chillanes.
texts.en:
Eugenia Auriola is 30 years old, single and she lives with her 17-year old mother. She lives in the enclosed community of El Progreso in the city of Chillanes. 

The members of the communal bank El Progreso, located at 15 minutes from the office in Chillanes, is made up of 13 members who request their third loan from the cooperative. The members of this group are agriculturists who cultivate cocoa, corn, bananas, soy beans, and yucca.

Eugenia Auriola is an agriculturist who cultivates cocoa, corn, bananas, soy beans, and yucca. She also raises poultry. She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and she carries out her sales at the Sunday fairs in Chillanes. 

The loan will help her purchase products, such as fertilizers and manure for her cultivation, and feed for her poultry. The loan has helped her increase production in her cultivations. She has faced challenges such as illnesses that have struck the workers, and plagues and diseases on the cultivations. Her dream is to keep working and to contribute to her daughter’s education. 

She enjoys visiting her parents who live in Chillanes.

loans.use: to purchase products such as fertilizers and manure for the cultivations and to purhcase feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Elsa Mariflor

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elsa, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos ya todos mayores de edad, pero el menor de ellos  aun vive con ella. El marido se dedica a la pesca. Nuestra amiga lleva cinco ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella se financia cada vez que los recibe.

Ella tiene un negocio de compra y ventas de pinchaguas,  esta es una variedad de pez muy solicitada por las personas y por los dueños de negocios de ceviches, ya que con este producto ellos preparan el delicioso ceviche de pinchaguas que es muy apreciado  por los clientes, ella compra a los pescadores en Los  Arenales, los mismos que luego se encarga de limpiarlos y curtirlas con limón para luego entregarlas en tarrinas plásticas a sus clientes, trabaja todos los días en las mañanas, lleva más de cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad que le deja muy buenos ingresos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más pinchaguas (pescado) y embases plásticos. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish, in Portoviejo Canton, we find a place known as "Los Arenales".  The members of the “Nueva Generación” (New Generation) Communal Bank meet here every two weeks. This area is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy, and the warmth of its people.

This is where we meet Elsa, age 52.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has four children.  They are all adults now, but the youngest still lives with her.  Her husband is a fisherman.  

She has been in her communal bank for five cycles.  She likes it because she funds the business every time she receives a loan. 

She has a business of buying and selling “pinchaguas” (alewife fish).  This is a very popular variety among people and ceviche (raw, marinated fish) business owners.  They use the product to prepare the delicious “ceviche de pinchaguas”, which is very popular with the customers.  

She buys from the fisherman in Los Arenales.  She then takes charge of cleaning them with lemon.  She later delivers them in plastic containers to her customers.  She works every day in the mornings.  She has been doing this for over five years, and it gives her very good income.

This loan is to buy “pinchaguas” (fish) and plastic containers.

Her dream is to get ahead and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and plastic containers.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.en:
Maria lives in Choluteca, Honduras, and has four grown children. For the last 15 years, she has made a living selling soft drinks near the border with El Salvador. 

Maria is requesting a 5,000 HNL loan to purchase soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is a father of two children.  He has been doing farming for the past five years. He was taught farming by his parents.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for rice farming labour.

loans.name: Padppa Ste Cecile Group

texts.fr: Le groupe PADPPA STE CECILE est composé de trois personnes qui habitent la même maison au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Justine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Justine est âgée de 49 ans et vit au Bénin .Justine est une veuve qui a quatre enfants, dont deux restent encore à sa charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Justine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Justine vend depuis vingt ans du poisson frais. Justine s’approvisionne au bord des lac du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenau, Justine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe PADPPA STE CECILE un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
PADPPA STE CECILE group is made up of three persons who live in the same house in Benin. The group leader, named Justine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 49 years old and lives in Benin. She's a widow with four children, out of whom she still has to support two. Some of the children attend school.

Justine never went to school. To provide for herself and for her children, she's been selling fresh fish for 20 years. She gets her supplies on the banks of Benin's lakes. In order to meet customer demand and increase her revenue and income, she's seeking a third loan from Kiva's parter, ALIDé, together with the other members of PADPPA STE CECILE  group. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Karina Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señorita. Karina es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive por el sector camino al Tejar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más  importante de país, desde 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad y fue nombrada así por la belleza de su arquitectura.

La Señorita. Karina tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá es carpintero de profesión y su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, la casa en la que habitan es arrendada.

Nuestra socia estudia en una universidad de la ciudad y está en primer año de contabilidad y auditoría. Ella tiene  una tienda de comestibles  hace un año y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fué invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de azúcar, fideos, aceites, arroz, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.

Su meta es culminar sus estudios y que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the 'Las Caleras' community bank.  She lives in Camino al Tejar, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is the third most important city in the country.  It was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of the beauty of its architecture.

Karina is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  Her dad is a carpenter by trade and her mom looks after the house.  They rent the house in which they live.

Karina is studying at a university in the city and is in her first year of an accountancy and auditing degree.  She has had her own grocery store for one year and works there from Sunday to Sunday.  She does not work fixed hours.

This is Karina's first loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will invest her loan in buying sugar, noodles, oil, rice, detergents and other basic household products with which to stock her store.

Karina's goal is to finish her studies and for her business to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, oil, rice, detergents and other basic household products

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 40 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, he has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells second-hand shoes. 

To help expand his business, Julius has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale, and will help Julius to generate greater profits and improve the standard of living for him and his wife. He hopes that in the future he will be able to have children and educate them up to university level. 

Julius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”PEROLNIYOC”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Narcisa; La socia tiene 47 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 27,25, 23, 17 años de edad; la socia trabaja atendiendo su tienda de abarrotes y también es agricultora, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo de maíz, ella compra también de sus vecinas maíz y los vende todo al por mayor.  La socia se dedica a ambos negocios desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, la socia requiere invertir su préstamo en la compra de maíz para la venta ella acopiara o almacenara los productos para ofrecer a sus diferentes clientes y venderlos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz al por mayor.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Narcisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Perolniyoc” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 47 years old, married, and has four children (ages 27, 25, 23, and 17). Narcisa manages a grocery store, but she is also a farmer. She has land on which she grows corn, but she also buys corn from her neighbors and then sells it in bulk. Narcisa has managed both businesses for approximately 10 years. She needs a loan in order to buy corn in bulk that she can sell to the collection centers and the stores which in turn offer this product to different customers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to use for this purpose.

Narcisa is grateful for this loan and promises to complete her payments according to the stated terms.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is in school. Madina has a business of a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Madina sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Madina has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of creams, braids, and hair shampoo. The main business challenges for Madina include theives and the ever increasing prices of braids. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and to own a fully stocked salon. Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, and hair shampoo.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly believes that, "Poverty is not a hindrance to success". She is 46 and has three school-age children. She is married to a farmer and they live harmoniously in a village. They live through farming. They plant rice and vegetables to sell. Since their children are now in a higher level of education, they are in need of financial support. 

In this regard, Nelly is engaged in selling detergent soaps and dishwashing soaps to earn additional income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional stock of detergent soaps and dishwashing soaps to sell in their village. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices, she will make an improvement in her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent and dishwashing soaps to sell

loans.name: Javzanhorol

texts.en:
Javzanhorol is 52 years old and lives with her granddaughter and grandson in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

She started her grocery retail business in 2007 by renting a counter in the market. She has many regular customers due to her good service and cheap prices. 

Now that winter is approaching, she needs to save some groceries in order to run her business successfully. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says, "I am happy that I can support my grandchildren. It makes me feel useful." 

She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy more products.

loans.use: To buy more products.

loans.name: Samaladou

texts.fr:
Samaladou est une femme  âgé(e) de 43ans. Elle est mariée å un  marin. Elle a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 18ans et le dernier 14ans.
Samaladou travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2006. Elle vend seule à la maison et achète les produits à Lomé.
Samaladou a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentations générales. Elle veut intensifier l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Samaladou voudrait agrandir l’activité en vue de créer une plus large clientèle. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Samaladou is 43 years old and married to a sailor. The couple have 3 children, aged between 14 and 18, who all go to school. Samaladou has been selling groceries since 2006. She gets her supplies in Lomé and resells them from her home.

Samaladou is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to restock on groceries and increase her current level of business activity. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business and grow her customer base. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family´s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Eri

texts.en:
Eri is a 30-year-old married man with three 3 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been driving a motorcycle despite the challenges of high fuel prices, theft, and accidents.

Eri's personal goal is to build a good permanent house and provide an education to his children. His business dream is to own at least five motorcycles in order to increase his income. Eri is requesting a loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Sahuaro ( Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama sahuaro  y se integra de  cuatro personas  y vive en un barrio pequeño de donde  celebran  la fiesta del san  francisco de asís.
La  señora quien se  le tomo la entrevista se llama  Guadalupe  quien es casada con el señor    Patricio y con quien procreo cuatro hijos  quienes  dos  ya están casados y dos  aun están a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son:   carnes, plátanos, hoja de guineo, pasas, maza, entre otras para la elaboración de  tamales, en donde lleva  trabajando  custro meses y comenta que le  va bien ya que con ello ha mejorado sus ingresos para su hogar.
Lo que ella lo inspiro a esta actividad  ya que  también quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y no le haga falta lo más necesario.
 
    Lo que desea  es que con esta pequeña actividad  pueda seguir trabajando hasta que dios le preste vida y asa  seguir a poyando también a su hijos que están estudiando.
 
   Quienes integran en el grupo son las siguientes señoras: Soraida  quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta  cosméticos, María estela  invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de piñatas y la señora María del Carmen  invertirá en la compra y venta de refrescos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Sahuaro” and is made up of four ladies in a small neighborhood where they celebrate the festival of San Francisco de Asís.

Guadalupe was the one interviewed.  She’s married to Patricio, with whom she has four children, two are married and she still supports the other two.

She requested this loan so that she can buy ingredients such as meats, bananas, banana leaves, raisins, and dough, among other things to make tamales.   She’s been doing this for four months.  Things have gone well for her and her household income has improved.  It was this that inspired her to start this business; as well as wanting to help her husband generate the household income so that nothing will be needed.  What she wants is to be able to continue working this small business as long as God grants her life, and in this way continue supporting her children who attend school.

The other members of the group are: Soraida, who will invest in cosmetics to resell; María, who will invest in supplies for making piñatas; and María del Carmen, who will invest in soft drinks to resell.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Ситора жительница Гиссарского района. Ей 25 лет. Она не замужем. Ситора занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области она пять лет. Она берет кредит для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Sitora is a resident of the Gissar district.  She is 25 years old and not married.  Sitora is involved in breeding cattle for subsequent sale.  She has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase several heads of cattle

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Magdalena, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 12 y de año y medio, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es obrero en una cantera de la localidad.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para dama), tambien vende productos naturales, trabaja tres días a la semana ya sea en la mañana o en la tarde, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y productos naturales. Lleva 13 años  en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora ("Our Lady of Help") communal bank meets in Sequita parish in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí province full of hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita's people are honest and know only how to work and dedicate themselves to their families.

In this place we meet Magdalena, 32 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has three children who are one and a half, 12, and 14 years old. The two older children are in secondary school. Her husband is a worker in a quarry in the town. 

She is a housewife who, in order to obtain her own resources, sells products from the Esika catalogue (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies' accessories). She also sells natural products. She works three days a week, either in the morning or in the afternoon. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this work for a year, and it is going very well for her.

This loan is for purchasing perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and natural products. She has been in the communal bank for 13 years and is the treasurer of the group. She likes it because the payments are easy to make. 

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and natural products.

loans.name: Reyna Antolina

texts.es:
La señora  Reyna es una señora amable que se dedica a la venta de refrescos, jugos y desayunos  desde  hace un  año.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Eusebio  Agustín un señor trabajador  que la ayuda en lo que pueda ya que trabaja de albañil y casi no tiene tiempo de  ayudarla.
Tambien se dedica a la venta de maiz.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más refrescos de diferentes sabores.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyarla en todo ya que sin su apoyo no tendría lo que ahora a tiene.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna is a friendly woman who has been selling soft drinks, juice and breakfasts for the past year.

She is happily married to Sr. Eusebio Agustín, a hardworking man who helps her as much as he can however since he works as a bricklayer he does not have much time to spare.

Reyna also sells corn. She requested the loan to buy different flavored soft drinks. She thanks the Fundación for supporting her in everything she does since without its support she would not have what she now has.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: Josefa de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.

loans.use: para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Increase the stock of the business.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid H. owns an Audio/Video store in the town of Khachmaz in North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Rashid is one of Azerbaijan’s new young entrepreneurs. Rashid wants to increase the number of customers that come to his store by increasing and diversifying his inventory.

loans.use: New Inventory for store (DVDs, CDs, CD Player, DVD player)

loans.name: Aolele

texts.en: Aolele is one of the first members of the SPBD Center in the Samoan village of Malie.  She is a hard-working, 62-year-old woman with five children.  Aolele operates a small shop in the front of her house.  Although Aolele had moved to New Zealand to seek a better life, she returned to Samoa some years ago and is passionate about remaining in her home country and finding a way to support her family in her small village.  Aolele has used micro-loans to build up her small shop, and these funds are key to allowing her to finance the expansion of her inventory.  Aolele can bring in revenues of ST 500 (USD 200) on a good day and works hard to translate that into a profit.  Every Friday, Aolele contributes to her steadily growing savings account.

loans.use: Purchase of shop inventory

loans.name: Erica

texts.en: Erica B. operates a fruit and vegetable kiosk in the Gid Market of Mukachevo, Ukraine. Erica opened her business nine years ago and chose to specialize in fresh produce, knowing that they are in constant demand. Her business helps to support her family of three. Erica is hard working and kind - she has built a loyal customer base by offering a wide selection of fresh produce and quality service. Erica has a perfect repayment history and has used previous loans to effectively and consistently grow her business. Currently, Erica is seeking a loan for $1200 to increase her inventory. With the profits, she plans to expand her business and purchase a car to transport produce more effectively.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana Maria is 44 year old and has been with her husband Leonardo for more than 20 years. They have 5 children. Both Ana Maria and Leonardo work cultivating a small farm, which they've have done for more than 25 years. They grow all types of vegetables such as tomatoes, cauliflower, lettuce and other types of greens.

Every day they get up very early. At 3AM, Ana Maria drives to the produce market in the capital to sell their products, while Leonardo takes care of the daily work on the farm. Ana Maria is very proud of the work they've done, and grateful that they've been able to acquire the comforts they have in their home, not to mention that they've built a comfortable and cozy house thanks to their efforts.

They have made good use of the loans since today it's very difficult without the extra help. In this case, the loan will be used to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides that they need for their business.

Ana María tiene 44 años y está en pareja con Leonardo de 47 años. Viven juntos hace más de 20 años y tienen 5 hijos. Tanto Ana María como Leonardo se dedican al cultivo de la chacra, actividad que desarrollan hace más de 25 años. Cultivan todo tipo de verduras como: tomates, acelga, coliflor, lechuga y otro tipo de hortalizas. Todos los días se levantan muy temprano pues Ana María se dirige a las 3 a.m. al mercado de abasto que queda en la capital a fin de comercializar sus productos, mientras que Leonardo debe dirigirse a la chacra para realizar sus labores diA.. Ana María manifiesta que está muy orgullosa del trabajo que realiza debido a que gracias al mismo ha podido adquirir todas las comodidades con que cuenta su hogar sin olvidar de mencionar que han construido también, gracias a dichos ingresos, una confortable y acogedora casa. Siempre han recurrido a los préstamos debido a que hoy día es muy difícil trabajar sin la ayuda de los mismos. En esta oportunidad el crédito lo utilizarán para la compra de abonos, semillas e insectidas que serán empleados en sus cultivos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Gulbahor is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. Together with her husband she sell fruits and vegetables wholesale. This business is the main source of income for the family. Produce is purchased at the border with Uzbekistan and later resold in the local markets. After getting her loan from MicroInvest, Gulbahor was able to significantly increase her turnover capital. She is planing to invest the money from her new loan into purchasing potatoes and onions.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Гульбахор 32 года, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Вместе с мужем она занимается оптовой реализацией овощей и фруктов. Это основной семейный доход. Товар приобретают на границе с Узбекистаном и потом реализуют по окрестным рынкам. Получив в начале года займ в Микроинвест, Гульбахор значительно расширила свой оборотный капитал. Новый займ собирается потратить на закупку осенней картошки и лука.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and onions

loans.name: Lidia Maruja

texts.en:
Lidia owns and runs the friendly grocery store at which everyone stops in her small neighborhood just outside the city center of Ayacucho, Peru. She opened her doors just one year ago, and already has a steady flow of regular customers who pass through her doors shopping for their daily needs. Just as any clever business woman does, Lidia is constantly looking for opportunities to give her the advantage and attract new customers. For this reason, she has just recently had the idea to purchase tables and set up a small area where people can come over after work and have a beer or soda with their friends.

Before opening her store, Lidia was working as a waitress in her aunt’s seafood restaurant. Although she enjoyed it, Lidia’s real dream was to work for herself, independently. Three years ago, Lidia joined FINCA to take out loans and invest in her aunt’s business. Meanwhile, she was slowly saving her earnings in the bank. Eventually she had enough money saved up to strike out on her own and open her grocery store.

This enterprising dream that Lidia has realized would not have been possible without the help she receives from her village bank. There she has learned how to save her money formally in the bank, where it is safe and accumulates interest, and the loans she has received have been of an immense help. She is now requesting a loan of US$ 350. With this money, she will buy new tables to set up a nice space to realize her newest idea of a small bar.

loans.use: Buy new tables for her store

loans.name: Rano

texts.en: Rano U. lives in Yova; she is married and has 2 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004 and recommends herself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. Loan sums are permanently increased to those who show business stability and an income increase. She is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mrs. U. has a business in egg selling. She works with clients of different income levels. She is very polite, which is why she has repeat customers who want to buy only her goods. Rano U. is very experienced in the business but  has stiff competition, which is why she wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods. Now Mrs. Rano U. requests a loan of 1,000 TJS (US$300)  for business development and to widen the assortment.

loans.use: business development and to widen the assortment

loans.name: Nasuti B(I) Group

texts.en:
Justine is 48 years old and married with eight children. She plans to increase the stock in her retail shop and use the extra business profits to pay school fees for her children. Sylvia has a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to buy a hair dryer. Rose has a retail shop, while Caroline sells second-hand clothes and Cissy has a restaurant.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase business capacity and pay school fees.

loans.name: Samath

texts.en:
Mrs. Samat Y. and her husband, Thol Hout, have been married since 2000. They have four children; one son and three daughters. All of them are still young and stay at home. Samat works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a full time employee in an electrical shop in Phnom Penh for seven years. Both of them travel to work on their old motorbike from their home in Kandal Steung district, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Y. is requesting her second loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money, along with money she has saved, to purchase a new motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Santos Victoria

texts.es:
Santos Victoria G. M. is 52 years old. She was unable to complete primary school. She has 6 kids, whom depend on her. She is very optimistic towards what she does. She lives in the district of Florencia, providence of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She earns a living by selling bread, cakes, and other goodies. Despite having ups and downs in her business, she’s been able to get back on her feet, and now in addition to selling bread, she sells rice, milk sugar, oil and other items.

She is a member of the communal bank “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II” (guide guide our steps). She was invited to join by a neighbor. She obtained her first loan of 300 Soles, which she used to buy flour. With the other loans that she received she was able to make large quantities of bread and to make her business grow. She went from making bread from 5 sacks of flour to making it with 25 sacks. With her prior loan she made hundreds of loafs of bread. Also, she took advantage of the Christmas season, and she was able to sell a lot and make money.

With a loan of 500 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy two sacks of flour, sugar, lard, yeast, salt and firewood. Her biggest dream is to own a bakery in her neighborhood and distribute bread throughout her district.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Santos Victoria G. M. tiene 52 años de edad, con grado de instrucción primaria incompleta y con 6 hijos actualmente 2 dependen de ella, es una señora muy optimista en su negocio. Vive en el Distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo. Departamento de La Libertad – Perú.

Ella desde hace muchos años se dedica a la elaboración de pan, roscas, bizcochos y pasteles a pesar que tuvo algunas caídas en el negocio se ha vuelto a levantar y ahora no solo vende pan sino también algunos productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc.

La señora Santos ingresó al Bancos Comunal “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos II” por invitación de una vecina; obtuvo su primer crédito de S/.300.00 con los cuales compró harina. Con los otros créditos que recibió elaboró pan en mayor cantidad y el negocio fue creciendo antes elaboraba pan solo con 5 sacos de harina y actualmente lo hace con 25 sacos. Con su anterior préstamo elaboro cientos de panes ya que aprovecho la campaña navideña la cual le fue muy bien.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el que pagara en cuatro meses comprará 2 sacos de harina, azúcar, manteca, levadura, sal y leña ya que su mayor sueño es tener una gran panadería a disposición de su barrio y también distribuir pan en todo su distrito.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy ingredients for preparing her goods.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes is a woman who dreamed about forming a home where unity, love and tranquility reigned. She yearned to share these dreams with the father of her child, however he did not feel the same and decided to abandon her. Now she has gotten over his deception. In association with her brothers she decided to buy three knitting machines in order to earn a living entirely through this beautiful art that they learned from their humble parents. Lourde’s dream is to increase the volume of production to continue making beautiful garments such as: sweaters, socks, scarves and pants; with the income that she obtains she will improve the quality of life for her and her dear son Cristian, only six years old. With your support Lourdes will be able to buy a large variety of raw materials to make her proposal a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Lourdes es una mujer que soñó con formar un hogar donde reine la unión, amor y tranquilidad, anhelaba compartir estos sueños con el padre de su hijo, sin embargo él no pensaba lo mismo y decidió abandonarla.Ahora ya habiendo superado esa decepción. En sociedad con sus hermanos decidió comprar tres máquinas de tejer para dedicarse enteramente al bello arte que aprendieron de sus humildes padres.El deseo de Lourdes es aumentar el volumen de su producción para seguir fabricando hermosas prendas de vestir como: chompas, medias, chalinas y pantalones, con los beneficios económicos que obtenga mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su querido hijo Cristian de 6 añitos de edad.Con vuestro aporte Lourdes podrá comprar una gran variedad de materia prima para concretar su propósito.

loans.use: Capital increase to acquire more materials of good quality

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase meat to keep her business running

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros N., a widow with two children, works as a goldsmith making and decorating a variety of fashionable bracelets, necklaces, rings, earrings, and so on. She also trains a few workers who would like to become goldsmiths. Each day she can typically make around $30 in revenue. As well, once a year a broker comes to her house to purchase a mat placed beneath her goldsmith tables to collect small pieces of gold that have descended during her work activities. The mat can generate around $100 per year for her. 
Mrs. Ros N. and her co-workers now need more goldsmith tools in order to work  faster and more productively and render even better service to the customers.

loans.use: To buy more tools to facilitate her work as a goldsmith.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Mrs Maimouna M., age 44, is a widow and the mother of 3 children. She's seeking a loan to bolster her vegetables wholesale business. She intends to repay the loan after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Maimouna M., 44 ans est veuve et mère de 03 enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt pour s’activer dans la vente en gros et demi gros de légume. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To bolster her vegetables wholesale business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fashionable jewelry to retail in her community.

loans.name: Danixa Del Rosario

texts.es: Danixa tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un niño de 3 años, trabaja en el C.D.I como educadora desde hace 9 años. Habita en el municipio de Juigalpa, mismo en donde trabaja.  Está solicitando crédito para compra materiales de construcción como son : Piedra cantera, cemento y hierro, el que utilizará en la casa que actualmente habita, que está a su nombre y a nombre de dos hermanos más. Le ha costado mucho a Danixa salir adelnate ya que es madre soltera y la manutención de su familia le ha tocado sólo a ella, pero poco a poco le está haciendo la inversión a su vivienda, y espera dentro de algunos años poder ver su casa terminada para así darle a su hija una vivienda digna, y también como toda madre soltera espera poder darle educación a su pequeña niña.
texts.en:
Danixa is 28 years old, single, has a 3 year old child, and she has worked in the C.D.I. as an educator for 9 years. She lives and works in Juigalpa. She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as: stone, cement, and iron which will be used in the house where she lives, which is in her and two of her brothers names. It has been a struggle for Danixa to get ahead as she is a single mother and supporting her family is something she has to do alone, but little by little she is making an investment in her home, and she hopes that with a few years she will be able to see her house completed in order to give her daughter a deserving home, and also like all single mothers she hopes to provide an education to her small daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room of her home

loans.name: Huor's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan and there are six members. Mr. Huor S. is one member of the group and has been selected to be leader. Huor is 23 years old and he breeds pig to sell. Normally, he purchases piglets from other breeders and he sells them for slaughter after four months. Huor has been breeding pigs since 2005 and currently can earn around US$2.33 per day. He is married to Mrs. Nhem Beak and has four children. His wife is a roasted chicken seller in her local market. With his family growing from day to day, and needing to increase income, Huor wants to expand his amount of pigs to breed. Hence, he needs a loan of US$300 to purchase 10 pigs to breed.

The other five group members are:

1) Mrs. Sinan S., a young woman who sells groceries. She requests a loan of US$300 to purchase grocery inventory to sell.

2) Mr. Ret L., who breeds pigs to sell and requests a loan of US$300 to purchase more pigs to breed.

3) Mr. Kan K., who is a farmer and requests a loan of US$300 to pay for plowing farmland to grow vegetables and fruit trees.

4) Mr. Tey T., who is a farmer and sells chopped wood as well. He requests a loan of US$300 to purchase a machine to chop wood to sell.

5) Mrs. Sophal P., who grows vegetables to sell and requests a loan of US$300 for a pump to use for her vegetable crop.

This group of people live in Paksneng Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase 10 pigs to breed

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Met P. is the group leader of six who all live in Veal Thom village in Kandal Province. She is a tailor in the local village. In this business, she can make a small income to support her family. She is a 54-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a teacher while the youngest one is a 29-year-old university student.  Mrs. Met P. does not have enough money to pay for the school fees for her youngest child so she is asking for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Ehouloume

texts.en:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Ehouloume G. sells drinks in a small stall on the side of a busy road full of motorcycles in Cotonou. Ehouloume sells a large selection of drinks; including soda, beer, liquor, and bottled water for the thirsty inhabitants of the neighborhood. Ehouloume has sold drinks for three years and has one employee, Bridgitte. Ehouloume has some 15 loyal clients who buy large quantities of drinks, in addition to the local passersby in the street.

With her current loan, Ehouloume will stock up on supplies. Ehouloume also has another business selling clothes and shoes at her house. With future loans, she would like to enlarge her home business.

loans.use: Purchase of various drinks

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta F., 22, is married with 1 child.  She has many years of experience in the taxi stand business. She provides taxi services to the villagers and general public 7 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 650 Tala (about $270 USD).  SPBD loans are Elisapeta’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy car parts to repair her taxi.

loans.use: Purchase timing belt, tires and rims for her taxi

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en: Vutha N., 22, lives in Sa Ang district, Phnom Penh. She grows vegetables and weaves scarves to earn approximately US$ 3 every day. Her husband grows rice and vegetables and makes about US$ 2 a day. This couple has three children, two of whom are students and one weaves at home. Mrs. Vutha is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to purchase more silk to weave more scarves and buy fertilizer to put on her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase silk and fertilizer

loans.name: Yonn

texts.en: Mrs. Yonn K. is a villager in Krang Chhoeur Neang village in Takeo province. She is a pork seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Phorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a pig breeder. Since his pig business is doing well, he wants to expand it; thus, Mrs. Yonn K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more pigs for breeding to earn more income. She is a 33-year-old mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for breeding

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to three daughters and three sons. The first five children are all in the basic school while the last-born has yet to start school. She lives with the children and her husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming whereas some of the women are into trading activities. Her husband is a cocoa and palm-nut farmer.

Vero is a fishmonger. She procures fresh fish and smokes it herself. She also fries some fish for sale. She sells on a table in the market square but distributes the greater part to retailers and food vendors in and around her community.

Vero procures fresh fish from cold stores in the nearby cities. She has been in business for four years. Vero says she wants a loan to procure fresh fish in bulk. It is her dream to help her husband put up a structure for the family and to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Keila Patricia es una esforzada dama cuya labor es la venta de especies como lo son salsas diversas, salsas de tomate, mayonesa, vinagre, entre otras. A este negocio se dedica desde hace 15 años en su propia habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino.

Hoy en día el motive por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las especies y así ofertarla a sus clientes en su establecimiento en su municipio.
texts.en:
Keila Patricia is an enterprising woman whose work is the sale of goods such as various sauces, tomato sauces, mayonnaise and vinager, among others. She has worked in this business for 15 years out of her own home in the township of Ciudad Sandino.

At this time, the reason for which she has turned to Ceprodel is to apply for a loan for the purchase of goods and in this way offer them to her customers in her establishment in her town.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 49 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She sells provisions and bottles of wine. She has been in this business for a long time.She requests a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions and supplies of wine to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and supplies of wine to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly S. is a farmer. She is 59 years old and the mother of two children. She is a rice grower. Every day, she goes out to the field, working under the heat of the sun and feeling the wet soil to ensure a good harvest. She and her husband, Nicolas S., are working so hard to provide a good future for their children.

She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy two sacks of complete fertilizers. The loan will truly help her earn a better income for her family.

CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage to their clients.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of complete fertilizers

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.ru: Абдурасулова Хурсаной-молодая женщина 39-ти лет, замужем , имеет двоих детей.Хурсаной занимается изготовлением и продажей национальных блюд. Они с мужем имеют маленькую столовую на территории Центрального рынка Спитаменского района.Она начинала с продажи пирожков и бутербродов, постепенно расширив свой бизнес она увеличила ассортимент блюд. Сейчас у Хурсаной много постоянных клиентов.Это продавцы и посетители рынка .Хурсаной вместе со своим мужем мечтает открыть собственный ресторан в центре района.
texts.en:
Khursanoy A. is 39 years old, married and has two children. She is involved in preparing and selling traditional dishes. Together with her husband, Khursanoy owns a small café at the Central market in the Spitamen district. She started with selling pies and sandwiches, then gradually expanded her business and increased the assortment of dishes. Now Khursanoy has many loyal clients, among which are other sellers and market visitors. Khursanoy and her husband dream of opening their own restaurant at the district center.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is 21 years old. He is a small entrepreneur who sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many others in his grocery store, which he built one year ago. 

Today Samer is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

Samer is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Mrs. C. lives at Upper Langub, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married, and blessed with two children who are of school-age.
