Mrs. C. owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than twenty-one years, and earns 2,100 PHP per month.

Mrs. C. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC.

Mrs. C. is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 16th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Martha Kemuma

texts.en:
Martha N. is a 36-year-old farmer in Nyamusi, Nyanza Province. She is married to Charles who is a primary school teacher and they have five children. Martha has been running a general store for the last twelve years and it has proved to be a profitable business. 

This is her second loan from KADET, which was approved after she successfully completed repaying her first one. She hopes to expand her business with the money from this loan by increasing her stock, expanding it to a wholesale shop, and in future diversifying to hardware sales. 


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To add more stock and diversify into selling hardware

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en:
Tunzala is the mother of two children. She was born in 1980. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, and she is now settled in Absheron region. She is a teacher and has been in this business for five years.

Tunzala teaches students at home also and now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy computers and a printer for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy computers and a printer for her teaching business

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en: Barikisu is a forty-three year old business woman. She is wife and mother of four children. Currently two of her children are in school and the other two are working. She trades in native sandals, kente, smocks, stools, beads etc. these items are mostly used by chiefs in Ghana. She wants to use the loan to purchase bulk kente, smocks, royal stools,etc. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: To buy kente, smocks, native sandals.

loans.name: Dương's Group

texts.en:
T. Dương Thị (20213040007), 57 and living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh, is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by SEDA. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, they each are responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Giữa 03 (3).

T., a married mother of two school-aged children, operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from selling confectionery products in the local community. Engaged in this business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month.

In 2009, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 2.242.000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 2.950.000 VND which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be her second loan from SEDA, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About the Other Borrower in the Group: Nguyễn Thị X. (20213040013) is a 36-year-old female requesting a 3.186.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Dương Thị (20213040007) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cầu Giữa 03 (3). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2009, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.242.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 2.950.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị X. (20213040013) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.186.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Tamaraneh Ii Group

texts.en:
This is Issa K., Henry B. C. and John K. of the Tamaraneh group II. Tamaraneh is a Temne phrase meaning “Let us help each other”.  This will be the fourth loan they are receiving from Kiva Lenders through SMT. Previous loans have been very helpful to these entrepreneurs. With previous loans, their businesses expanded, their profit margin increased and consequently, their standard of living also improved. They have repaid their last loan successfully and they now want a new loan. They are thus requesting a new loan of Le 2,400,000.00 to further strengthen their businesses.

Issa K. (left) is the leader of the group. Issa was born in Magburaka town about forty years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have five children who are attending secondary and primary schools. Issa sells building materials for more than ten years now. With this loan, he will further expand his business by buying more building materials to include into his stall.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen sells fried beef by hawking it within her community in Sapele, Delta State, Nigeria.  A hard-working woman, she purchases the beef in the market and then fries it  by herself to sell. Queen is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more beef to fry and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more beef to fry and sell

loans.name: Evelyn Pamela

texts.es:
Evelyn es una socia dinámica y trabajadora que se esfuerza por superarse, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 25 años, es madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad,  se dedica al  alquiler de motocarro y también es cosmetóloga, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es profesor de educación. Evelyn es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al 2000” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue  de 300 soles, que utilizó en la compra de politos para niños.
Ahora ella requiere un crédito de 1200 soles, que será utilizado para comprar otro motocarro de segundo uso, con el fin de alquilarlo. La meta de Evelyn es tener su salón de belleza, ya que esta estudiando en un centro de estudios de cosmetología.
texts.en:
Evelyn is one of our dynamic and hardworking members who strives for excellence. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. Evelyn is a cosmetology student and also rents out a motorcar (motorcycle taxi). She has the support of her husband, who is a professor of education. Two years ago, she joined the Communal Bank “Mujeres al 2000”. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy children’s polo shirts.

Evelyn is now requesting a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy another secondhand motorcar, which she will use to generate rental income. Her goal is to open her own beauty salon since she is currently in cosmetology school.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a secondhand motorcar

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: El Sra. Marlene tiene  como  actividad economica principal,  la venta de ropa nueva, ella es una vendedora sin puesto fijo, ambulante. Su sueño es comprarse un puesto en el mercado para eso ella ahorra, ademas que el credito lo invertira como parte de pago para la adquisicion de un puesto en el mercado de El Torno. En la actualidad esta viviendo en la localidad de Santa Martha junto a su esposo, que se dedica a la  actividad de el trasporte; tienen dos hijos están en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Marlene sells new clothing but does not have a fixed stall from which to sell; she moves from place to place. Her dream is to buy a stall in the market. She will use her savings, in addition to this loan, to buy a stall in the el Torno market. She currently lives with her husband, who works in transportation, and their two school-age children in Santa Martha.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stall in the market.

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye D. est une femme de 53, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KOUNKANE depuis 3 ans et y a réalisé de belles performances en terme de crédit et d'épargne. Elle développe une activité de petit commerce: elle vend de la pâte d'arachide, de l'encens emballé dans des sachets plastiques, des bijoux, de la pâte d'arachide en faisant du porte-à-porte. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye D., aged 53, is married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the village bank Kounkané for three years and has performed well in terms of loans and savings. She is active in a small business, namely she hawks peanut butter, incense packed in small plastic bags and jewelry. She helps her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her investment capacity

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Margret is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a journalist. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Madres Unidas del barrio Caacupemi de la ciudad de Aregua, se forma a causa de que integrantes del comité Mujeres unidas del mismo barrio invitaron a sus vecinas a integrarse en el comité y viendo que la cantidad de integrantes sobrepasaba la cantidad máxima requerida, decidieron formar un nuevo comité. 
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y esta conformado por 21 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Gloria A. de dedica a la venta de frutas y dulces e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para el incremento de su negocio. 

La señora Rosa L. se dedica venta de bijouterie e invirtió el dinero en la compra de bijouterie para venta de sus productos.

La señora Cirila V. se dedica a la venta de hierbas medicinales e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para su venta.

La señora Juana F. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio. 

La señora Daysi O.  tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio. 

La señora Delia F. se dedica venta de mercadería para despensas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos tales como azúcar, yerba, harina, leche, papel higiénico, pañales entre otros, al por mayor.

La señora María Lourdes O. se dedica a la venta de golosinas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la 
venta de sus productos.

La señora María Nilce M.  se dedica al reciclaje e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la venta y compra de los mismos.

La señora Eugenia G. se dedica a la venta de golosinas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mas mercaderías para su venta posterior. 

La señora Amada A. se dedica a la venta de golosinas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mas mercaderías para su venta posterior. 

La señora María Elizabeth M. se dedica al reciclaje e invirtió el dinero en la compra y venta de plásticos.

La señora Gabina U. se dedica a la venta de golosinas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mas mercaderías para su venta posterior. 

La señora Emiliana N. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de prendas varias para su venta posterior.

La señora Noemi M. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de prendas varias para su venta posterior.

La señora María Casilda O. dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtio el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Cintia L. se dedica venta de mercadería para despensas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos tales como azúcar, yerba, harina, leche, papel higiénico, pañales entre otros, al por mayor.

La señora Susana N. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Mabel U. se dedica a la venta de helados e invirtió el dinero en la compra al por mayor en variedad de sabores para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Miryans L.  se dedica a la venta de frutas e invirtió el dinero en la compra al por mayor de frutas varias para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Sonia V. se dedica a la venta de frutas e invirtió el dinero en la compra al por mayor de frutas varias para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Sara V. se dedica a la venta de sabanas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de telas e hilos para la confección y venta de las mismas.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Madres Unidas (Mothers United) group from the Caacupemi neighborhood in the city of Arequa formed because the women of the Mujeres United (Women United) group from the same neighborhood invited their neighbors to join them but seeing as the quanity of participants was more than the allowed limit, they decided to form a new group. Currently the group is in its fifth loan cycle of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya and is made up of 21 members who use the loan proceeds for different activities. Mrs. Gloria A. sells fruit and candy and used the loan to purchase goods to expand her business. Mrs. Rosa L. sells jewelry and she used to loan to purchase more inventory. Mrs. Cirila V. sells medicinal herbs and she used the loan to purchase more goods to sell. Mrs. Juana F. has a grocery store and she used the loan to buy wholesale merchandise to expand her business. Mrs. Daysi O. has a grocery store and she used the loan to buy wholesale merchandise to expand her business. Mrs. Delia F. sells merchandise to grocery stores and she used the loan to buy products on a wholesale basis such as sugar, herbs, flour, milk, toilet paper and diapers among other things. Mrs. María Lourdes O. sells candies and she used the loan to buy more goods to sell. Mrs. María Nilce M. works in recycling and she used the loan for buying and selling recycled goods. Mrs. Eugenia G. sells candies and she used the loan to buy more merchandise to sell. Mrs. Amada A. sells candies and she used the loan to buy more merchandise to sell. Mrs. María Elizabeth M. works in recycling and she used the loan for buying and selling plastic. Mrs. Gabina U. sells candies and she used the loan to buy more merchandise to sell. Mrs. Emiliana N. sells clothing and she used the loan to buy more garments to sell. Mrs. Noemi M. sells clothing and she used the loan to buy more garments to sell Mrs. María Casilda O. sells food and she used the loan to buy ingredients for food preparation. Mrs. Cintia L. sells merchandise to grocery stores and she used the loan to buy products on a wholesale basis such as sugar, spices, flour, milk, toilet paper and diapers among other things. Mrs. Susana N. has a grocery store and she used the loan to buy merchandise to expand her business. Mrs. Mabel U. sells ice cream and she used the loan to buy a variety of flavors on a wholesale basis. Mrs. Miryans L. sells fruit and she used the loan to buy fruit wholesale. Mrs. Sonia V. sells fruit and she used the loan to buy fruit wholesale. Mrs. Sara V. sells sheets and she used the loan to buy cloth and thread to make the sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables, candies, jewelry, medicinal herbs, meat, bakery goods, milk, sugar, flour, spices, plastics and other items

loans.name: Marie Jovana

texts.es:
La Sra. Marie Jovana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Brigada Ramírez”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años tiene 03 hijos ya  independientes.  

Marie Jovana, lleva 12 años en el negocio, es una mujer trabajadora y con su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Cosméticos de la línea Esika, y Oriflame, sin tener que tener un jefe y horario. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada, ella vende al contado y al crédito con pagos de manera diaria, semanal quincenal o mensual.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00, comprará productos de belleza como: colonias, esmaltes, bisutería como aretes, collares y anillos, así como perfumes para varón que salen en ofertas, quiere tener surtido su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Marie Jovana, sueña con crecer en este negocio y llegar a ser una vendedora estrella para ganar buenos premios. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Marie Jovana belongs to the community banking group "Brigada Ramirez" in the Lamas District, Lamas Province, and Department (State) of San Martin. She's a live-in partner who is 32 years old and has three grown children, who are living independently. Marie Jovana has worked in this business for 12 years. She's always been known as a hard-working woman with a fighting spirit and she has desires to get ahead through her own means. This has paid off and allowed her to start her own business of cosmetic sales, including the Esika and Oriflame lines, without having to have a boss and set hours. Little by little, she has become well-known among her cilents, and today she tells us that she is doing very well in this line of business. Nowadays, she has a loyal following. She takes cash and credit, accepting daily, weekly, bi-monthly or monthly payments. With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy beauty products like: colognes and nail polish, costume jewelry like earrings, necklaces and rings, as well as colognes for men that go on sale. She wants to have a well-stocked business and provide good service to her clients so that they can find what they need. Maria Jovana dreams of growing this business and becoming a star saleswoman so she can win great prizes. She's grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for also helping many women who want to develop themselves personally and in business.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Charis

texts.en:
Charis C. is 28 years old. She is married to 40-year-old Edwin C., who is a fisherman and bamboo set maker. The age gap is not a hindrance to their love or to their fighting the challenges of poverty in their life. She and her husband hope to have children in the future. The partners are both strong and full of courage to elevate themselves out of poverty. They live in the Coastal place of Talim Island, Rizal Province in the Philippines.

In 2009, they got the idea of joining ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), which means ”To rise up from poverty”, an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. She was given hope and the opportunity to acquire working capital, so she now runs her fishing business. The business has brought them good profits. Currently, on her second loan, she proposes the amount of 10,000 PHP as additional capital to pay for two sets of "Baklad" (fishing materials made of fishnet for creating fish pens), which cost 5,000 PHP each.

Charis has simple dreams in life. She would like to have a durable, concrete house for themselves and for her future children. She also dreams of expanding the fishing business. With the service offered by ASHI, she believes that her dreams will come true. The couple is thankful that there is ASHI service in their village.

loans.use: to buy materials for making "baklad" (fish pens).

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is 56 years old and is from Esicharai in Kakamega. She is married to Reuben Lumwanji and they have three children who are in college.

Rose has a retail shop and is running out of things in her shop - thus the need of acquiring a loan to help her add more stock. She has taken two previous loans from KADET and this will be her third. She is looking for Kiva lenders to assist her with funds to be able to buy a sack of sugar, cooking fat, paraffin (kerosene), three crates of soda and washing basins to add to her existing stock.

Rose has been running her business for some years and out of it she was able to pay school fees for her children until they completed high school. She has a huge clientele since her shop is the only one around the neighborhood and so she faces no competition. 

Rose hopes to diversify into a hotel (restaurant) business in the future and even buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To add stock to her shop

loans.name: Konie

texts.en:
This is Konie C.. She is 50 years old and a widow who lives with her children in Tegbeh town in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. Konie has six children: two boys and four girls, three of whom are in college and the last three are in the secondary school.

Konie sells palm oil, pepper, tomatoes, salt, and matches in Tegbeh town market. She has been a client of LAPO, SL for over two years now as a member of a credit union (a loan group that serves as collateral and guarantor for LAPO, SL clients). She has taken four previous loans since joining. With her previous loans she bought the same types of goods for sale and uses the profit to support her children's education.

This time, Konie is seeking a loan of 1,500,000 leones to enable her to buy a deep freezer for the sale of cold drinks to add to her previous business and to make good profits that will change her life and that of her family forever.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory and a deep freezer for cold drinks

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA EULOGIA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE BALONES PARA NIÑOS DE GOMA Y CUERO DESDE HACE NUEVE AÑOS, TAMBIEN TIENE SU PUESTO EN EL MERCADO AGUSTIN LOPEZ DE LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA, LA SEÑORA ES MUY ANTIGUA EN LA INSTITUCION, ESTA EN UN BANCO DE EMPRENDIMIENTO VILLA PARAISO, ELLA ES LIDER DE SU GRUPO DONDE HA DEMOSTRADO SER MUY RESPONSABLE. LOS CREDITOS LO UTILIZA PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIAL. LA SRA. EULOGIA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE HIJOS PEQUEÑOS ES TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Eulogia has been making rubber balls for children for nine years. She also has her own stall in the Agustín López Martket in the city of Cochabamba. She has been with the institution for a long time. She is in the “Villa Paraíso” entrepreneur’s bank. She is the leader of her group and she has shown herself to be very responsible. She uses the loans to buy materials. Eulogia is married and she has young children. She is hardworking and responsible. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have shown by granting her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather and other materials

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie C. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lanie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lanie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Lanie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 06 Thieu Phu _ Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Tien L. T. (9) is a 48 year-old femaL. living in the town of Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa. Tien is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06 Thieu Phu _ Thieu Hoa (06 Thieu Phu _ Thieu Hoa).

Tien is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Tien owns & operates a general store. She sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Tien has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007 Tien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Tien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Tien from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Thach (10) is a 60 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  L. T. Nga (22) is a 36 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tien L. T. (9) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Tien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06 Thieu Phu _ Thieu Hoa (06 Thieu Phu _ Thieu Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tien kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Tien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Thach (10) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Nga (22) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine L. is from the city of San Jose Santiago. She is 37 years old. Josephine is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Josephine L.'s group.

Josephine is married and has 3 school-aged children. Josephine owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mayra Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora Mayra es socia del Banco Comunal Damas en Progreso desde hace 2 ciclos, es madre de dos niños, tiene de casada 4 años se conoció con su esposo en la provincia del Guayas,  luego se casaron y se radicaron en la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Nuestra socia Mayra fue motivada por una amiga para que ingrese al Banco Comunal, esta muy satisfecha trabajando con los créditos en su negocio, que consiste en la venta de arroz por saquillos, en su propia casa tiene un pequeña bodega, el esposo es el que se encarga del negocio, el viaja hasta la provincia del Guayas a comprar a los distribuidores los quintales el arroz, desde hace 1 año están dedicados a este negocio y les ha ido muy bien, la manera de vender de estos esposos es la siguiente, todos los días ponen una mesa en las afuera de su casa y ahí venden por libra el arroz o como el cliente pida.

La señora Mayra con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en mas quintales de arroz, todas la semanas tiene el esposo que viajar e invertir en 30 sacos de arroz, una vez que tiene el arroz lo pesan y lo comparten en diferentes saquillos, dependiendo de la exigencia de sus clientes, todo se  vende.

Para nuestra señora Mayra es maravilloso saber que las cosas en su negocio marchan bien y que se da tiempo para poder cuidar a sus hijos que están de 2 y 4 años y es por ellos que trabaja,  para poder cumplir el sueño de obtener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mayra has been a member of the Damas en Progreso community bank for 2 loan cycles. She is a mother of two and has been married for 4 years. She and her husband met in Guayas province, got married and settled in the city of Portoviejo. A friend encouraged her to join the community bank, and she is very satisfied with working with credit in her business. She sells rice in little sacks and has a small store in her own home. Her husband takes charge of the business, and travels to Guayas to buy rice in quintals (100 kg measurements) from distributors. They have done this for 1 year and it is going very well. Every day they set up a table outside of their house and sell rice by the pound, or however the client requests it. With this loan, Mayra will be able to invest in more rice. Every week her husband has to travel and invest in 30 bags of rice; once they have it, they weigh it and divide it into different bags, depending on demand. They sell it all. It is wonderful to know that her business is going well. It gives Mayra time to take care of their children, who are 2 and 4. She works for them: to be able to achieve the dream of owning their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Mrs. Nhor C., 48, is a villager who lives in Phnum Lonteah village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sok Rath, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. To support their farm, Mrs. Nhor C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay a laborer to plow her farm. Aside from farming, Mrs. Nhor C. also sells cakes to add to her farming income and support her family. The couple has three children; one is student and one is a cattle breeder while the youngest one is 7 years old and not yet a student.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pay for laborer to plow her farm.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira G., 45 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. She is a farmer and has been engaged in her business for more than fourteen years now. She cultivates her land for rice crops. She sells her harvest at the market. She also grows pigs for fattening and sale. 

Mira joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mira has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also feed for the pigs. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Mira from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure and also feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es: Ruth Elizabeth B. G. de 37 años de edad, es una señora muy emprendedora la cual posee su propio negocio por medio del cual desea mucho salir adelante. Vive junto a sus padres en el departamento de San Salvador. Ruth posee una librería y fotocopiadora, en la cual trabaja muy duro desde hace un año y medio, gracias a la cual ha logrado superarse y hacer realidad su sueño de contar con un negocio propio y así mismo poseer una fuente de ingresos fijos con la cual sobrevivir y brindarle todo lo mejor a sus padres. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, en donde poco a poco ha logrado ir surtiendo con lo más esencial y necesario, como cuadernos, papelería, lápices, y otros accesorios como bolsas para regalo, listones, chongas y otros productos más. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda hacer crecer aún más su negocio incluyendo más productos como plastilina, pegamentos, lápices de colores, mayor variedad de papel y muchos otros productos más los cuales pueda comercializar con las personas que residen en los alrededores de su hogar, y así de esta manera poder ser la primera opción dentro sus clientes y vecinos, la cual es la principal meta de Ruth para poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ruth Elizabeth B. G., 37, is a very enterprising woman who owns her own business and hopes to succeed with it. She lives with her parents in San Salvador department. Ruth has a stationery store and a photocopy machine. She has been working hard at this for a year and a half. Thanks to this effort she has managed to get ahead and have the dream of having her own business with which to earn her own income to survive and provide for her parents come true. Her store is located in her home. She has managed to gradually stock it with the most essential and necessary items like: notebooks, paper goods, pencils and other accessories like gift bags, ribbons, beads, etc. She is asking for funds in order to expand her business even more adding stock items like modeling clay, glue, colored pencils, a larger variety of paper goods and many other products that she can sell to the people living nearby so that she can become the first choice of her customers and neighbors. This is Ruth’s main goal in order to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock stationery items.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 50 years old and  married with six children between the ages of 9 and 20. Flora makes a living by selling drinks made from sorghum. This is her tenth successful year in the business. Her business hours are from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

Flora needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, Flora will purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make into drinks. With the use of this loan, Flora will also start wholesaling to retailers who operate the same business. If successful, Flora will hopefully earn a lot of money and this income will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business and start saving for a better future for her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of sorghum to make into drinks for sale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad y en este nuevo ciclo es la presidenta D. su Banco Comunal y lo que mas le agrada D. su Banco son las capacitaciones y el inventivo al ahorro, Margarita es casada y tiene 8 hijos D. los cuales solo uno le falta D. terminar la universidad.
Margarita tiene un recreo llamado el Amigo que esta ubicado en el centro D. la ciudad, en donD. venD. comida típica, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, mientras los demás días venD. menú, negocio que atienD. con la ayuda D. sus hijos.
Margarita solicita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. mesas y sillas.
Margarita sueña con mejorar su negocio, tener mas clientes y estar bien D. salud.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “Dignidad” (Dignity). She serves as president of her Communal Bank and is participating in her ninth loan cycle. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the training classes and the incentive to save. Margarita is married and has eight children, of whom only one failed to complete university.

She has a lounge called “El Amigo” (The Friend) located in the central part of the city. There she sells traditional food on Saturdays and Sundays. On other days she sells menu items. Her children help her with managing the business.

Margarita needs a loan of 3000 PEN to invest in the purchase of tables and chairs. She dreams of improving her business, attracting more customers, and maintaining good health.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Cecilia Matilde

texts.es:
Cecilia de 44 años, ella tiene un salón de belleza en la parte delantera de su casa, esta separada pero tiene 4 hijos, y viven en el suburbio de Guayaquil. 

Inicio con el negocio cortando cabello y pintando uñas, con sus ahorros puso un local y algunos instrumento para el salón de belleza, poco a poco y con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores pudo readecuar su casa para ubicar salón de belleza. Ahora trabaja desde las 09h00pm hasta las 23h00pm todos días. 

Para poder agrandar su negocio ella necesita comprar con el préstamo esmaltes, maquinas. En el futuro quiere incrementar su familia y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years old and operates a beauty parlor in the front part of her house. She is separated from her spouse and has four children. They live in Suburbio de Guayaquil.

Cecilia started her business by cutting hair and painting nails. With her savings, she was able to create her own shop and purchase equipment for her beauty salon. Little by little and with the help of her adult children, she was able to remodel her house so that she could place her beauty salon there. Now she works every day from 9am until 11pm.

In order to expand her business, Cecilia needs a loan to buy nail polishes and machines. In the future, she wants to grow her family and build a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nail polishes & machines

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has a wife and two children. This hardworking man is a computer technician, and his business is a repair center. He found the need to do service in his community and used his knowledge to serve people and sell them the pieces they need to have better equipment. 

He will use this loan to buy computer supplies like memory, hard drives, video and sound cards, motherboards, discs and others. Emmanuel is excited to be taking out his third loan with the Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He will use the profits to invest in his business and save, as he is planning to have his own house.

He became interested in and motivated others to join Esperanza because of the good things he heard that it was doing in his community and other nearby areas, especially the low interest. Compared to others around, Esperanza's rates are very low and with this opportunity he can make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies (memory, hard drives, video and sound cards, motherboards, discs)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is a 28 year-old food kiosk owner and charcoal dealer in Shanzu Mombasa married to Livingstone Nyamawi. She has been in this business for two years and makes a good income. She is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to purchase sacks of charcoal, bails of maize flour and to carry out renovations in her kiosk.

Agnes has no history with any other MFI. She would use the anticipated profit to expand her business and dreams of opening up a hotel in the future. She is very determined and hard-working lady.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and maize flour, and renovate her kiosk

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 35 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años, vende animales entre porcino y ovino, actividad que empieza en conseguir estos animales de granjas alejadas, del cual los compra y luego procura mantenerlos en buen estado hasta que tengan el peso exacto para ser vendidos los fines de semana en la ferias ganaderas de su comunidad, es así que como se genera ingresos semanales. Sin embargo durante los demás días de la semana opta por  trabajar cuidando niños en su casa, ya que en  ocasiones sus vecino le solicita este servio. Por otro lado su madre la apoya en el negocio de venta de animales, ya que este trabajo le es bastante rentable y más cuando es época de festividades. Por tal razón, Angélica desea seguir vendiendo animales y tener más capital de trabajo. Es la crédito número 16 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más animales, de esa manera podrá incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Angélica is 35 years old, and lives with her two children and her husband in her own home. For 4 years she has been selling pigs and sheep. First she buys animals from farms and then tries to keep them in good condition until they reach exactly the right weight to be sold at the weekend livestock markets in her community. This is how she makes her weekly income. However, during the other days of the week, she works looking after children in her home, as her neighbors sometimes ask her to do this for them. On the other hand, her mother helps her with selling the animals and this work is quite profitable, especially during the holiday season. For this reason, Angélica wants to keep selling animals and to have more working capital. This is her 16th loan from MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support and is very responsible about her repayments. She also likes being part of the community bank because all the members are people that she knows, who are responsible and very supportive. She is very grateful to the people who will be managing the loan, which will be very useful in advancing her business. She will use the loan to buy more animals and in this way she will be able to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Bayraa

texts.en:
Bayraa is 52 years old, lives in a small house with his wife, daughter and grandchild in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Two children are all grown up but the youngest daughter still lives in her parents' house.  She will go to university in Korea, leaving her baby with her parents this spring. The eldest daughter is separated from them.

In the year 2000, he started his transportation business with capital of 2.500,000 MNT and purchased a van for transporting people in the city. After a while, the government plans to enact a law forbidding the use of vans for transportation in the city. Therefore, Bayraa has purchased another used bus from the auto transportation service and used a loan from us.

He is renting one of his buses to someone else and his wife works along with him, collecting fares and announcing stops as he drives. Bayraa is  operating his other bus with someone he pays. He is a very clever, responsible and hardworking person.

Bayraa is planning to build a big house for his family. The loan will be used to purchase a new motor and four wheels to keep his buses operating efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase a new bus motor and four wheels to keep his buses operating efficiently.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses M. is 36 years old. He operates a shop selling electrical appliances to his customers in Vikwatani Mombasa. He is married to Purity and together they are blessed with one child. He has been in this business for the last 14 years and has done great. He is requesting his first loan from KADET to purchase more electrical appliances and will use the anticipated profits to boost his business. Moses hopes to buy a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To  purchase more electrical appliances.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 24 años, convive con Nilton, de 30 años. Producto de su amor, nació Luis, de 4 años de edad. En unión familiar, los tres viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la comunidad Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Cuando era niña, su papá tenia una cajonería (fábrica de cajas de madera que se utiliza para envasar frutas), en ahí aprendió este oficio y desde entonces hasta hoy, se dedica a ello, pero no trabaja para su padre, los constantes problemas de enfermedad que sufría le impidieron surgir y, tubo que cerrar. Ahora Jessica trabaja, para terceros, donde todas las mañanas realiza un promedio de 300 cajones diarios, los cuales después se comercializa a diferentes partes del país. Pero lo que más le gusta a Jessica, es dedicarse íntegramente en sus sombríos de café y plátanos. Ya tienen 2 años dedicándose a ello y se siente feliz y realizada, ya que es “su propio negocio”, afirma. Lo que le molesta a ella es la lejanía de su terreno agrícola, donde tiene que caminar muchas horas para poder llegar, pero consiente de sus buenos ingresos ella está ahorrando para comprar su casa propia. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y, como integrante nueva de su banco comunal; se siente satisfecha de los logros alcanzados en esté corto tiempo y, espera que más adelante pueda lograr todos sus objetivos. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 200 mamones de isla (plantas de plátano), que oscila entre un nuevo sol por unidad. Con ello podrá renovar su producción de plátano.
texts.en: Jessica, 24, lives with Nilton, 30. The product of their love, Luis, was born, and is 4 years old. In family union, the three live in a rented home, located in the community of Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian rainforest). When she was a child, her father had a "cajonería" (a factory making wooden crates used for packing fruit), in there she learnt this trade and from then right up to today, she has done this, but she doesn't work for her father, the constant health problems that he suffered prevented this from arising, and he had to shut. Now Jessica works for third parties, where every morning she makes an average of 300 crates daily, which are sold in different parts of the country. But what Jessica likes the most, is to immerse herself entirely her plantings of coffee and plantain trees. She has been doing this for 2 years and she feels happy and fulfilled, since this is “her own business”, she states. What bothers her is the remoteness of her farming land, as she has to walk for many hours to get there, but it gives her a good income and she is saving to buy her own home. This is the second loan with MFP and, as a new member of her communal bank; she is satisfied with the successes achieved in this short time and, she hopes that in the future she can achieve all her goals. On receiving the requested loan she is planning to buy 200 "mamones de isla" (plantain plants), which are about one nuevo sol per unit. With it she can renew her plantain production.

loans.use: To purchase 200 plantain plants.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina S. lives in the town of Trinidad. She is 27 years old, married and has three children who are 8, 6 and 3 years old. She and her husband make a living by vulcanizing rubber, and her husband also occasionally provides motorcycle transportation to people who live in their town. She and her husband have worked hard to build their business and sustain their family.

Cristina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to buy the materials they need to provide services to their customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to to continue expanding it.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem R., 45, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-ankorean temples. Nhem sells porridge, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.

Nhem is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase dishes and tents to rent for the events in the village, and plans to use any additional profit to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy dishes and tents to rent for events in the village

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Sylvia has a grocery business, which she has had for less than a year.
To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 1,600,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for her store. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Sylvia hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her store

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Balla C.  est âgé de 40 ans et vit avec ses 4 enfants et son épouse dans une famille monogame à Dangassa, un des villages de la préfecture  de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
Balla C. n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé ses 4 prêts précédents il est à son cinquième individuel  qui servira à acheter, 5 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de Dangassa et environnants qu’il gardera jusqu’à ce que les produits soient sur le marché. Il vend  essentiellement, sur place en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
Balla C. espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Balla C. is 40 years old and he lives with his 4 children and his wife as a monogamous family in Dangassa. It is one of the villages in the Kati prefecture in the region of Koulikoro. 

Balla C. did not have the opportunity to go to school. At a very young age he became interested in revenue-generating activities such as the buying and selling of cereal grains. He learned this trade from his maternal uncle, who was once a great cereal grains merchant.

In order to satisfy his every growing clientele, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Following the successful repayment of the previous 4 loans, he is now on his fifth individual loan and he will use it to purchase 5 tons of cereal grains (corn, beans, millet, and fonio seed) from the producers in Dangassa and surrounding areas. He will store the grains until the products are sold in the market. He sells primarily in wholesale to a clientele made up of retailers who travel from large cities, such as Bamako. 

Balla C. expects to earn a monthly income of 75.000 FCFA which will be used to repay this loan and the remaining portion will be reinvested into the business.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Don Vidal, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y la crianza de cerdos, vive con su esposa y sus hijos que son cuatro de 12, 14, 17 y 19 años de edad, don Vidal se dedica a la siembra de frijol y maíz, también a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 10 años, el comercializa en el tiangue de Corinto los días miércoles  y Domingos.
El está solicitando un préstamo para comprar cerdos y alimento para engordarlos, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar una buena inversión que en un futuro le generara ganancias para su propia vida. El sueño de él es comprar un terreno amplio donde pueda cultivar maíz y frijol, también trabajar por el desarrollo de sus hijos en la educación.
texts.en:
Mr. Vidal is 42 years old and lives in the Corinto department of Morazán. He cultivates corn and beans, and raises pigs. He lives with his wife and his four children of 12, 14, 17, and 19 years of age. Mr. Vidal has planted beans and corn, as well as raising pigs, for the last 10 years. He markets them in Corinto's small market on Wednesdays and Sundays.
He is requesting a loan to buy pigs and feed to fatten them. This loan will help him make a good investment which will generate earnings for him in the future. His dream is to buy a large plot of land where he can cultivate corn and beans, and also to work for the development of his childrens' education.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and feed (concentrated)

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is a twenty-six-year-old married man with one child living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his family and his dream is to build a permanent house as a residence. For five years he has been growing tomatoes and per season he is able to harvest twenty crates of tomatoes. He has challenges with transportation, and his dream is to harvest at least two hundred crates. Godwin needs the loan to buy sprays for his tomatoes.

loans.use: Buying spraying chemicals for his tomatoes

loans.name: Tamaraneh  5 Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamaraneh 5” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Hassan K.. Hassan is age 38; he was born in Kenema, where he is currently residing together with his wife and 3 children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending school. For 15 years now, Hassan has been selling house-building materials. With this loan, he will buy house-building materials in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials lin large quantity to add to his business

loans.name: Fortaleciendo Familias Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Fortaleciendo Familias” y está conformado por 20 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Villarrica. Todos ellos se dedican a diferentes rubros, específicamente, la venta de leña, abarrotes, ropa usada y nueva.
Virginia es la presidenta del banco y se encuentra en la foto en la primera fila, segunda del lado derecho, tiene cabello corto, usa anteojos y está un poco inclinada. Ella se dedica a la picaduría y venta de leña. Además transporta y distribuye la leña en su camioneta a sus clientes, que son muchos. 
Con éste préstamo comprará más leña, que la adquiere de los sectores rurales, en el campo específicamente. 
Sus metas son cambiarse de domicilio, ya que vive a 5 mil kilómetros de Villarrica, lo que le dificulta en su vida cotidiana, ya que debe trasladarse en camioneta y se encarecen todos sus gastos. Por ende sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, ya que éste le permitirá generar más ganancias y por ende concretará su proyecto. 
Virginia está muy agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo esperanza, además se siente muy contenta con las reuniones, ya que son muy amenas y disfruta mucho de la compañía de los demás emprendedores. 
Villarrica es una  ciudad al sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de La Araucanía. Es una ciudad pequeña, pero cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y turísticos, siendo uno de los principales centros de servicios del área cordillerana y principal centro turístico de la región, junto con Pucón. Durante los meses de verano se realizan numerosas actividades y eventos culturales, artísticos y deportivos, Además de las innumerables alternativas de Ecoturismo, Turismo Aventura y Etnoturismo.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Strengthening Families” and it is made up of twenty members that live in the city of Villarica. Each member has a different occupation such as selling firewood, groceries, used and new clothes, etc.
Virginia is the president of the bank. You can see her in the front line in the photo. She is the second one on the right. She has short hair, wears glasses and is kneeling a bit. She works buying and selling firewood. She also transports and distributes firewood in her pick-up truck to her customers, of which there are many. 
With this loan she will buy more firewood, which she buys in the rural sector, more specifically, in the countryside. 
Her goal is to move to a new house, as she lives five kilometers outside of Villarica. This causes difficulties in her daily life, as she has to commute in her truck and pay for all of these expenses. Nevertheless she would like to continue with her business, as it allows her to generate earnings and thus reach her goals.
Virginia is thankful for the loan that will be provided from a long distance. She is very happy with the meetings at the bank as they are very nice and she enjoys the company of the other business people.
Villarica is a city in southern Chile, located in the Araucania region. It is a small city but it has basic and tourist services. It is one of the main centers of the lumber industry and is a tourist attraction as it is near Pucón (where there is a famous lake and the Villarica volcano). During the summer months there are numerous activities and cultural, artistic and sporting events. Also it is a popular spot for ecotourism, adventure tourism and ethno tourism.

loans.use: To buy fuel/firewood

loans.name: Cruz Esrmeralda

texts.es:
Cruz Esmeralda, tiene 45 años de edad, es originaria  del pueblo El Dorado localizada a 3 kilómetros de la ciudad de Estelí, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos de 22,18 y 4 años de edad. Ella se dedica a destazar cerdos es un negocio familiar en donde la apoya su esposo y sus hijos también vende verduras y frutas  en  las acera de su hogar para ayudarse con los gastos alimenticios así mismo se dedica las tareas del hogar como ama de casa ,esta criando su pequeño nieto el cual ella misma cuida mientras su hija trabaja vendiendo carne de cerdo, su labor de ella comienza desde las 4 de la mañana hasta la noche sin horario fijo , lo hace con  la fe de lograr vender los mas que pueda y tener para el alimento diario de su familia.    
Solicita el préstamo para aumentar la compra y venta de cerdo. Con este crédito aumentaría sus ingresos a través de las ventas. Su próxima meta es mejorar su vivienda, quiere mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, comprar maquinaria moderna para destace de cerdo.
texts.en:
Cruz Esmeralda is 45 years old and from the village of El Dorado which is located 3 kilometers from the city of Estelí.  She is married and has 3 children aged 22, 18 and 4.  Cruz Esmeralda's business is butchering pigs.  This is a family business and she has the support of her husband and children.  She also sells fruit and vegetables on the sidewalk outside her home in order to help cover the family's food expenses.  In addition, she does her housework and raises her young grandson.  She looks after her grandson while her daughter works selling pork.

Cruz Esmeralda's work begins at 4.00am and she works until evening, but without fixed working hours.  She does her work with the faith that she will manage to sell as much as possible and be able to provide her family with their daily food.

Cruz Esmeralda is requesting this loan to increase her business buying pigs and selling pork.  With this loan, she will increase her income through improved sales.  Her next goal is to improve her home.  She would like to improve the infrastructure of her business and buy modern machinery for butchering pigs.

loans.use: to increase her business buying pigs and selling pork

loans.name: Deen United Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Deen United” group. They are small scale businessmen in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have requested a loan of SLL 800,000 each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and make better profit. 

Umar Deen F. is the leader of this group. Umar was born in Margburaka. The 35-year-old is married and has 2 children. Umar sells rice, palm-oil, groundnuts, etc., he has been doing this business for 11 years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, groundnuts, etc. in bulk to add to his business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Madame Adama Diakité est une femme mariée de 47 et mère de 3 enfants. Elle réside avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Dialanicoro de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne, très vite elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus. Elle a tenté plusieurs activités notamment, la vente de chaussures et tissus, mais sans réussite.
Elle décida alors d’accompagner son oncle dans ses activités afin d’apprendre auprès de lui la vente de céréales. Avec une expérience de plus de 10 années, elle maîtrise son activité. Elle mène son activité dans le grand marché de Bougouni. Pour agrandir son entreprise, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter; 1 tonne de maïs, 2 tonnes de petit mil et 2 tonnes de riz...
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants. Il est à son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les prêts précédent ont été correctement remboursés
La vente se fait au grand marché de Bougouni et une partie est vendue dans les différents villages les jours de marchés hebdomadaires.
Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour agrandir davantage  son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adama Diakité, 47 years old, is married with three children. She lives with her husband and children in the Dialanicoro district of Bougouni.
Not having been able to attend a modern school, she quickly started earning a living. She has tried different business activities, such as selling shoes and fabrics, but without success.

Then she decided to join her uncle’s cereals business in order to learn from him. Now, with over 10 years experience, she excels at her work. She sells cereals at the big market of Bougoni. In order to expand her business she decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy one ton [2200 lbs] of corn, two tons [4400 lbs] of millet and two tons [4400 lbs] of rice.

She stocks up in Bougoni and in the nearby villages. [She] is on her third loan with Soro Yiriwaso. All prior loans have been duly reimbursed. She sells at the big market of Bougouni, and partly also at weekly markets at different villages. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 60,000 West African francs, which will allow her to grow her business further

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: Aminatou est née 16 Août 1965 à Zagnanado, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Mariée à un couturier du nom de Chèfiou, Aminatou est mère de trois enfants, dont deux restent à sa charge. Parmi les enfants de Aminatou, certains sont scolarisés. Aminatou et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Aminatou a appris la couture. Aminatou exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de ses enfants. De façon secondaire, Aminatou vend des friperies. Aminatou achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Aminatou sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu.
texts.en: Aminatou was born on 16th August 1965 in Zagnanado in the Ouérné "département". She is married to a tailor by the name of Chèfiou and is mother to three children, two of whom are still her responsibility. Some of her children have attended school. Aminatou and her husband live with their children. Aminatou never attended school but learned how to sew. She has been carrying out this activity for the past fifteen years, which enables her to provide for her needs and those of her children. Animatou also sells second-hand clothing as a secondary activity. She buys her products in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. It is the second time that Animatou is asking for a loan from Alidé, with a view to increasing her business volume, her turnover and her income.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials and second-hand clothing

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 50 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 5 and 14. 

She sells goods such as sorghum and beans. She has five years of experience in her business and works from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day except Saturday. Speciose currently employs two people to help her. 

Speciose has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand the inventory of her goods (beans and sorghum). With the profits, Speciose will reinvest in her business, pay school fees for her children, and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sorghum and beans.

loans.name: Briginta

texts.en:
Briginta is a single woman with eight children, three boys and five girls. Two children are grown while four still attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, electricity, and clothing. 

For the past five years, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other fish sellers in the area. She dreams of establishing a vegetable stall in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase a frying pan and cooking oil, and repair her market stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a frying pan, some cooking oil, and to repair her market stall.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 32-year-old single male with one child living in a rented house in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a video hall where people can watch movies. He has been in this business for six years, having started with 800,000 shillings worth of capital. He now has 1,600,000 shillings. His hardship is lack of enough capital. His vision is business expansion, buying land and building a house for his family. Fred needs a loan to enable him to buy chairs and a flat screen for his video hall.

loans.use: To buy chairs and a flat screen for his video hall.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. Edith lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and school fees.
Edith has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days a week. Edith sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Edith include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only and also to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Marisol July

texts.en:
Marisol July is 40 years old and lives with her partner. She has two daughters, one of whom lives separately from her and one who lives with her while she completes university. Marisol July is the owner of a small grocery store in which she sells soft drinks, beer, snacks, and household necessities. In addition, she often sells food from her grocery store such as "chicharron"-fried pork commonly served with potatoes and corn. She has had her grocery store for over 14 years. She is asking for a loan in order to buy products for her grocery store such as beer, soft drinks, and snacks. 

Marisol July is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks, and snacks for her grocery store.

loans.name: Patricia  Lourdez

texts.es:
La señora  Patricia    tiene  treinta ochos años de edad , se dedica  a la venta  de joyas , es originaria de la localidad de Tetepec  estado de Oaxaca.
Tiene la cantidad  de  tres hijos una mujer  Luisa  y dos varones  Tadeo y José Luis .
Esta  muy contenta por el apoyo de su esposo Tadeo ,  quien le ayudo cuando apenas empezada con su negocio. 
 Esta  muy contenta  ya que le va muy bien en su negocio  ya que tiene muy buenos clientes  , y sus  mejores ventas  se dan en el mes de julio en las clausuras  y en  las comuniones y bautizos.
Es una señora muy trabajadora  aparte de vender joyas , también se dedica a vender  cena  ya que le va muy bien esta cerca de una escuela y van los niños y  maestros a cómprales de comer.
Ella pidió el préstamo para compara mas joyas ya que  las vende y obtiene  muy buenas ganancias.
Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios  y tengan un buen trabajo  y pongan   su propio negocio lo hagan mas grandes  y  lo administren.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte de ellos .
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia is 38 years old and sells jewelry for a living. She is originally from the town of Tetepc in the State of Oaxaca. Patricia has three children, a daughter named Luisa and two sons named Tadeo and José Luis. She is very pleased to have the support of her husband Tadeo, who helped her when she started her business. Patricia is happy that her business has done very well and that she has obtained very good customers. Her sales improved during the month of July as a result of promotion ceremonies, communions, and baptisms.

Patricia is a hardworking woman who does other things besides sell jewelry. She also does very well selling meals near a school. The children and teachers buy from her when they want something to eat.

She is requesting a loan to buy jewelry to sell so that she can obtain good earnings. One of her dreams is to see her children finish their studies, find a good job, and establish their own large businesses that they manage themselves. Patricia thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it has provided so that she can move forward and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for her business.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is a father of six children, the eldest of whom is 26 years old.  He is a rice farmer and has done this for the past 20 years. His parents taught him this type of farming.
He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.
