For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice farming.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a married man with three school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, he has operated a carpentry business, making tables, chairs and beds for sale in a shop to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation in his business. Alex dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, he wants to purchase more equipment for the carpentry business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is married, with 2 children. She is 37 years old and lives in Pereyra Village, Maningcol Ozamiz City.  Rosanna is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP14,999 to purchase equipment for her farm tractor.  Rosanna has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and 3 months. In the future, Rosanna hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her farm tractor

loans.name: Mercedes Del Rocío

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unidas Por Un Futuro Mejor se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Mercedes es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido para mejorar su negocio. Tiene 34  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4  hijos de 17, 14, 10 y 8 años, los dos mayores  estudian en  colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es maestro albañil.

Doña Mercedes trabaja en un hotel de Montecristi, allí realiza diversas actividades y trabaja de lunes a sábado hasta las 16h00, ella además de este trabajo también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y realiza sus ventas en sus tiempos libres, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada dia domingo. Lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los cosméticos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos, ella comprar los productos de oferta que son los que más ganancias le dejan.
 
Sus sueños son tener su propio hotel o un gran restaurante ya que le encanta la cocina.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Unidas por un Futuro Mejor" (United for a Better Future) community bank meet in Montecristi canton.  This canton is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are well known both at home and abroad.  It is the birthplace of the famous Panama hat. 

Mercedes is a founding member of this community bank and she likes it because the loans have helped her to improve her business.  She is 34 years old, married, and has four children from her marriage who are 17, 14, 10 and 8 years old.  Her two eldest are in high school and the younger ones are in elementary school.  Her husband is a master builder.

Mercedes works in a hotel in Montecristi where she carries out a number of activities.  She works from Monday to Saturday, until 4.00pm.  In addition to this work, she also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She makes her sales door to door in her free time.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every Sunday.  She has been in this business for three years and it is doing very well.  What she sells most of are cosmetics.

Mercedes will use this loan to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics.  She buys sale products as these make her the most profits.

Mercedes' dreams are to own her own hotel or a restaurant as she loves cooking.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Zoila Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal La Merced, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana (Cuenca), este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades. Mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Zoila tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 10 y 8 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo su camioneta realizando fletes, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de familiares.

La Señora. Zoila labora hace 15 años en una panadería, allí trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta el momento que termine de realizar sus tareas. Ella tiene hace 4 años  una tienda de comestibles, para la cual contrato una empleada que le paga un sueldo mensual, su tienda está abierta  desde 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una vecina,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad  para surtir su tienda.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the La Merced communal bank. She lives in the parish of Santa Ana (Cuenca). This place has a cold climate and its people raise animals and farm. Many work in the city in different activities. It maintains its culture and traditions in its small towns.

Zoila is 33 years old. She is married and has had 2 children from that marriage, aged 10 and 8. They go to a school in town. Her husband works as a driver and carries freight in his pickup truck. They do not have a house of their own and live in the home of relatives. 

Zoila has worked for 15 years in a bread bakery. She works there fron Mondays through Fridays from 8 in the morning until she finishes her tasks. For four years she has had a small grocery store and she pays an employee a monthly salary to work there. Her store is open from 6 in the morning until 9 at night.

This is her first loan with the communal bank and she was invited to join by a neighbor. She will invest the money from the loan in basic necessity products to stock her store.
 
Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy basic necessity products.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
The name of Ainura, 39, of Kerben village in the Jalal-Abad province of Kyrgyzstan, is well-known as a most successful progressive farmer of the district. Untiring efforts, strong management skills and patience helped her to attain this status. Being born in a typical farming family, Ainura used to help her father in land cultivation and cattle breeding. 

Ten years ago, she took full control of livestock left as a family heritage and since then has never looked back. 

Ainura invested 15,000 KGS in a purchase of young calves. Step by step she expanded her activities with expected returns and soon saw good economic gains from cattle reselling. Today she is a proud owner of one of the largest households in the district. 

Ainura’s next step in business promotion is dairy. She plans to distribute the generated milk products to local customers. Ainura hopes that the loan from Kiva lenders will allow her buy her first cow for the new business start-up. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Retailing grocery items to the people in her place of residence makes Josephine busy in her daily life. She has operated the business for almost seven years and has average sales of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) monthly. She has four children attending school so she needs to generate a good income in order to provide them a good education. 

Josephine is now 45 years old and married to Leopoldo, who is a tricycle driver. 

Josephine is now requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy shampoo, soap, sugar, milk, coffee, biscuits and soft drinks to sell in her store. 

In the future, Josephine would like to sell not only grocery items but also fruits and vegetables to boost her profits and allow her to continuously send her children to get a college education.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, sugar, milk, coffee, biscuits and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary Nyambura

texts.en: Mary Nyambura, 33, is married and has two children. She has been selling shoes and herbal medicine for the last fifteen years in the town of Nakuru. The business is facing the problem of high competition within the area. Mary is requesting a loan of KES 80,000 to increase her stock of shoes and medicine. In the five years to come, she sees herself as a major supplier of shoes and medicine at fair prices, to promote to a better life of her clients. Mary is innovative, honest, responsible and respectful.

loans.use: to increase stock of shoes and herbal medicine

loans.name: Mulimani C Young Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mulimani C Young Group in Western Kenya! Diana is the facilitator of the Mulimani C Young group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Diana takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's best prices and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield, harvesting 10 1/2 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Diana was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Diana and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Diana will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

 In 2012, the members of Mulimani C Young group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Diana is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Tum, 43, a mother of three single children, owns a business selling a variety of products from a booth at her house. She sells many things, such as sweets, soft drinks, biscuits, shampoos, and powders and other household products for the people in her community. She typically earns approximately $1.50 per day. Tum’s husband is a garment factory worker in Kampong Chhnang province. Tum wants to further help her family by producing palm juice from sugar palm trees. She need funds from Kiva to invest in this project. For this reason, she is taking out a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to buy a ladder for climbing sugar palm trees and bamboo containers for sugar palm juice as well. She is very pleased and appreciative to all lenders who kindly help in her business.

loans.use: to buy a ladder for climbing sugar palm trees and bamboo containers for sugar palm juice.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Carlos es Chapista (arreglo de movilidades, pintado) hace varios años,  vive en casa familiar en la casa de los Papás de su esposa Romelia,  el taller que tiene el cliente es en la casa de sus papás, ambos trabajan por el bienestar de su familia, desean mejorar sus ingresos , ya que desean un bienestar para sus hijos  El crédito lo invertirán en compra de algunas herramientas  para su taller de chapería y compra de equipo de sonido y algunos electrodomésticos, el  Sr. Carlos es una persona joven con ganas de superación agradecido con la institución por el trabajo brindado.
texts.en: Carlos has been a vehicle body repairman (vehicle repair and painting) for several years.  He lives in his parents’ house with his wife Romelia.  His repair shop is also located at his parents’.  They both work for their family’s wellbeing.  They hope to improve their income because they want wellbeing for their children.  They will use the loan to buy a few tools for the body shop and to buy sound equipment and some home appliances.  Carlos is a young person who very much wants to get ahead and he’s grateful to the institution for the work it’s provided.

loans.use: to buy tools for his workship and also a television set and sound equipment.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana lives in the village of Sartichala, East Georgia, with her family: husband Michael, 10-year-old son, 8-year-old daughter and mother-in-law (retired). Manana and Michael operate the family's agricultural business, which is their main source of income. The children attend school. 

The family has 10 milk cows and produces cheese. Michael takes their homemade cheese to Tbilisi and sells it to grocery stores. The family's total average monthly income is 1,000 GEL. 

Manana has requested a loan to purchase feed for the cows. Since the cows will get high quality natural feed, their productivity will increase and the family will produce more cheese to sell in Tbilisi. Their income will increase and they will use it to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase natural feed for her cows for the winter months

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old, widowed and has two adult children. 
To make a living, Teresita sells a variety of food and home use products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP per month from these activities. 
In 2010, Teresita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 8,401 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.es:
El joven Eliezer es un joven trabajador honesto que se dedica a la venta de  mercancía de abarrotes desde hace   cuatro años.
El nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es darles una buena atención a sus clientes ya que ellos se desean lo mejor.
Tambien se dedica a la venta de motocicletas en una tienda de motocicletas desde hacedos años.
El pidió el préstamo para la compra de más mercancía de abarrotes como es jabon, aceite, chile, cebollas, jabon, café, refrescos, pan, galletas y leche.
Le da las gracias por ayudarlo en todo para salir adelante y seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Eliezer is an honest, hardworking young man who has been selling groceries for four years.
He tells us that what he likes best about his business is providing his customers with good service, since they want the best.
He has also been selling motorcycles at a motorcycle shop for the past two years.
He has requested the loan to purchase more grocery merchandise, such as soap, oil, chile peppers, onions, coffee, soda pop, bread, cookies, and milk.
He is grateful for all the help in getting ahead and in continuing to grow with his business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: La solicitante es de estado civil casada, en la foto esta con su esposo,  tiene un nivel de estudios hasta la secundaria ,  actualmente ella tiene 27 años de edad,  es una señora muy responsable, lastimosamente en estos momentos su padre se encuentra en mal estado de salud, por lo que están incurriendo en varios gastos para medicamentos, hospital, y otros. Su padre le dejó a cargo de sus bienes y otras responsabilidades en las cuales la señora Vilma está cancelando deudas por el mal estado de salud de su padre, por esta razón requiere un crédito para la mejor nutrición de sus   vacas que necesitan de un buen Alimento, y ella necesita de la producción de leche para seguir generando ingresos y poder cubrir sus deudas, ante estos momentos difíciles que esta pasando, con una persona muy querida para ella.
texts.en: This requester is married and appears in the photo with her husband.  She has a middle school education and is 27 years old.  She is a very responsible person but unfortunately her father is in poor health at the moment and she is accruing expenses for medicines, hospitals, and other things.  Her father has left her in charge of his property and Vilma has paid off debts.  She needs this loan to provide better feed for her cattle.  She needs to produce milk to continue generating income to cover her debts.  She is spending these difficult moments with a person very loved to her.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Bartholomew Kimutai Langat

texts.en:
Bartholomew lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. He has 10 children and has been doing this work (agriculture) for 40 years.  His primary income sources are milk and eggs.

He stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is "milking dairy cows." According to Bartholomew, his biggest challenge is "lack of enough funds." One animal on the farm is named Chebois.

Bartholomew was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan. "Because it has low rates," he replied. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He said "They are for our economic improvement, and they are good."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?," Bartholomew replied it will "increase sources of income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Bartholomew owns at least one cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito netting and electricity, but does not have solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Yasmit Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yasmit, con 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, una visionaria y buena negociante. 
Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo ropa en el municipio de Sincelejo y, desde hace 1 año tiene su propio negocio.  
Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Yasmit acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido e inventario de calzado y ropa para vender.

Yasmit es una mujer muy organizada aunque ha tenido que enfrentar la competencia comercial del sector.  
La suma de todos sus esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente.

loans.use: comprar surtido e inventario de calzado y ropa para vender.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith was born 34 years back and she is married with two children. She has been the group secretary of Kanunga Hope Women Group since it was started in 2003. Faith joined WEEC in 2003, received training in business management and later, was given a loan of USD 150 which enabled her to start a small business. Prior to this, she used to growing and selling vegetables in Kiambu Town and Westlands Nairobi. Her family has a small piece of land where she grows vegetables however; the income is not enough to meet her family requirements. She is yet to start rearing pigs because they sell like hot cakes.

loans.use: She would like to buy 15 piglets and all the medicine required for treating them.

loans.name: Aynure

texts.en: Aynure O. owns a school supply / Stationary store in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. She is another one of Azerbaijan’s growing number of young women entrepreneurs. Aynure is looking for funding so that she can increase the quantity and diversity of her store inventory.

loans.use: New Inventory - To increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Gustava

texts.en: Gustava was one of the first beneficiaries of South Pacific Business Development. Gustava sews a variety of clothing: women's Puletasi, men’s aloa, children’s wear and any other kind of clothing you want. Her sewing machine was a second-hand machine she bought when she got her first loan of $300. She sews clothes by order. If you provide your own material then Gustava will charge you less, but if you want to buy the finished product then you are charged the full amount. She also has her Banana Plantation, which is worked by her husband, to provide income to her family. Gustava is requesting a loan for her sewing business, and also for the banana plantation that her husband runs.

loans.use: To purchase materials, thread, needles, new sewing machine, fertilisers, bushknives, weed killer

loans.name: Jairo Alejandro

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Jairo Alejandro and I am a mechanic who specializes in motorcycle repairs. I have a small shop in my home, called "T.," which generates enough income to cover household expenses and other bills. I currently need to buy more spare parts in order to better serve my customers. I am a father of a family with 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Hola mi nombre es Jairo Alejandro, mi actividad principal es la reparación de Mótocicleta, cuento con un pequeño taller en mi casa de habitación, llamado taller de Motocicletas "T.", el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas gastos, actualmente necesito comprar mas repuestos para poder atender mejor al cliente. soy padre de familia y tengo 2 hijos.

loans.use: To purchase a pistons kit, handbreaks,   handlebars, tires, rims

loans.name: Rosa Lila

texts.es:
I have a business selling "baliadas", buttery tortillas filled with beans. I have run this business for ten years and my baliadas are famous in my neighborhood of Villa Nueva. At this time I need to buy flour, eggs, oil, beans and plantains. I count on this business to support my family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Yo tengo un negocio de venta de baliadas (tortillas de harina con frijoles y mantequilla). Este pequeño negocio lo tengo hace 10 años en colonia Villa Nueva. Mis baliadas son muy famosas y tengo una buena clientela. Ahora nesecito comprar; harina, huevos, aceite, frijles, platano etc. Este negocio es el que me el sustento diario para poder mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: To buy flour, beans, oil, plantains and dairy products.

loans.name: Idoh

texts.en: Idoh is 35 years old and married. Her business is cooked foods, and she has been working on her business for one year. She sells her goods by going around the village on foot. From her business, Idoh earns $2 per day. Her husband is a farmer who earns $7.50 per day. Idoh needs to borrow $50 to expand her business. She will pay  within a 12-month period.

loans.use: $50 will be used to buy food materials

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.en:
Rocio has a successful business cooking and selling tamales in Lima. She has five carts and four employees who each run at cart at a different location. She’s found that business is better if you can sell in various locations versus being in a permanent stand. Rocio sells only on the weekends, and spends the very early morning hours of Saturday and Sunday preparing the tamales: it takes almost 5 hours to cook them, and they are best served hot, so she can’t prepare them ahead of time.

Rocio and her husband have three children, ages 12, 10, and 2. Her dream for her business is to keep expanding by adding more carts throughout the city. She has started to sell at fairs as they come through Lima, and has found this to be an excellent source of additional income, so she would like to sell at fairs more frequently. With this loan of $150, Rocio will buy corn and other ingredients (such as flour and meat) for her tamales, all the ingredients for which she buys from a local market.

loans.use: To buy corn and other ingredients for the tamales she makes and sells

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru:
Mukaddas has been working at a Beauty Salon as a barber for 2 years. She has 2 children. Before she worked at a store. She will use her loan to purchase accessories for hair stylists such as sets of scissors, hair dryer, and hairspray. She anticipates a lot of customers since a quite a few people seek her services before and for the New Year's Day, which is widely celebrated in Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Мукаддас работает в саоллне красоты парикмахером. У нее двое детей. Ее деятельность длится второй год. До салона она работала в магазина. Кредит она получила для того что бы приобрести парикмахерские аксессуары(ножныцы, фне , лак для волос и т. п.).Так как перед новым годом многие обращяются в салон что бы выглядеть лучше.

loans.use: Purchase of accessories for hair stylists

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud M. owns and operates an auto parts store in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Mahmud has been working in this business for the last 8 years and is married with four children. He has already successfully repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit and thus has proved to be one of our valued and trusted customers. He is currently looking for funding in order to increase and diversify the amount of auto parts he keeps in stock.

loans.use: To increase and diversify his inventory of auto parts

loans.name: St. Noah Women's Group

texts.en: Sarah, aged 41 and a resident of Kayunga, is a woman of substance. She is married with 5 children, although her husband lives in Kampala. Since 1989 her business has been buying coffee seeds from all the villages around Kayunga and selling them to the factory in Kayunga. Her range is usually 3 to 5 tonnes, where a tonne is 1000 kilogrammes. Sarah needs a loan, together with her group members, to enable her to buy more tonnes now that the prices are high, as well as to cover the ever increasing transport costs, because of the crisis in Kenya. She has been our client for 16 months and so far we have no regrets.

loans.use: Sarah intends to buy more kilogrammes of coffee to increase her savings.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mr. Sun S. and his wife have been married since 1975. They have six children—four sons and two daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. As for the other three, one sells flowers, another is an artist, and the youngest is in school. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. S. and his wife have been farming since 1979. They grow bananas, jasmine flowers, and longans on the farm near their home. In addition to growing crops, they buy bananas and longans from farmers in the village to sell in Phnom Penh.

Mr. S. is requesting a loan for the fourth time. He is asking for $1200 to buy bananas, flowers, and longans for resale, and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: For purchasing fertilizer, flowers, and bananas

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Rebeca is a young mother and has many wishes for progress. To reach her goal, she took the initiative to start work in her home without neglecting her small children. She decided to buy an embroidering machine with which she can optimally spend her embroidering time. This machine greatly helps her work. Thanks to this important tool, she can devote plenty of time, without anxiety, generating sums of money for her family's economic situation. She wants to improve her studio as well as the stables for her bulls and cows by improving the quality of her products and raising living standards for her lovely family.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Rebeca es una joven madre de familia con muchos deseos de progresar y como iniciativa para alcanzar su meta ha decidido trabajar en su propia casa sin descuidar la atención de sus pequeños y ha optado por comprar una máquina bordadora con el fin de optimizar el tiempo del bordado de fustanes ayudándose de este valioso instrumento de trabajo.Gracias a esta importante herramienta de trabajo puede dedicarse plenamente y sin temores generando interesantes sumas de dinero a su economía familiar. Quiere mejorar su taller y de paso mejorar también el establo de toros y vacas con el propósito de incrementar la calidad de sus productos y elevar el nivel de vida de su amada familia.

loans.use: to increase capital to improve the quality of her artistic handiwork

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Salamatou A. was born in 1957; she is married to a carpenter and is the mother of seven (07) children. She sells wood coal. She alone provides financial support for the family and she fights day and night to see her trade flourish. Unfortunately, she is limited by financial constraints and needs financial support. This is why she is requesting a loan to strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1957, madame Salamatou A. est mariée à un menuisier et mère de sept (07) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois. Elle porte sur elle seule tout le poids des charges familiales et se bat nuit et jour pour faire prospérer son commerce. Malheureusement elle est financièrement limitée et nécessite un appui financier. C’est pourquoi elle demande un crédit pour renforcer son commerce.

loans.use:
Purchase and sell of wood coal

Achat et vente de charbons de bois

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy R., 46, is married and lives with her six children in Siem Reap Province. Daily she goes to the market to sell Khmer desserts for a profit of $4, while her husband, Sek Saroeun, works in construction. They are also supported by two of their sons who work in construction and one of their daughters who is a waitress at a local restaurant. The family is now in need of some capital, requesting a loan of $500 both to invest further in the dessert business and to purchase a motorbike to replace the family’s old and unreliable one. Tuy R. sees these investments as a great opportunity to increase the family’s income and standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in the dessert business and replace the motorbike.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa S., age 34, is divorced and has two children to support. She's seeking a loan to bolster her business, that consists in selling fruits and hard-boiled eggs at the bus station of her village. She intends to repay the loan after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Awa S., 34 ans est divorcée avec 02 enfants en charge. Elle sollicite un prêt pour améliorer son petit commerce de vente de fruits et d’œufs durs à la gare routière du village. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To bolster her small business selling fruits and hard-boiled eggs

loans.name: Mrs. Hong Nari Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hong N. is the group leader of five who all live in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Sok Bunthoeun owns a small cart -which he attaches to his motorbike with a cable -in order to transport soil to sell door-to-door.  However, his business now faces a problem because the cable he uses to attach his cart to his motorbike is broken. Therefore, his wife, Mrs. Hong N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a new cable. Mrs. Hong N. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is only four months old.

loans.use: to buy a new cable to attach a cart

loans.name: Lita Elinor

texts.es:
La señora Lita, socia D. Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, vive en la región  San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Distrito de Juanjui, de profesión Secretaria. Lita y su esposo cuentan con una emisora radial para dar oportunidad de trabajo a quienes lo requieran. Ya tiene 5 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien. Se dedica a la administración de su empresa radial.

Con este crédito de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará una computadora bien implementada que tanta falta le hace en su emisora, y otros equipos que son muy indispensable para el buen funcionamiento de la emisora radial y poder dar un buen servicio a los clientes y a la comunidad. 

La señora Lita tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo que aún está a su cargo. Es una mujer muy responsable, carismática y sobre todo decidida. Su meta es seguir implementando su emisora para tener más cobertura y llegar a más ciudades de la región.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lita, member of the "Hidden Treasure" community bank, lives in in the San Martin region, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the district of Juanjul. She is a secretary by trade. Lita and her husband own a radio station which offers job opportunities to those that need them. She has already been doing this activity for 5 years and things are going very well for her. She works as a manager at her radio station. With this 3,000 soles loan which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase a well-functioning computer, which she is lacking in her business, as well as other pieces of equipment needed in running a radio station so that she can offer a high quality service to her clients and the community. Lita is 35 years old and lives with her husband and son, whom is still under her care. She is a responsible, charismatic, and above all else dedicated woman. Her goal is to continue expanding her radio so that she can increase it's coverage and transmit it to more cities in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer and other equipment needed in managing a radio station.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen Bibi is the wife of M. A. and lives in an area named Riwind of Kasur, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of five daughters. Her younger daughter is in 11th standard. The others are working in a cotton factory. Nasreen Baji's husband works in a factory. Nasreen Baji herself makes thread and sells it in a market. She has been involved in this business for the last 6 years. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a thread-making machine so that she is able to make more thread and sell it in the market to earn a good profit.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Maqsoodan Baji wants a loan to buy wood to make furniture to resell. Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy another bicycle for her bicycle rental business. Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a thread-making machine

loans.name: Sinoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinoem P. is a villager in Prey Meilang Cheoung village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 

On her plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile soil and has a lot of pests which hurt her crop. Moreover, she does not have much money to support production. In order to deal with these problems, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice. 

She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Soy Choun, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sinoem P. is 31 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled at the school, while the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice.

loans.name: Vanra

texts.en:
Miss. Vanra C., 26, is single. She lives with her parents and her sibling. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her mother is a silk weaver.
 
Miss. Vanra has been a silk weaver since she was fourteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for her loom and her mother’s loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Tanzania Group

texts.en:
Kapembe H., age 35, is married with two children ages 14 and 12. She has a beauty salon which she started 6 years ago and works daily from 8 am until 8 pm. She is able to earn a monthly income of around $387. 

This will be Kapembe’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock of her salon and started a kiosk where she sells cold drinks and snacks. Kapembe has repaid these loans successfully. She now hopes for a third loan to increase her kiosk business. 
	
Kapembe will share this loan with her loan group, Tanzania, which totals 18 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Kapembe is in the centre, sitting on a chair.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks and snacks for resale.

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Mr. Vong A., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Phalla Mean, 43, have been married for 22 years and have four children: one son who is a construction worker and three daughters. Two of their daughters are garment factory workers and another one is in school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Vong has been a mason for 25 years. He does his work in Phnom Penh and near his village. His wife stays at home and takes care of their family. The couple is in the process of building their new house and they lack money to build a staircase. Therefore, Vong is requesting his first loan of US$ 300 to build a staircase on his house.

loans.use: To build a staircase on his house

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Mrs. Hing L. lives in Kos Nhoei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who cultivates rices on her plot of land. Her husband, Mr. Touch Nan, is a construction worker. They want to build a better house for their family. Mrs. Hing L. is applying for a loan to add to her savings in order to buy building supplies for the house. She is 41 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: Build a better house.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina C. C. es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, del barrio Central, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de secundaria completa 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, posee un negocio de venta de productos de higiene y limpieza (Cremas dentales, cremas para zapatos, pilas, etc.) y accesorios (escobillas, cepillos, etc.), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio.  
Ella desea seguir mejorando su negocio por ello viene solicitando un préstamo adicional de S/. 1100.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir más mercaderías para su negocio (accesorios de higiene y limpieza), productos que comercializará en las ferias de Desaguadero. Ella desea comprarse una casa en el futuro, así como un automóvil para ponerlo en servicio y finalmente brindarle una profesión a su hijo.
texts.en:
Rufina C. C. is a member of the Corazones Unidos ('United Hearts') community bank in the Central neighborhood of Desaguadero district, which is in the Chucuito province of the department of Puno. She is 40-years old, has a live-in partner, one child, and finished schooling through secondary school. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years and owns a business selling personal hygiene and cleaning products (toothpaste, shoe polish, wash basins, etc.) and accessories (toilet brushes, scrubbing brushes, etc.). Her first loan was 300 PEN, which she used to buy merchandise for her business. Rufina wishes to continue improving her business, therefore she is requesting an additional loan of 1,100 PEN which she promises to repay in four monthly payments. With this loan she hopes to buy more merchandise (cleaning and personal hygiene accessories) which she will sell in the Desaguadero street markets. Rufina hopes to buy a house in the future, as well as a car to hire out for service. Finally, she hopes to provide her son with the opportunity to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of personal hygiene and cleaning merchandise for sale

loans.name: Marithza Isabel

texts.es: La señora Marithza se desempeña de Secretaria en una empresa privada lleva diez años dando sus sevicias laborales. Tiene 26 años de edad, reside en el barrio 380 en la ciudad de Managua, con un hijo de 5 meses el cual ha venido hacer una alegría en su vida, su esposo es operador de moto carga en unos almacenes. La joven Marithza inicio en la empresa de afanadora pero por su buen comportamiento y superacion logro sus objetivos. Con esta solicitud es para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer  un muro en la parte de enfrente para estar un poco segura con su familia y poder gozar de los beneficios de su trabajo y beneficios que Afodenic ha dado a la oportunidad para salir adelante con sus metas
texts.en:
Señora Marithza carries out her duties as a secretary in a private company where she has been employed for ten years. She is 26 years old and lives in Barrio 380 in the city of Managua. She has a five month old son who has brought joy into her life. Her husband is a warehouse motor freight operator. When she was younger, Marithza started work as a cleaning lady but with her good demeanor and job performance she has accomplished her objectives. This loan request is for the purchase of construction materials to build a wall in front of their house. This would be for the security of her family so they can enjoy the benefits of her work and the benefits made possible by Afodenic for her to move forward with her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for a wall.

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Ese is 25 years old. She is single and has no children. She sells women's clothes and shoes. Ese started this business in 2008. She has requested and hopes to get a loan of N50,000 to purchase more women's clothes to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Gorgui

texts.fr: MR G. EST ORIGINAIRE DE LA REGION DE LOUGA OU IL EST NE EN 1960.IL EST MARIE ET EST PERE DE QUATRE ENFANTS ET VIT AVEC SA FAMILLE AU QUARTIER CITE LAMY DE THIES.IL FAIT DU COMMERCE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES ET GERE UN MAGASIN DE DENREES ALIMENTAIRES CHEZ LUI.AVEC CE PRET IL VEUT RENFORCER SON STOCK DE MARCHANDISES.
texts.en:
Mr. G. comes from the Louga region, where he was born in 1960. He is married and the father of 4 children and lives with his family in the Cite Lamy neighborhood in Thies. He has been a merchant for several years, managing in his home a shop that sells foodstuffs. With this loan, he wants to bolster his stock of merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of grocery items

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia loves flowers and has innate artistic ability in creating wonderful floral arrangements, so she wants to start a florist shop business. Flowers are a big part of people’s lives. Their beauty and color allows us to convey our messages perfectly: get-well soon for our sick friends and family, congratulatory messages to a newly promoted colleague, condolences to a grieving family, and to express our love to another person. Every occasion is celebrated with flowers. 

Silvia has experience in the business from working in another floral shop before. 
The materials that she will need for florist services include: a store or sales location, a refrigeration system, flowers, plants, floral supplies and secondary products she wants to sell.  

At the start, she decided to run her florist business from home, doing the entire process of designing, selling, delivering and ordering new supplies.  

Silvia has requested a loan from Microinvest to start a florist shop business.

loans.use: Starting a florist shop

loans.name: Khairijon

texts.en:
K. Khairijon, as she is very caringly called by her clients, is the mother of 3 children. Her husband decided to leave them some years ago and he left them with few economic protections. However, this fact did not become a motive for Khairijon to cave in emotionally and spiritually. A little while after she decided to dedicate herself, in an ambulatory way, to selling foodstuffs and opened her grocery store near her house.

Due to the large demand for her typical foodstuffs, she wishes to open a café in the future which will offer better and more comfortable service to the population and increase the quantity of clients. All this would allow her to generate a larger economic income for her family with the aim to elevate their quality of life and education.

In order to carry this out, she is proposing to solicit a loan of 5000 Somoni that will be invested in purchasing more foodstuffs for her grocery. With your help Khairijon will be able to open her café someday and turn her wishes into reality. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of stock and purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Afonso

texts.en:
Afonso P. S. is 32 years old.  He is the father of two children, and he and his family currently reside in Boane. He is originally from the province of Gaza, but he moved to Boane with his family due to the civil war. His children are 2 and 11 years old.  The 11 year old is currently enrolled in school.

Afonso works as a civil servant for the state, and has previously worked with the local agricultural institute in Boane. He intends to use this loan to make improvements to his home, mainly to put a proper roof on it. This is the first time that Afonso has accessed credit and he looks to continuing to do so in the future.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita O. is 47 years old and married with 6 children. She sells palm kernels. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more palm kernels to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels to sell

loans.name: Iris Maribel

texts.es: Iris Maribel Q. D. Vive en Ayuxtuctepeque en el  departamento de  San Salvador junto a su madre. Iris es una persona muy trabajadora ha logrado mantener a flote y con mucho esfuerzo y éxito su negocio, con 10 años de experiencia Iris maneja su  tienda y tortillería ubicada en su casa, donde cuenta con una clientela muy fiel y estable, ahora Iris intenta surtir su tienda para ofrecer más variedad de productos a su clientes lo que le ayudara  a aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Iris Maribel Q. D. lives with her mother in Ayustuctepeque in the San Salvador department. Iris is a very hardworking person who has managed to stay afloat through much effort and success in her business. Iris has ten years of experience running her store and tortilla shop in her house. She has loyal and stable customers. Now Iris intends to stock her store to offer a greater variety of products to her customers. This will help her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is thirty three years old. She is married with a child. She lives with her family in their community. Helena is a  hair dresser. She has three apprentices who are currently under training. Aside her hairdressing business she also sells hair products like pomades, shampoos and various kinds of weavons. Helena buys her working materials such as artificial hair, shampoo, pomade, lotion, etc. from the city central market. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy materials in bulk to be able to render quality services to her cherished clients. Helena aspires to expand her business and use proceeds to improve upon her standard of living

loans.use: To buy Hair products.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mr. Phalla S. lives in Chrouy Dang Village in Kandal Province. He is 20 years old and is single. He is a construction worker.

Aside from this work, Mr. Phalla S. is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Pan Sellers Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Pan Sellers group. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. These women have accessed previous loans from Kiva lenders through SMT. With those loans, they were able to improve their businesses, make better sales and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group, shown on the left, is Kadiatu C.. She was born in Magburaka town about fifty years ago. She is married to a businessman and they have four children.

Kadiatu sells dishes, spoons, cups and buckets in Magburaka town and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Kadiatu will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Adozinda Leonor

texts.pt:
Adozinda Leonor Xirinda é natural de Maputo tem 44 anos de idade solteira mãe de 3 filhos gémeos de 22 anos e outro de 19 anos todos estudam. Fez o nível médio de magistério primário (instituto de magistérios primários da Matola) Vive na casa dos serviços junto com os seus filhos.

Adozinda nunca mudou de cidade, é professora e trabalha das 07.00h as 17.00h auferindo um salário mensal de 5.440.00mt. que aplica no sustento da família e construção da sua casa própria em fases.
 
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000.00mt pretende comprar blocos, cimento areia e chapas para a sua obra. Sendo este o terceiro empréstimo os anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt e 10.500.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 

Já teve alguns empréstimos com Tchuma, uma instituição de crédito. Quando as amigas lhe disseram que haviam abandonado para se juntarem a Hluvuku, por varias razoes, ela também preferiu seguir o mesmo caminho.

Os desafios que enfrentam é a subida dos preços de material, mas como o objectivo dela é concluir a sua obra ira pagar bem este empréstimo assim para levantar mais no futuro e continuar com os estudos.
texts.en:
Adozinda Leonor Xirinda was born in Maputo, she is 44 years old, single and has 3 children, twins who are 22 years old, and another who is 19 years old, all of them are studying. She finished the mid level of elementary teaching (at the Elementary education Institute in Matola) she lives at the service houses with her children. Adozinda never moved from her city, she is a teacher and works from 7am to 5pm and earns a monthly salary of 5,440MT which she uses to support her family and to build her own house in phases. With the current loan of 10,000MT she expects to buy bricks, cement, sand and metal sheets for the construction. This is her third loan the previous ones were for 10,000MT and 10,500MT for the same activity. She already had some loans with Tchuma, a credit institution. When her friends told her about Hluvuku she followed them. Her current challenge is the high prices of construction materials, but her goal is to finish the construction so she will pay well the loan in order to request more in the future to finish her studies.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, sand, and others)

loans.name: Amistad De Palmira Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento: AMISTAD DE PALMIRA se encuetra ubicado en el Barrio La Palmira,el Banco esta en su 2do ciclo, compuesto por 10 personas; es dirigido por su PRESIDENTA MARIBEL, la TESORERA MARIA ERICKA y la SECRETARIA CONSUELO. El grupo se dedica a la venta de Ropa, Zapatos,Cosmeticos,Comida, Abarrotes,Panaderia,Venta de Jugos de Frutas y otros. 
La Presidenta del grupo, tiene 6 años de antigüedad en la Venta de ropa, Zapatos al cual ira destinado el crédito; tiene 2 hijas pequeñas que aun asisten a la escuela. 
La Tesorera del Banco, tiene un año de antigüedad en el rubro de venta de comida, su meta es seguir Trabajando y ampliar su negocio. Vive en la casa de su madre, tiene 3 niños que estudian en la escuela del barrio y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda en sustento del hogar.
La Secretaria del Banco, tiene 9 años en el negocio de Panaderia trabaja de lunes a viernes 8 horas al dia. Vive en alquiler, tiene una hija bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Amistad De Palmira” is located in the neighborhood of La Palmira. The group is in its second loan cycle and is composed of 10 members. The leaders are Maribel (President), Maria Ericka (Treasurer), and Consuelo (Secretary). The members are engaged in various retail businesses selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, food, groceries, bread, fruit juices, and other products.

Maribel has been selling clothing and shoes for six years. Her loan is designated for her business. She has two young daughters who attend school.

Maria Ericka has been selling food for one year. Her goals are to continue working and expand her business. She lives at home with her mother and three children, who attend the neighborhood school. Her earnings enable her to sustain her household.

Consuelo has been operating a bakery for nine years. She works eight hours a day, Monday through Friday. She lives in a rented house and has one child.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is a patient and kindhearted mother. She has been engaged in a retail store business for almost three years now. Her weekly net income is PHP 300. But her income is insufficient for providing the needs of her family and that's why she is requesting her fourth cycle loan of PHP 10,000 from some generous KIVA lenders. She will use it to purchase grocery items to sell. She wants to strengthen her business to maintain their good living conditions.
She is married to Alejandro P., a farmer, and they have only one child named Chris, 31, who is a college graduate. There are four family members living together in the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is near the national highway and rice farm.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth D. runs a sari-sari (variety retail store) selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 32 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. Janeth has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Janeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Janeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday sells medicines at retail prices to his customers. He is 49 years old and married with four children. His youngest child is 9 years old. His children are in primary and secondary schools. His wife is a teacher and she also supports the family. Friday has been in his business for a long time. He hopes to own a maternity home in the future. He will use his loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is forty-three years old. She is married and she has five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.

Adwoa works hard to support her husband and to provide for the family. She is a fish monger. She buys fresh fish, smokes it and then supplies the fish to food vendors. She buys fresh fish directly from the fishermen in her community.

Adwoa has been in business for twenty-five years and yearns to increase her stock. It is her desire to give all her children a good education. For this reason she has requested a loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
La señora Salvadora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Breo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 50 años y es madre de  05 hijos, todos ya independientes. 

Motivada por ella misma emprendió un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, bebidas gasificadas y ropas, hace 03 años que se dedica de lleno al negocio  con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 se implemento mucho mas obteniendo buenos resultados desde un inicio, por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas, paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores , agua mineral , ropas para damas , caballeros y niños ,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Salvadora , se siente una Mujer fuerte, con ganas de salir adelante , agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Salvadora belongs to the community banking group "El Breo," in the Juanjui District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, in the Department (state) Departamento of San Martín. She's a live-in partner who is 50 years old. She's the mother of 5 children, all of whom are self-reliant. Self-motiviated, she began a little business selling groceries, soda and clothes. Three years ago she began working full-time at her business with her first loan of 300 soles. She worked hard, and got good results from the start due to the the quality of her products, her reasonable prices and her good attention to the customer. Nowadays she's still working in the same business, located in her own home, where her best clients are the neighbors in her neighborhood. With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy more products to supply her business like: kilos of rice and sugar, crates of eggs, packages of different flavors of soda, mineral water, women's, men's and children's clothing, supplies for personal hygiene and cleaning the home, candies and other products to keep her customers happy. Salvadora feels that she's a strong woman, with desires to get ahead. She's thankful to the Manual Ramos movement, for helping people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes that they continue in this manner for a long time, helping many families and entreprenurial women.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: My's Group

texts.en:
Mỹ Thị P. is 59 years old. She lives in Cau Ca – Co Loa – Dong Anh – Ha Noi with her husband and two of her children. She has been raising chickens for many years. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 Vietnamese Dong. She joined SEDA, a Kiva partner, three years ago and has made repayments on time. This time, she wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND to repair breeding facilities and buy some chickens.
 
About the other borrower in her group: 

Huệ Thị Nguyễn is 28 years old. She sells goods in the market. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to invest in her small business.

loans.use: To repair breeding facilities and buy some chickens

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa S. is from Tacuara, 5 km from the city of San Estanislao.  She is single and 37 years old.  Teresa has been selling gold and silver jewelry and perfume for 15 years.  She travels on a motorcycle, selling her merchandise throughout the town to her established client base.  Teresa's dream is to have her own retail space in the city of Santani, as the majority of her customers are from there.  This would allow her to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase her own retail space

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La joven María Elena es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente está estudiando el cuarto año de contabilidad, se desempeña como Secretaria en la Alcaldía municipal de El sauce donde tiene un año de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel el cual será invertido en la compra de cerámica, cemento y pago de mano de obra con el fin de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is from the town of El Sauce. Currently, she is studying accounting and is in her fourth year. She works as a secretary at the municipal town hall of El Sauce where she has been working for a year. This is the first loan Maria Elena requests from CEPRODEL. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of ceramic, cement and to pay for labor for the improvement of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramic, cement and to pay for labor for the improvement of her home.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Reina Isabel C. C.. Es de oficio agricultor  junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos especialmente maíz y trigo los cuales tienen un desarrollo optimo en esos suelos el crédito lo solicito para mejoras en la finca como la realización de potreros y hacer nuevos pastos para el ganado y así separar los terrenos agrícola del ganado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reina Isabel C. C. works in agriculture; together with her husband they grow basic grains such as corn and wheat which grow optimally in these soils. She requested the loan for farm improvements such as fencing fields and setting up pastures for the cattle to separate the farming lands from the cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wire to build fences and separate farming lands from cattle.

loans.name: Diombo

texts.en:
Diombo D. is a 58-year-old married woman who is responsible for one child. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois Thiéckène for nine years and has always paid back her loans on time. She runs a little business selling second-hand clothes and hand-dyed cloth known as «thioup». As a side activity, Diombo D. sells palm oil and peanut butter.

Diombo D. wants to use this loan to buy more second-hand clothes as well as peanuts and palm oil.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes, peanuts and palm oil.

loans.name: Song's Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of 18 people, is located in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. Mr. Song S. is 50 years old and is the village bank president, selected by the members. Each member of this village loan will use it for a different purpose. Mr. Song S. is a farmer who owns a four-hectare field on which he cultivates rice to earn a living. He faces a problem because he does not have enough money to support his farm. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support his farming crop. His wife, M.. Srey NE. Chum, is a housewife and takes care of her children. This couple has six children; one is a chef, one is a laborer and the other four are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Hafis

texts.en: Hafis H. was born in 1984 and is married. He and his wife live in the city of Baku. He has been farming for 8 years. In the picture, Hafis is working on his saplings. He needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fertilizers and seeds to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Manos Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
PERCY ROBERTH, TIENE 38 AÑOS, ES SOLTERO Y VIVE EN LA ZONA D. LA LIBERTAD EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS AL IGUAL QUE SUS 8 COMPAÑEROS DEL GRUPO "MANOS FORJADORAS", QUIENES LO ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTE D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE TRES AÑOS, UN AMIGO LO ANIMÓ A PONER SU PROPIA BOTICA, EMPEZÓ CON MUY POCO CAPITA, SÓLO VENDÍA LO QUE SON MEDICAMENTOS BÁSICOS Y QUIE NO COSTABAN MUCHO.
CON MUCHO TRABAJO HA CONSEGUIDO QUE CRESCA SU BOTICA Y A LA VEZ CON LAS GANANCIAS D. SUS VENTAS HA REMODELADO LA CASA QUE LE DEJARON COMO HERENCIA SUS PADRES.
SU PRÓXIMO PROYECTO ES APERTURAR OTRA BOTICA Y MAS ADELANTE TENER UNA CADENA D. BOTICAS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA LA COMPRA D. UNA COMPUTADORA YA QUE LE SERÍA D. MUCHA UTILIDAD PARA EL CONTROL D. SUS PRODUCTOS.
texts.en:
Percy Roberth, 38, is single and lives in the La Libertad zone in the Comas district along with his 8 companions in the group “Manos Forjadoras” [Forging Hands], who elected him to be president of the group’s Board of Directors. Three years ago, a friend encouraged him to set up his own pharmacy. He began with very little capital and sold only some very basic medicines that did not cost much. Through much work he has maD. his pharmacy grow and with the profits from his sales he has remodeled the house that his parents left him as an inheritance. His next project is to open another pharmacy and down the road to have a chain of pharmacies. He will use the requested loan to purchase a computer since it would be very useful in the management of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer for his pharmacy

loans.name: Ichel

texts.en:
Ichel M. is from the village of Lower Irasan. She is 23 years old. Ichel is single. To make a living, Ichel owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members. Ichel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ichel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ichel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase grocery stock for her new sari-sari store. Ichel is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used for motor cab registration and maintenance. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Ichel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for motor cab registration and maintenance.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
To make a living, Myrna E. plants and harvests rice to sell. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-age children. They live in the town of Sta. Josefa. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years now. Her dream is for her children to finish college and have a bright future. 

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be her eighth loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 27 años, vive en la casa de su madre en compañía de ella, de  su pareja Luis (26), y sus dos pequeños  hijos.Desde hace 6 años, cultiva papa, alverja, maíz, habas, olluco, oca y cebada, junto a su esposo, quien además en sus días libres trabaja como operario de tierras de otras personas, y le pagan 20 soles por día trabajado, con sus ganancias cubre los gastos de su hogar. A ella lo que más le gusta  de la agricultura es cultivar y regar bien sus tierras, para que sus frutos se desarrollen muy bien y brinden una excelente cosecha, además de generosas ganancias. Considera que su labor es rentable porque vive sin pasar necesidades, además está ahorrando algo de dinero para construir su casa y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, también sembrará mayor cantidad de papa y alverja en los terrenos que desea comprar.Es  la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además de  trabajar junto a los integrantes de su grupo comunal de manera activa y responsable, para no defraudarlos.Elizabeth tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de guano para sembrar semillas de papa y alverja, y de esta manera espera aumentar su producción, para que la próxima campaña sea mas provechosa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 27 and lives with her mother, her huband Luis (26), and two small children. For the past six years, she has cultivated potatoes, peas, corn, beans and other crops with her husband, who also works as a day laborer on other farms, earning about 20 soles per day (US$ 7). With his wages they are able to cover household expenses. Elizabeth enjoys planting and tending to her crops, seeing them grow and produce an ample harvest, as well as solid earnings. Her activities have yielded some savings above expenses and she has provided well for her family, also expanding the area in cultivation for her crops of potatoes and peas. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to prompt repayment in accordance with the other members of her communal lending group. Elizabeth plans to invest her funds in fertilizer for her crops, in order to assure even more abundant harvests in future seasons.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer to increase crop yields

loans.name: Olga Rebeca

texts.es:
Olga Rebeca R. P., tiene 57 años.  Es divorciada vive solo,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, Rocio, Eduardo, Alberto y Jina. 

Olga es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Olga  se dedica a la agricultura, la siembra de naranja, yuca, café y maiz . Las compras las realizan cada vez que sale la cosecha en Guayaquil y Babahoyo y vende sus productos en la misma localidad y en los alrededores.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para incrementar la producción. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para viajar a Italia para encontrarse con sus familiares. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero.

Le gusta trabajar, salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Olga Rebeca R. P. is 57 years old. She is divorced and lives alone in Ventanas, a province in Los Ríos. She has 4 children: Rocio, Eduardo, Alberto and Jina. Olga is a member of the “Y” rural bank, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total who, for the most part, work in agriculture. This is the first loan they are taking with Cooperativa San José. Olga dedicates herself to farming, such as the planting of oranges, yucca, coffee and corn. She makes her purchases at harvest time in Guayaquil and Babahoyo, and sells her products in the same cities and in neighboring areas. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of seeds, so she can increase her production. She believes the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to be able to travel to Italy to meet her relatives. She faces challenges related to lack of funds. She likes to travel, and to go on trips with the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds so she can increase her crop production.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es casada y tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando, Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio hace 15 años y durante este tiempo los prestamos le ayudaron a ampliar su negocio, recuerda con mucha nostalgia a Morenita dice que fue la única que confió en las mujeres cuando ninguna institución daba prestamos a mujeres como ella. Teodora tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días y hace algunos meses compro un carro para que alquilara diariamente.
Teodora solicita un crédito de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Teodora son terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casa para la comodidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teodora is married and has four children enrolled in school. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Milenio” (Millennium) for 15 years and used the loans she received during that time to expand her business. She remembers with great nostalgia the early days of FINCA when no other institution would grant loans to women like her. Teodora has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meats. She manages her business every day and bought a car a few months ago that she rents out on a daily basis.

Teodora is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. She dreams of finishing the construction of the second floor of her house so that her children will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.es: Doña Antonia Catalina Marín Villagrán, D. 45 años D. edad, con 5 hijos actuales, D. las cuales solo 3 están asistiendo a la escuela, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta D. pollos, marranos desD. hace 15 años, poco a poco ha venido superando con esta actividad, pero con el paso del tiempo y los altos costos D. la canasta básica no ha podido enviar a sus dos hijos a la escuela, por lo que actualmente la apoyan en la actividad que ella realiza, por lo que necesita incrementar su capital D. trabajo.
