Por tal forman un grupo 5 personas para solicitar un préstamo a la Asociación,  la cual el nombre del grupo se denomina La Fe, y con este préstamo implementaran sus granjas D. pollos y solo así poder cubrir sus necesidades básicas como la educación D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonia Catalina Marín Villagrán is 45 years old. She has five children, and only three of them attend school. She has been raising and selling chickens and pigs for 15 years. Little by little she has prevailed with this activity. However, with the passage of time and the high cost of feeding her family, she has not been able to send two of her children to school. They currently help her in the work she does. She needs to increase her working capital. To do so, five people formed a group in order to request a loan from the Asociación. The group is called “La Fe” (Faith). They will use the loan for chickens for their farms. That is the only way they will be able to cover their basic expenses like educating their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nélida, de 45 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jorge y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Nélida trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, poniendo todo su esfuerzo siembra continuamente plátanos y café, productos que vende en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar su siembra de la plaga de insectos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nelida is 45 years old and a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Jorge and she really wants to improve her quality of life. As they work together everyday in their fields, Nelida tries to change their current life, putting all her effort into growing bananas and coffe. They sell their crops in the market in La Merced where they can get the best prices. Her favorite part of her work is protecting her crops from insects. She has worked in this for 10 years but she thinks the hardest part of her work is getting her products to market since the sacks of crops are very heavy. In the future, she would like to improve her crops and get better prices. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she feels like this loan will really help her to grow as a farmer. In her village bank, she is a very unified and involved member. She will use the 1800 soles ($650 USD) to buy fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fertilizer to improve her crops

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion M. is thirty-two years old and married. She describes herself as hardworking, business-minded, wise and honest. Her husband is employed in a flour mill, and they have four children aged between fourteen and seven years old whom they hope to give a good education up to the university level.

Marion’s business is located in a busy market in a residential area called Mukuru Kwa Njenga and is well known by the name Marion Cereals. Marion is served by the Kitengela Branch. She sells beans, maize, green grams (mung beans), rice and other cereals. She has been in business for the last one and half years now. She says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge she faces is that there are many other people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers, so it is difficult to maintain customer loyalty. High prices for her products also reduce the number of potential customers who could consume her products. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Marion is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more cereals and beans to grow her business and be able to cater to all her customers' needs. She hopes to have a big business in the future and even own her own home.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, sorghum, millet and green grams

loans.name: Las Samaritanas De Xequemeya Group

texts.es: Doña Rosario L. L. D. treinta y nueve años D. edad, es una señora casada, tiene tres niños y  una nena, doña Rosario apoya económicamente a su familia y darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración D. trajes para niños y elaboración D. pantalones. Para elaborar esta prendas ella utiliza una máquina D. coser para realizar su trabajo con el apoyo D. su esposo, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 10 años, doña Rosario necesita elaborar mas prendas, para poder mejorar las ventas y así obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas que conocía desD. hace mas D. 15 años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su aldea, el cual cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, cultivo D. frijol y tomate, elaboración D. ropa como pants, pantalones, venta D. alimentos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario L. L., 39, is married.  She has three sons and one daughter.  She helps support her family and proviD. a better future for her children.  She makes clothes for children and she makes pants.  She uses a sewing machine to do the work.  Her husband helps her.  She has been in this line of work for over 10 years.

Rosario needs to make more items in order to improve sales and thus earn a bit more profits.  To do this, she gathered together a group of friends she’s known for over 15 years to form a group because she tries to support not just her family but other people in her village as well.  

Each of the women is in a different type of activity, such as: fruit sales, raising animals, bean and tomato farming, clothing manufacture, food sales, etc.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials and supplies.

loans.name: Polo

texts.en:
Mr. Polo T. (in the photo with his wife) is 38 years old and his wife, Mrs. Srung Hoem is 44 years old. They have been married since 1992 and have four children--three sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school and the other two are still young and stay at home. The family lives along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Polo and his wife are farmers. They grow vegetables such as green beans, cucumbers and cauliflower on their farmland in the village. The couple does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their vegetable farm.

Hence Polo is asking for his first loan of US$ 500 to provide his capital.

loans.use: To use for growing green beans, cucumbers and cauliflower

loans.name: Simoneides

texts.en:
Simoneides M. is from the village of Centro Napo Tudela Misamis Occodental. She is 31 years old and single. To make a living, Simoneides owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a parlor. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing parlor services in the local community. Simoneides has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Simoneides joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simoneides has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Simoneides is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide parlor service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Simoneides from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her parlor service

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita B. is from the village of Western Wao in Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 50 years old. Mercedita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods & biscuits, in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mercedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has 3 children aged 18, 13 and 11.

Dionesia owns and manages a sari-sari (general) store. She sells tissues, candies and other various products. She is also an Avon dealer and displays Avon products at her store. Dionesia also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells pork meat at the market. Dionesia says she does all this to be able to help improve her family's living conditions.

Dionesia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Dionesia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to buy products to sell and additional piglets.

loans.use: To buy products to sell and additional piglets.

loans.name: Mrs. Saroeurn Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeurn K. is a village bank president in Kampong Pou village, TaK. province. She has been selected by nine people who make up a village bank loan. Each portion of the loan can improve each group member's standard of living for their families. 

She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land to grow rice. She sells the rice to support her family's living expenses while her husband, Mr. Yary Kun, is a palm juice collector. He also earns some money to support his family. They earn little money even though they try to work hard. So, to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Saroeurn K. is asking for a loan to add more money. She would like to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, one of whO. is a driver who earns a low salary while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Luisa C. H., es una persona de 65 años de edad,  divorciada con un hijo dependiente con 13 años de edad, vive en la zona oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba, trabaja como independiente en un puesto por las mañanas de venta de salteñas y algunos productos para la limpieza del hogar, este puesto de venta es ambulante en carrito muy cerca del mercado que existe en la zona y donde hay movimiento de tiendas y colegio.  Asimismo se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir los dìas domingos en el mercado central.  Ella vive en una vivienda alquilada y quiere crecer en su actividad para poder comprar un lote de terreno para realizar su sueño de construir su casita, está en esta actividad hacen 8 años.  

El crédito será utilizado para comprar mercadería para diversificar su oferta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa C. H. is 65 years old, and is divorced with a 13-year-old son. She lives in the Western part of the city of Cochabamba, and works independently in a stand in the mornings, selling empanadas (meat pies) and cleaning products for the home. Her stand moves on a cart, so she can travel to sell her products very close to the market, where there are many stores and a school. She also sells clothes on Sundays in the central market. She rents her home, and wants to grow her business so that she can buy land to achieve her dream of building her own house. She has been pursuing this business for 8 years.

The loans will be used to buy merchandise to diversify the products she sells.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to increase her capital

loans.name: Kalabirwamu Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en: N. Christine, 35, with hand raised, has sold charcoal for the past ten years in Kalabirwamu-Lugazi. It is a business the happily married mother of six has relied on to support herself and her family financially. She says she began this business with savings from her farming business. Christine also sells fish and says, with this loan, she is going to buy more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Kabera

texts.fr: N. Kabera est commerçant, agriculteur, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il a 35 ans, il est marié, et il est né a Rwanda.  Il a 2 enfants entre 5 ans et 8 ans, un de qui va a l’école, et il a fini 6 ans d’école primaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour la réhabilitation de sa maison d’habitation ; acheter 10 triplex, 26 planches en bois pour plafond,  2 portes métalliques vitrées et guillage.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’avoir une belle maison dans son secteur en vue d’avoir une meilleure habitation.  Il voudrait la réhabilitation de sa maison, pour avoir une maison souhaitée par sa famille.  Il voudrait aussi développer le bien-être et bonne habitation de sa famille.  Pour gagner plus de revenue, N. est aussi élévateur de vaches.
texts.en: Ngabieye Kabera is an entrepreneur, farmer and client of ACV since 2010. He is 35 years old and married. He is born in Rwanda. He has two children, five and eight years of age, one of whom is in school. He has finished six years of primary school. He is going to use his loan for repairing the house he lives in by purchasing 10 sheets of triple ply-board, 26 wooden boards for his ceiling, two glazed metal doors and a fence. His strategy is to have a nice house in his neighborhood in order to improve his live conditions. He would like to repair his house to make it more suitable for his family’s needs. He would also like to be able to provide for the well-being and decent housing of his family. In order to increase his revenue, N. also raises cattle.

loans.use: Purchasing 10 sheets of triple ply-board, 26 wooden boards, two metal doors, etc

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A., 47, is a micro entrepreneur who makes something big out of what is little. She did not even reach high school, but her life story does not simply end there. Patricia is married to Ricardo, a mason with regular work. Together they take care of their only child, a daughter, in their home in Baseco, Manila.

To cope with financial difficulties, Patricia has set up her own carinderia (food stall) located in Intramuros, Manila. Here, she cooks delicious meals for customers who find it easier to buy cooked food than to prepare their own, especially on busy days. Patricia has been running her carinderia for seven years. She is also buys and sell palay (rice grain). Her entrepreneurial efforts earn her Php11,000 per month.

To improve her carinderia, she decided to borrow Php30,000 with the help of CCT* to improve both her food business as well as her trading business. Aside from quality food ingredients, she also intends to buy palay and sell it to business connections. She plans to have small homes to rent to boarders. 

One struggle Patricia faces is family finances, as the price of the goods in the market has soared. But she knows she will overcome, because the Lord of her life is one faithful Provider. She desires to see the expansion of her business and allow her family to experience prosperity. Currently, she is saving up for her child’s education. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: purchasing palay (rice grain) to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 36 años, es casada vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Ella se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, trabajo que lo realiza en su tierra natal, que es un pueblo rural lleno de belleza y netamente agricultora, casi toda su vida estuvo ahí, ya que sus padres la criaron y le enseñaron a cultivar la tierra. Actualmente tiene una familia consolidada, por ello y con razón se dedica  a la agricultura, considera como una fuente de ingresos importante para su hogar y junto a su esposo y sus hijos trabajan en cada temporada para sembrar papa, maíz, trigo, cebada habas entre otros productos mas de su zona. En la temporada de cosecha, es la época más agitada y por lo general necesita de ayuda y es ahí donde contrata peones para que se dediquen a recoger los cultivos. En ambas temporadas siempre necesita de dinero  inmediato para comprar las semillas, arrendar una yunta y demás implementos necesarios, por lo que siempre acude a solicitar un crédito que siempre la han favorecido en el crecimiento económico. Es por esta razón que en adelante desea adquirir más terrenos de cultivo y ser una comerciante mayorista de  los productos que cosecha, en esta ocasión el crédito le servirá para la compra de sacos de abono que es indispensable para la preparación de sus terrenos. Es  el octavo crédito que solicita con MFP tiene amplia experiencia en créditos  dentro de su banco comunal de la que tiene gratos recuerdos pero en esta oportunidad ha decidió solicitar un crédito individual. Con este dinero comprará varios sacos de abono cuyo presupuesto cubre una parte y la otra que falta  viene de su propio capital que unirá para abastecer a toda la extensión de su terreno.
texts.en:
Vilma is 36 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and their two children in her own house.  She devotes herself to farming.  She does this work in her native land; a beautiful, rural farming village.  She has been there almost all of her life because her parents raised her there.  They taught her how to cultivate the land.

She now has a strong family, which is why she farms.  It is an important source of income for her household.  She works with her husband and her children in each season in order to grow potatoes, corn, wheat, barley, beans, and other products in her zone.  Harvest time is the busiest, and they generally need more help.  That is when they hire field workers to harvest the crops.  In both seasons she always needs cash on hand to buy seeds, to rent a yoke of oxen, and for the other needed tools.  

That is why she always requests a loan.  The loans have always helped with her financial growth.  That is the reason that she later wishes to acquire more farm land and to be a wholesaler of her harvested products.

This time she will use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer, which is indispensable in preparing the land.  This is the eighth loan that she has requested from MFP.  She has extensive experience with loans with her communal bank, and she remembers them gratefully.  However, on this occasion she has decided to request an individual loan.  She will use the money to buy sacks of fertilizer, which will cover part of the cost.  She will use her own money for what the loan does not cover.  The loan and her own money will supply enough for all of her land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Gbotima 4 Group

texts.en:
Umo Sherrif is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Umu was born in eastern Sierra Leone about 43 years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. 

This is the first loan that Umo and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Umo sells market food – rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc., and has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying rice, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, margi, salt, pepper and more in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 52 años, se separó de su esposo hace 17 años, producto de su relación tuvo 4 hermosos hijos. Ahora vive solo con el mayor de sus hijos Paúl, en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Santa Ana (selva central peruana). La actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, donde siembra en las 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, que heredó de su madre; una variedad de cítricos, entre naranja, tangüelo, así como también café, productos que comercializa en la ciudad de La Merced. Su trabajo requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, ante esto debe contratar peones para que le ayuden en esta actividad. Por otro lado, trabaja como personal administrativo en un colegio del estado, trabajo que lo ha venido ejecutando durante 11 y en el hasta el momento continua percibiendo una remuneración mensual. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder estar ocupada, pues le agrada mucho ser independiente,  “Además de ayudar a mis hijos mayores en lo que ellos necesitan”, afirma. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha de café en los meses de junio y julio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los milagros”, y este es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde agradece todo el apoyo que le ha brindando durante estos años. Ana, comenzará la cosecha de café; por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ana, 52 years old, separated from her husband 17 years ago. She has four beautiful children from the marriage. Now she lives with the oldest, Paul, in his house which is located in the city of Santa Ana in the central Peruvian rainforest. 

She works in agriculture and plants two hectares (20,000 square meters) of agricultural land which she inherited from her mother with a variety of citrus fruits including oranges and tangelos as well as coffee, products that she sells in the city of La Merced. Her work requires a great deal of physical work so she contracts with agricultural workers to help her with the effort. At the same time she works as an administrative person at a state school, a job she has had for eleven years to the present and for which she continues receiving monthly income. What she likes most about her work is to be able to remain busy especially since she really likes being independent. "And I can help my older children with the things they need", she says. 

Now she is preparing for the coffee harvest in the months of June and July. She belongs to the communal bank Los Milagros and this is the eighth loan she has with MFP, where she is very grateful for all the assistance they have provided over the years. Ana will begin the coffee harvest and  will use the requested loan to buy several sacks of fertilizer to spread on her crops

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es una joven de la ciudad de Medellín que decidió crear un nuevo negocio de alimentos. Desde muy pequeña le ayudaba a su madre con el cuidado de sus hermanos haciéndoles la comida y poco a poco fue aprendiendo a cocinar exquisitos platos. Consciente de su destreza decidió comenzar con la venta de los alimentos que prepara, los cuales han tenido gran acogida entre sus clientes. Ella es madre soltera y trabaja de domingo a domingo para velar por el bienestar de su hijo.
 
Alejandra  reconoce que los mejores días de trabajo son los del  los fines de semana e incluso ya ha tenido contratos para cocinar en fiestas y eventos pero como debe estar comprando constantemente los ingredientes para hacer la comida y los platos desechables para distribuirla, ella requiere del capital necesario para surtir su negocio, sin embargo como apenas está comenzando ha solicitado un crédito para adquirir los insumos que perduren por lo menos 1 mes y medio, mientras se estabiliza económicamente.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a young woman from the city of Medellín who decided to create a new food business. From the time she was very young she helped her mother with the care of her siblings, making them food and little by little she learned to cook wonderful food. Aware of her skill, she decided to sell the foods that she prepares and they have had great success among her customers. She is a single mother and she works from Sunday to Sunday in order to provide for her son.

Alejandra knows that the best work days are weekends and she has also had contracts to cook for parties and events. Since she must constantly buy ingredients for making her food, and the disposable plates to distribute it, she needs capital to stock her business. Since she is just getting started, she has requested a loan to buy enough ingredients to last for at least a month and a half, while she stabilizes herself economically.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and disposable plates for the foods she cooks

loans.name: Medejro Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MEDEJRO est composé de trois personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier à Kouhounou à Cotonou.  C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo. Jeanne est née le 22 Août 1969 à Bohicon dans le département du Zou au Bénin. Jeanne est mariée à un pâtissier nommé Janvier et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Jeanne et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis près de quinze ans, Jeanne vit à Kouhounou avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Jeanne exerce depuis huit ans environs, comme activité la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine (assiettes, plastiques, etc.), qu'elle achète à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Jeanne vend des tissus. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Jeanne sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
The MEDEJRO group is made up of three women from the same neighborhood of Kouhounou in Cotonou.  This is the second time that the group is seeking financial aid from ALIDé, with the goal of strengthening their business activities.  

The group's representative, Jeanne, is shown with her finger raised in the photo.  She was born on August 22, 1969, in Bohicon in the department of Zou in Benin.  Jeanne is married to a pastry chef named Janvier and has three children, all in school.  Jeanne and her husband share responsibility for the family’s expenses.  For about 15 years, Jeanne has lived in Kouhounou with her husband and children.  In order to support herself and improve her quality of life, for the past eight years she has been selling kitchen utensils (plates, plastic items, etc.), which she buys in Dantokpa, Benin's international market.  She also sells fabric on the side.  With the goal of satisfying her customers and to increase her income, Jeanne, together with her group, is requesting another loan.

loans.use:
Acheter des ustensiles de cuisine (assiettes, plastiques, etc.)
to buy kitchen utensils (plates, plastic items, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and five children. He has owned a cattle farm in his town since 2002. He works independently. His farm produces milk and he delivers his products to local markets and multiple clients that he deals with directly. He cooperates with his wife, who works as bread seller, to provide better living conditions for the family. Today, he is requesting a loan of $600 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase a new cow in order to enlarge his business operation. In the future, he hopes to own more cows so that he can increase his milk production and sales. In Lebanon, it’s very familiar to buy milk from cattle farms and produce special Lebanese dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase a new cow.

loans.name: Ganijon

texts.en:
Ganijon owns and operates a grocery store business. Approximately 10 years ago, Ganijon rented a place that had terrible conditions and was very deteriorated, and it was there that he started his business. He improved the space and expanded his grocery, and now it is one of the most popular groceries in his community. He has proven his belief that a person can reach his goals little by little through perseverance and dedication. Thanks to his skills and strengths, and fueled by the desire to provide a better future for his family, he moved from being a simple salesman to becoming his own boss. 

Ganijon is requesting a loan of 8,000 Somoni to increase the inventory of foodstuff items in his grocery store. Ganijon is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push himself to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. It seems certain that his perseverance and clear vision will become key factors for the success of his small business.       
 
More about Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and served as the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent of arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International:
 
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of foodstuff items in his grocery store so as to expand his range of product offerings

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Rebecca has a retail shop that sells a variety of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional stocks for the retail store such as snacks & detergents. 

Rebecca is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items for the store like snacks & detergents

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson, 29 years old, is married to Ruth and they are blessed with one child. Dickson is a livestock trader in Enkaroni. He has been selling livestock such as goats for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

Dickson was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. He is applying for his first  loan of KES 20,000, which he plans to use to purchase more livestock. He will use the anticipated profit to start a ranch. Dickson is very hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 42 year old retail business man. He plies his trade in Kyenjojo in Western Uganda. The father of seven says he began this business out of his own enterprise. Before that, he was involved in a cattle sales business. 

Hard work is a precept he lives by. On the side, he has a small farming business from which he ekes out supplementary profits. 

Weekly, his business generates him sales revenue totaling up to UGX 30,000. Lawrence is requesting this Kiva loan to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, soft drinks, sugar, beans, plastics, etc., to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, soft drinks, sugar, beans, plastics, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel y su esposo el señor Clemente están agradecidos por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos, los cuales les han ayudado a pagar los gastos de educación de sus hijos. 
Solicitan un préstamo para poder pagar la inscripción de la escuela de sus hijos y comprar los útiles escolares y uniformes, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar los pagos en la escuela y que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando 
Planean pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene Doña Maria Isabel de su trabajo en una fábrica, ya que Don Clemente se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe como albañil.
Desean que sus hijos tengan la educación  necesario para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Isabel and her husband Sr. Clemente are grateful for the assistance they received from their previous loans which were used to pay for their children’s education expenses.

They are requesting another loan to pay for the school tuition of their children and to buy school supplies and uniforms. At the moment, they do not have the necessary funds to pay for school so that their children can continue with their studies.

They plan to repay the loan using the earnings that Doña Maria Isabel receives from her job at a factory. Don Clemente will take care of the family expenses with his salary as a mason. They want their children to have the necessary education so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for her children's tuition, school supplies, and uniforms.

loans.name: Digna Esmerita

texts.es:
Digna  es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un pequeño negocio en L. parte delantera D. su casa. Comenzó hace 10 años con su negocio  para mejorar L. economía D. su familia. Poco a poco fue incrementando su pequeña tienda. 

En L. actualidad tiene una pequeña tienda donD. venD. víveres D. primera necesidad como arroz, granos, enlatados, bebidas, lácteos etc.  Poco a poco a incrementado su mercadería por eso también venD. cosméticos a sus vecinos o amigos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando por lo que con el préstamo desea comprar bebidas, lácteos, arroz, dulces etc. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local granD. para cubrir las necesidades D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Digna is a hard-working woman who has a small business in the front part of her house.  She started her business ten years ago in order to improve her family’s finances.  Little by little she was expanding her small store.

She now has a small store where she sells basic needs foods like rice, grains, canned goods, drinks, and dairy products, etc.  Little by little she has increased her merchandise, so she also sells cosmetics to her neighbors or friends.  

She has a lot of aspirations for her business.  Therefore, she wants to continue working.  She wants to use the loan to buy drinks, dairy products, rice, and sweets, etc.

In the future she wants to have a big place in order to meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, rice, and sweets.

loans.name: Jacoba Yolanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Fe Y Progreso.

La señora Jacoba es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado siempre con los créditos. Tiene  67 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 8 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto que ya tiene 18 años y que es como su hijo. Su esposo es jubilado.

Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, golosinas, sodas entre otras cosas, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo.  Su tienda tiene 18 años y empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que su tiendita es su razón de vivir ya que en ella adema de ganarse la vida se distrae con sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Jacoba lives in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí.  It has been known for many years as the city of real tamarinds due to the large quantity of this fruit that it produced years ago.  Jacoba meets with her fellow members of the Fe Y Progreso (Faith and Progress) communal bank every two weeks.

Jacoba is a founding member of her communal bank, and she likes it because of the help that her loans have always given her.  She is 67, married, and has 8 children who are independent adults.  She lives with one grandson who is 18 and is like her own son.  Her husband is retired.

Our friend has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of products like:  rice, sugar, oils, detergents, candy, soft drinks, etc.  She works there every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m., and her husband helps her with her work.  She has had her store for 18 years, and she started it with her first loan that she received from the institution.  She is very grateful this since her store is her reason for living.  In addition to earning her living from it, it is also a way to distract herself with her customers.

She will use this loan to further stock her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic goods.

Her goals are to get ahead with her business so that it will grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, sausages, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Marcia Lorena

texts.es:
La Sra. Marcia Lorena es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, tiene su propio hogar conformado por sus dos hijos y su esposo donde habitan en su propia vivienda, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en una escuela de la localidad con muchos años de experiencia.
Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para pagar gastos universitarios y comprar materiales para su hijo con el fin de llegar a formarlo profesionalmente como un hombre de bien, es por esta razón que decidió optar por este crédito ya que con su pequeño salario no da para cumplir con esta necesidad.
texts.en:
Marcia Lorena is from the town of El Sauce.  She has her own household which consists of her two children and her husband.  They live in their own home.  Marcia Lorena works as an elementary school teacher in a school in the town and has many years experience.

This is the first loan that Marcia Lorena has requested from Ceprodel and she will use it to pay university expenses and buy materials for her son with the aim of him finishing his professional training and becoming an upstanding citizen.  She decided to take out a loan as her small salary will not stretch far enough to cover this.

loans.use: to pay university expenses

loans.name: Yetana Group

texts.en:
Geofrey is the facilitator of the Yetana group. Geofrey and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Geofrey and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Geofrey takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and ensure food security for the family. 

With income from the maize sales, Geofrey will invest in animal raising and repair his home.

In 2012, the members of Yetana group will each plant maize on plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Norma Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Norma es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad, lugar que tiene abundante vegetación, es de clima frió, su población en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura o cría de animales, es gente muy amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Norma tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad, trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija también estudia en la universidad. Su esposo labora como ebanista, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora Norma labora como auxiliar de servicios de limpieza, esta actividad  la realiza hace 13 años y trabaja todo el día. En casa se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, ella tiene cuyes, cerdos y ganado.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para los mismos ya que va a comenzar a críar estos animalitros tambien.

Su meta es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the community bank "14 de Agosto" and lives in the community of Zhidmad. A place of abundant vegetation, Zhidmad has a cold climate and most of its people work in agriculture or raising animals. The people of Zhidmad are friendly, polite and maintain the culture and traditions of their parents. 

Norma is 40, married and has three children of 20, 18 and 3 years of age. Her eldest daughter studies at univeristy, works and helps her out financially. Her second daughter also studies at university. Her husband works as a cabinet maker and the house they live in is their own. 

Norma has been working as an assistant cleaner for thirteen years and works all day. At home she works raising and selling guinea pigs, pigs and cattle. 

She has been a member of a community bank for two years and her new loan will be put towards buying chickens and chicken feed for them, since she has also begun to raise chickens as well. 

Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed for them

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
A year and a half ago, Catherine was out of work and faced a lot of financial trouble. She decided to take a huge risk and use all of her savings to open up a daycare. She went from being unemployed to being a successful entrepreneur. She currently watches eight children from two to six years old. Two of the children are after school, but Catherine is able to charge the same for their care. There are also kids that don’t come in daily, but Catherine watches them occasionally. She is waiting for a new license which will allow her to have 16 children in her daycare at one time; five are currently on a waiting list. 

Catherine has been spending more money each month to enlarge her daycare space which allowed her to qualify for the license. Her husband is acting as her assistant and will help her with the larger group of children.

Catherine is using this loan to buy additional chairs, tables, mats, paint supplies and other materials needed for the larger daycare center.

loans.use: To pay for chairs, tables, mats, and supplies for her daycare.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Oñondivepa” es un comité D. 17 mujeres D. excelente estructura, unidas, diligentes y fraternales las unas con las otras. Estas señoras son D. la ciudad D. Villarrica, todas son vecinas y amigas las cuales se reúnen quincenalmente para brindarse apoyo entre ellas y solucionar los problemas en caso D. haberlos. Estas señoras están muy animadas para seguir participando en este programa D. microcrédito, pues mejoran así sus ingresos. Seguirán esforzándose en sus actividades solidarias para seguir creciendo pues tienen puesta todas las ganas D.  sobresalir en el futuro.  
Una D. las integrantes D. este excelente grupo es la señora Ignacia, la cual se dedica a la lavandería. Nos comenta que siempre está con mucho trabajo y eso le gusta mucho pues la ayuda a tener más ingresos. Ella se define como una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, entre sus metas está seguir creciendo cada día más, para que D. esa forna pueda ser D. ayuda no solo a su familia sino también a otras.
La ayuda que solicita es para la compra D. jabones, ya sea en polvo o líquidos, suavizantes y demás insumos necesarios para la lavandería.
texts.en:
The “Oñondivepa” group is a group of 17 women who have excellent structure, are united, diligent and sisterly with each other.  These women are from the city of Villarrica; they are all neighbors and friends.  They meet biweekly to proviD. support for each other and solve problems that may arise.  These women are very excited about continuing to participate in this micro credit program because they improve their income this way.  They will continue striving in their mutually supportive activities to continue to grow because they have placed all their efforts into standing out in the future.

One of the members of this excellent group is Ignacia who has a laundry.  She comments that she always has a lot of work and she likes this because it helps her earn more income.  She defines herself as a hardworking, tenacious woman.  Among her goals is to continue growing more every day so that she can not only help her family but others too.

The help she’s requesting is to buy detergents, both powder and liquid, fabric softeners and other supplies needed in the laundry.

loans.use: to buy detergent, fabric softener and other supplies.

loans.name: Vanic

texts.en: Vanic is a single man aged 21. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. For the past three years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to make a living. He also sell cereals to earn more income. He has employed one person to assist him in managing the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to buy a van. Vanic has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize and beans for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 37 years old. She is not married and lives with her brother and sister in law.

Liana has a higher education and for more than 13 years she worked in State Structure, but since the salary was not high Liana decided to run her own business.  

Since 2004 Liana has been engaged in a toys-trading business. Liana imports toys from United Arab Emirates and other countries and resells them in her rented place in one of Yerevan’s subways. Her brother helps Liana in her trading. Liana likes her business and does her work with great pleasure. 

What is important in Liana’s business? Liana puts emphasis on ecologically-clean produced toys and she says that her costumers are “children” from new born ages to adult because all of us are children during our whole life.   

Liana needs a loan for 1,000,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to add to her toys assortments for Christmas and New Year sales.

loans.use: to add toy assortments for Christmas and New Year sales

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a single woman aged 24. She has been selling clothes to make a living. The major challenge she faces is competition. Anne has been able to retain her business because of good reputation with her customers. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy blouses and belts for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to manage her business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy blouses and belts.

loans.name: Sanabarkhon

texts.ru: Санабархон 60 лет, вдова. Санабархон воспитала пятерых детей, часть из которых уехала на заработки в Россию. Санабархон в течении 20 лет работала старшей медсестрой, сейчас находится на пенсии, получая пособие в 2,800 сом (KGS).  В связи с тем, что заработная плата медицинских работников низкая, в 2000 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, Санабархон начала заниматься перепродажей бывших в употреблении вещей, таких как старые телевизоры, кровати, холодильники и т.д. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Санабархон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).   Доходы от кредита Санабархон планирует направить на дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Sanabarkhon is 60 years old and a widow. She had raised five children who have mostly left to Russia for work. Sanabarkhon had been working for twenty years as chief nurse in the local hospital and now is in retirement. Her pension is 2,800 som (KGS) monthly, which is about $60. Since the salary of medical workers in Kyrgystan is low, Sanabarkhon had started a second hand resale store back in 2000. She sells used TVs, rugs, refrigerators and the like. To further expand her second hand business Sanabarkhon has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) which she will use to expand her inventory.

loans.use: to raise floating capital

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 54-year-old mother of three living in Dimona. She is determined to break out of her current economic situation and move off of welfare. Now that her children are grown, Jennifer has decided to expand a small business activity she has had for years. Jennifer makes health bars and sells them in her own community. This activity has garnered a small profit for her each month but now she has the opportunity to expand and begin sales throughout the region and into other areas of the country. 

Jennifer needs this loan to buy materials and supplies for expansion. 

Jennifer wants to see her business activity grow into a secure monthly income and expand her customer base into stores and locations throughout Israel.

loans.use: Jennifer needs this loan to buy materials and supplies for expansion.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 42-year-old married woman with one child, not in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan, for the past three months. Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle. Helen has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from raising ducks.
Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina; pertenece al banco comunal "SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Taray perteneciente a la Provincia de Pisac departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 43 años de edad y es casada, la socia tiene 4 hijos la socia se dedica a la administracion y atencion de su propio restaurante; la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos y de productos que le salen a diario como arroz, en bolsas, aceite en bidon, sal, fideos, entre otros productos. La socia soliciate l prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos para implementar su restaurante.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The member Sabina belongs to the communal bank “Señor de la agonia de Taray”.  The group is located in the Taray district belonging to the Pisac province, department of Cusco.  

The member is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She makes a living in administration and care for her own restaurant.  She hopes to invest a loan in the purchase of ingredients and products used daily like rice, bags, oil drums, salt, and noodles, among others.  She requests the loan to invest in buying products to increase her restaurant.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments in the established time.

loans.use: invest the loan in buying ingredients.

loans.name: Azongnikin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AZONGNIKIN est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Clotilde Sambé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Clotilde Sambé a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Clotilde Sambé est âgée de 54 ans et vit au Bénin. Clotilde Sambé est mariée à un certain André. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Clotilde Sambé vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Clotilde Sambé vend depuis vingt ans de l'huile à moteur à son domicile. Clotilde Sambé s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Clotilde Sambé ensemble avec les membres du  groupe AZONGNIKIN, sollicite un premier crédit.

loans.use: Acheter de l'huile à moteur.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock for the business.

loans.name: Mushvig

texts.en: Mushfig is an IDP from the Fizuli region who now resides in Beylagan region. He faced many hardships in earning a living for his family and he decided to  start a business. He borrowed $300 from Normicro and started the business of butchery. His first attempt was successful and he borrowed a second loan of $1000 from Normicro and expanded the business. Now he needs $1200 to put a counter-refrigerator in his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy new refrigerator

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en: Lesina is a married mother of three children.  She is from the small village of Sauano Fagaloa, very far from town. She was employed at the Ministry of Health, but her enterprising spirit led her to resign two years ago in order to launch a lawn-mowing business.  Lesina says, “We women should not rely only on what our husband does.  We have to do something better, for our families and for the future of our kids.”  She used an initial loan to launch her business with two secondhand lawn mowers, but she is now applying for another loan to buy additional, upgraded equipment.

loans.use: Upgraded lawn-mowing equipment

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok M. E., 37 years old, is a mother of 4 children, and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She stays at home, looking after her children and cooking meals for her entire family. Meanwhile, her husband (pictured here because ME. E. is unavailable) plays an important role to take care of the family's expenses by operating a motor-taxi business. He can moderately earn around $2.50 each day. One of her children is employed at a local industry, and three are students. Sok M. E. is currently requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motor-bike for her husband's business. In the future, her husband hopes to save sufficient money to expand his business by purchasing a passenger cart attached to his motor-bike, so that he can operate a Tuk Tuk, which will enable him to increase his family's savings.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita R., 50, is a single mother of 2 children who are, respectively, 31 and 16 years old. The oldest is married and independent; the youngest is still in school and, according to Margarita, is her main reason for living. She’s a woman who gave up a lot to provide for her large family, a family with few resources, and she didn’t have the opportunity to finish school because had to begin working to help her family when she was only 8 years old. Margarita has had a small grocery store in her home for 3 years, one of the busiest in the area. She uses the income that she gets from the store to pay for her son’s schooling.

Margarita is a member of the “Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee of Entrepeneurial Women), also called “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women), made up of 20 women who stand solidly behind the loan. She’s asking for $150 to buy pasta, flour, cookies, candy, meat, etc. to increase the range of merchandise that she can sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita R. tiene 50 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 31 y 16 años respectivamente. El mayor de los hijos ya es casado e independiente, el menor de sus hijos está estudiando aún y ella manifiesta que es su razón de vivir. Es una mujer muy sacrificada, proviene de una familia muy numerosa y de escasos recursos, no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios ya que con tan solo 8 años empezó a trabajar con sus padres ayudando a su familia y demás hermanos. Margarita tiene una pequeña despensa en su domicilio desde hace 3 años, el mismo es uno de los negocios más concurridos de la zona. Los ingresos que obtiene con sus ventas los utiliza para pagar los estudios de su hijo.

Ella forma parte de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras denominado Mujeres Trabajadoras integrado por 20 mujeres que responden solidariamente por el préstamo. Solicita un préstamo de U$S 150 para ampliar su stock de mercaderías con la compra de fideos, harinas, galletitas, golosinas, carnes, etc.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Isabel Alfredo

texts.pt:
Isabel Alfredo C. joined the Fund program in February 2003. She is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and 5 children. They live in a camping sire in Corumana in the district of Moamba in Maputo. She has a stand and fishing boats. She has been investing loans on kitchen appliances. Isabel is happy with the program and says it has made her life better..

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel Alfredo C. é cliente do FDM desde Fevereiro de 2003. Tem 45 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 5 filhos. Vive no acampamento da barragem de Corumana no dostrito da Moamba em Maputo.Tem uma barraca e barcos de pesca .O valor dos empréstimos tem aplicado no negócio e na compra de electrodomésticos. Diz estar satisfeita com o programa uma vez que os empréstimos a ajudaram a mudar muita coisa na sua vida.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Luaono

texts.en: Luaono is a 43-year-old woman who is married with four kids. She applied for this loan (her second) in order to restock her shop and she hopes she can improve business by increasing her inventory. Her first loan was used to start up the shop. She hopes to further expand the shop with future loans and hopes to learn to become a better businesswoman.

loans.use: To restock her small shop

loans.name: Samura

texts.en: Samura (her brother is pictured) is 30 years old, single and lives in Khachmaz region. She has been running her farming business for 10 years.  Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy pesticides and seedlings to improve her farm. Note: Samura is not pictured for cultural reasons.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and seedlings

loans.name: Gertrudis De Los Áng

texts.es:
Gertrudis de los Ángeles S. B. is single, and the mother of four school-aged children. Her business for the past 33 years has been selling vegetables at the market in Chichigalpa. She tells us that, as a youngster, her parents did not send her to school and so she had to find a way to survive and support the home. Today, she endeavors to give her children what she did not have: a stable home environment and an education.

She inherited her business from her mother, who has been a force behind her getting ahead and supporting her family. Gertrudis has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and is very happy with the loans provided to her at various opportune times. These have helped her supply her business and satisfy her customers’ daily needs. She has a record of 19 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gertrudis de los Ángeles S. B., es una dama soltera y con 4 hijos en edad escolar. Su negocio es la venta de verduras teniendo 33 años de tenerlo en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Según cuenta en su niñez los padres no la ponían a estudiar y por tal motivo tenia que buscar la forma de sobrevivir para mantener el hogar. Hoy en día ella se esfuerza para darle a sus hijos lo que ella no tuvo, brindándoles de esta manera a su familia estabilidad y una educación para el futuro de ellos.

Este negocio de venta de verduras lo heredó de su mamá quien ha sido el pirar para que ella salga adelante y le de el sustento a su familia. Doña Gertrudis trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 19 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables.

loans.name: Santos Rosmery

texts.es:
Santos Rosmery Lázaro Q. is 23 years old. She attended high school but was unable to complete her studies due to personal reasons. She is the mother of two children that depend on her for sustenance. She lives in the Usquil district, Oztuco province, departamento de La Libertad. She earns a living buying live animals, such as pigs, and selling the meat to the restaurants in her district.

Becoming a member of the communal bank "Usquil" enabled her to start her business. She obtained her first loan, in the amount of S/. 300.00. She used it to travel to the Coina district to buy live animals at lower prices, which in turn brought her greater profits.

The loan, in the amount of S./ 1500.00 that will be paid in 4 months, will be used to buy 14 live animals to expand her business. Ms. Santos is a member of the club of mothers "Santa Rosa". Her dream is to set up a business in the city of Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Santos Rosmery Lázaro Q. tiene 23 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, sus estudios no los pudo culminar por motivos personales. Tiene 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Se dedica a la compra de animales vivos tales como huachos y chanchos los cuales mata para luego vender la carne; esta la reparte y ofrece por los diferentes restaurantes de su distrito.

Al integrarse al Banco Comunal “Usquil” pudo iniciar su negocio ya que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 , con este dinero pudo viajar al distrito de Coina para comprar huachos a menor precio y así obtener mas utilidades.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 , el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 8 huachos y 6 chanchos para poder incrementar su negocio. La señora Santos es socia del club de madres “Santa Rosa”. Su sueño es poner un negocio en la ciudad de Trujillo.

loans.use: Purchase of 14 live animals to expand her business

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
B. Rohat is 28 years old. This young and brave woman is raising her daughter . She supports her family; her husband left for Russia to work, and now he cannot attain remittance. So Rohat is the main bread winner, and she has to work hard. Rohat has been running her business for 8 years.

She purchases young cattle in the local market, fattens them, and sells them in the local markets. As a rule, she sells the fattened animals and buys the young ones once a week. With the help of a loan, she is planning to develop the business and to increase the income for her family.

This is her fist loan and she is so grateful for those who trusted her and decided to support her. Rohat promises to do her best in order to able to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase her capital to expand the business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Wedagni Group

texts.en:
Michael O. is a young Kenyan father. He is 30 years old with two children. He also lives with the orphaned child of his late brother, who perished two years ago.

Michael started his business three years ago after accumulating savings from his former work place, a local petrol station in the town of Kisumu. He currently sells men’s shoes but would like to diversify his inventory to include children's and ladies' collections.

As the bread winner for the family, expanding his inventory would allow him to support both his children and his wife, who does not have a job. With the little profit that he gets from the business, Michael struggles to pay the house rent and feed and clothe his children. With the help of his loan, he will be able to add more stock and increase his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady lives in a suburb of the town of Mbour. She began her little business selling fried dough with an initial loan of 50000 f cfa (about US$ 120). Two further loans of about US$ 360 and $600 allowed her to purchase a refrigerator so as to sell ice and then to begin to sell breakfast (coffee and sandwiches).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Khady habite dans un quartier périphérique de la ville de Mbour .Elle débute ses activités par la vente de beignets avec un premier pret de 50000 f cfa.Deux autres prets successifs de 150000 f cfa et 250.000f cfa lui ont permis d'acheter un réfrigirateur pour vendre de la glace et de commencer aussi la vente petit déjeuner (café, sandwich).

loans.use:
business capital

Fonds de Roulement

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay N., 28, lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and one young child. She works in the market selling vegetables, earning about $5 each day, while her husband makes $4 every day working at a local hotel. Hay N. has approached CREDIT for a loan that will enable her to expand her business and save money. She has asked for $1200 to purchase a motorbike to commute to and from work in order to save on the high public transportation costs. She would also like to use some of the money to increase her stock of vegetables and expand her business. She believes that this loan will be a sound investment, raising both her income and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in the vegetable business and purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Agowè

texts.fr:
Mrs. Agowè Madjakpre was born on July 6, 1961 in Tchamba. She is divorced and raising 3 children. She is uneducated and did not learn a trade. She has to support her family despite all this. For this reasons she undertook her little business making and selling juice and wholesaling mineral water. For the juice, she has ambulant salespeople who do the selling. The water is sold to retailers who come to get it from her.

A first loan allowed her to purchase a freezer to cool the juice. She is requesting this second loan so that she can expand her stock of raw materials for making the juice and add to her coolers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame MADJAKPRE Agowè est née le 06 juillet 1961 à Tchamba. Elle est divorcée avec 03 enfants à la charge. Elle n’est pas instruite et n’a appris aucun métier. Elle doit malgré tout subvenir au besoin de sa famille. Elle a donc monter sa petite affaire qui consiste a la fabrication et vente jus et la vente en gros d’eau minérale. Pour le jus, elle dispose de vendeuses ambulantes qui le commercialisent. L’eau est vendue aux détaillants qui viennent s’en procurer.

Un premier crédit lui a servi d’acheter un congélateur pour le rafraîchissement des jus. Ce deuxième crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’augmenter ces matières premières pour la fabrication du jus et le nombre de ces glacières.

loans.use:
Purchase of mineral water and coolers

Achat d'eau minérale et de glacière

loans.name: Kitimbwa Mixed Group

texts.en:
Rose N. is the chairperson of the Kitimbwa mixed group. She is married with 7 children and looks after 2 kids that belong to her siblings. Over the past few months, Rose has been able to improve her retail shop, as well as starting to farm. Now things seem to be going well, except that in her shop she lacks a fridge for selling cold drinks, and she needs to restock her shop with more products like sugar, salt, cooking oil, baking powder, and soft drinks so that by the end of the holiday season, she has saved enough to take care of her children's school fees and home care.

Rose does not regret being the leader of her group because this has taught her many leadership skills that she lacked before. She says that farming takes a long time to bring in revenue, but when the time is ripe, she is all smiles. Look at the baby that Rose had when she took her first loan in October 2007: he is really grown up and stubborn because she is able to care for her baby and the rest of her children with profits from the loans. She is asking for a loan to help her buy a fridge, soft drinks, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and baking powder in large quantities to prevent her from over-spending on transport costs.

loans.use: Rose is asking for a loan to help her buy a fridge, soft drinks, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and baking powder in large quantities for her shop.

loans.name: Yader Jose

texts.es:
El señor yader R. tiene 29 años de edad, es soletero no le tienen hijos, habita en casa de familiares, su nivel de escolaridad es primaria cursada, la actividad economica que el señor tiene es la comercializacion de cerdos en pie que posteriormente comercializa a clientes que le encargan de acuerdoa a la necesidad del mercado y sector al cual se orienta.
El señor tiene como proposito mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y mejor un area para poder criar cerdos que en la actualidad solo compra y entrega, y buscar la manera de ir creciendo en su actividad, en dicho negocio tiene  cinco años de ejercerlo dando inicio como una alternativa al desempleo y una forma de subsistencia.
texts.en:
Señor Yader R. is 29 years old, single, and does not have any children. He lives in the home of his relatives and went to school through the primary grades. His job is selling pigs on foot. He sells them to clients that put him in charge of delivering the pigs from the market to the desired locations. Yader's goal is to improve his conditions of living and also create an area to be able to raise pigs that, presently, he just buys and delivers; he is searching for a way to do his own raising of pigs in this business. He has five years experience in this business, which has given him an alternative to unemployment and a form of subsistence.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou D. est un boutiquier de plus de cinq ans d'activités, il investit dans d'autres secteurs comme le "tangana" qu'il a confié à d'autres proches parents. Il fait des chiffres d'affaires de vingt à trentes milles francs par jours. Il est marié et pére de deux enfants qu'il entretiens bien grâce à ses différents bénéfice. Ce crédit lui a permis de renforcer ses activités. Il a une boutique à scat urbam mariste et au belvédére.
texts.en:
Mamadou D. has been running shops for more than five years. He invests in other sectors such as "tangana" which he entrusted to close relatives. His revenue amounts to 20'000 to 30'000 XOF (40 to 60 USD). He's married and the father of two children whom he supports with his various revenues. This loan will enable him to bolster his business. He has a shop in Scat Urbam and in Belvédère (Dakar Region).

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retailing of various products

loans.name: Klakpasso

texts.fr: Klakpasso A. est un éleveur à Kpalimé, une ville à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agé de 42 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants et exerce cette activité depuis 2002. Monsieur Klakpasso désire améliorer son activité en achetant de nouvelles races de caprins et de porcins qui sont de plus en plus demandés sur le marché. Cette opportunité lui permettra d’augmenter gagner plus d’argent pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Klakpasso A. has been raising goats and pigs since 2002 in Kpalimé, a city located approximately 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He's 42 years old and the father of 3 children. Mr. Klakpasso wishes to bolster his business by buying new breeds that are more in demand on the market. This opportunity will enable him to make more money to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new breeds of goats and pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery merchandise

loans.name: Anastazia

texts.en: Anastazia L. is a Tanzanian woman entrepreneur. She runs a clothing shop. She makes and sells a variety of clothes, including traditional clothing, to customers. Her business is located in Vituka in Dar es Salaam. Anastazia has been in this business for three years. Income generated from the business is used to meet her daily family needs. She requests a loan of Tshs 800,000 to meet her business demand.

loans.use: To buy more clothing items to expand her business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 56-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their seven children. Fatima has owned a grocery store for 6 years. She is able to supplement her family’s income with the profit from her grocery store. Fatima has a good reputation in her area and she has competitive prices. Her clients are

her friends and neighbors. She requests a loan of $1000 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise to sell in her store. Fatima has been a microcredit client for 8 years and has always paid on time. Her previous loans have influenced her life in a good way; thanks to the loans, she was able to improve her work and her family situation. In the future, she plans to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in the grocery store

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
“Having a timeframe in developing a business is one of the best methods in attaining goals in life,” said Nely.

Nely is a vegetable vendor in her village, and she earns a weekly income of PHP 800.00. She is married to Wilfredo, a good and responsible husband and father to their six children. Her children are Winnie, 31; Nerissa, 29; Joemar, 27; Noel, 24; Winniefredo, 20; and Jocelyn, 18. Their children are all high school graduates and some of them are working as drivers and their eldest is a sales lady in Manila.

Nely dreams of starting a hog-raising business if she can raise enough capital. To fulfill her dream, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 that she will invest in the business. She plans to use the loan to start a hog-raising business and eventually to open a village store. The improvement of her business will help her to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To stare a hog-raising business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is married and the mother of three children, one girl and two boys who are all in basic school. She is 32 years old. Lydia lives with the children and her husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. Her husband is a farmer while she trades and farms. Lydia is a food vendor. She cooks rice/stew and yam slices and sells at the market. She also sells ready-made textiles. She hawks to sell the textiles in her community. Lydia procures her goods from Accra and from distributors who come to her community. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy foodstuffs, ingredients and variety of textiles. It is her dream to help her children have access to the best education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and textiles

loans.name: Marlin Jony

texts.es:
La señora Marlin R. es una dama muy esforzada cuya labor es la venta de carne de cerdo dedicándose a esta actividad con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda de habitación la cual posee actualmente.
