Un problema que ella atraviesa es que se le ha agotado los materiales de construcción y para ello requiere la compra de estos para proceder al mejoramiento de su vivienda en su localidad. Es debido a esto que ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de dichos materiales y continuar en su labor. Es de importancia destacar que con este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su familia por lo que lo requiere con urgencia.
texts.en:
Marlin R. is a vigorous woman who sells pork in order to improve the conditions of her home that she now possesses.

A problem that she comes across is that she has run out of construction materials and needs to purchase more to proceed in the improvement of her home in her community. Because of this, she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of said materials and continue her work. It’s important to point out that this loan will benefit her as well as her family, whom urgently need it.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen  es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia.
Carmen es casada tiene 54 años cuatro hijos de 30,28, 25 y uno de 12 años que esta estudiando  en la escuela estatal.
Su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y para ayudar en la casa ella se puso a vender lencería compra en gamarra al por mayor, también ella cose en su casa quiere empezar a confeccionar lencería. 
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para alquilar un kiosco por el mercado y allí vender su mercadería.
Desde que esta en Finca  su economía ha mejorado, aprendió la unión entre compañeras. 
El sueño de Carmen es tener un negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank “Sarita Colonia.” Carmen is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages: 30, 28, 25, and a 12 year old who is studying in the state school. Her husband is out of work, so she began selling lingerie, bought wholesale at Gamarra, to help out with the house. She also sews at home and wants to start making lingerie. Carmen needs a loan of 800 soles to rent a kiosk in the market where she can sell her merchandise. Since she has been part of Finca, her economic status has improved and she has learned about camaraderie among friends. Carmen's dream is have a business selling clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carmen necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para alquilar un kiosco por el mercado y allí vender su mercadería.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac P. is a 29 year old trader. He is married with two children. He has been selling used shoes in the local market of Bawjiase for the past four years. With income from his business, Isaac supports his kids in school. His major business challenge over the years has been inadequate funds to scale up the business. He has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that a loan would enable him to achieve remarkable business progress.

He wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used shoes to serve his customers. He is a member of a community group called Heavens Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Raul Enrique

texts.es: Raúl Enrique, tiene 28 años de edad,  el vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, menores de edad, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de playeras, empezó este negocio hace aproximadamente 6 años cuando murió su papá. El empezó con este negocio gracias a Dios su padre le dejo esta oportunidad para que el empezará de nuevo con el, ahora es de su propiedad. El sale a vender sus productos en diferentes municipios y lugares, a dejar su pedido  en tiendas y otros comercios.  El destino del préstamo que solicita es para comprar una maquina para serigrafías, ya que el no cuenta con esa posibilidad y para el, es una oportunidad que se esta perdiendo por no tener esa maquina.  Su sueño es tener esta maquina,  y con eso ya puede ampliar  el negocio, también con eso El puede mejor sus ganancias para el  un futuro un mejor futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Raul Enrique is 28 years old and he lives with his wife and two small children. He makes a sells T-Shirts. He started out his business about 6 years ago when his father passed away. With his father's inheritance he has been able to start out with a piece of property. He goes otu to sell his products to different municipalities and areas, to deliver orders to stores and other businesses. The loan requested will be used to purchase a silkscreen printing machine seeing as he does not have one now, and he feels he is missing out on opportunities by not having it. His dream is to have this machine so that he could expand his business and to improve his earnings for his future, and for a better future of his family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his clothing business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Virginia is widowed and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the construction sector selling lumber. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling lumber to local businesses and community members. Virginia has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine Pesos (about $416 US) a month from these activities.

In 2008, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 pesos from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 pesos which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Virginia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina A. D. C. is 50 years old, single, the mother of one child, and the guardian of her nephew. Maria Cristina studied through the 10th graD. when she was forced to stop in order to start working.

Maria has worked as a secretary for the past year. She learned her vocation working for the BIM bank (Banco Internacional D. Mocambique) for the past 30 years. She intends on using this loan to finalize construction of her home and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna U. is from the village of San Roque, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Edna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim H., age 27, is married and has two young children who have not been enrolled in school yet. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She has been engaged in a business as a grocery seller, typically earning US$ 5 per day. Her husband’s business is the primary source of income for her family. He is a tourist car driver for a private company, typically earning US$ 8 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, H. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, H. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase various kinds of groceries, a purchase that she sees as an opportunity to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: purchasing various grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Mariana Luz

texts.es: Mariana Luz C. D. G. D. 43 años D. edad vive en Soyapango municipio  del departamento D. San Salvador. Mariana vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Mariana y su esposo se dedican a la carpintería, poseen un negocio hace 10 años donD. ofrecen variedad D. productos en madera, manejan un promedio D. ventas D. 300$ mensuales. El  deseo D. Mariana es ofertar D. sus productos a tiendas D. electrodomésticos, para poder obtener mayores ingresos, es por eso que solita este crédito ya que desea invertirlo compra D. materia prima para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Mariana Luz C. D. G., 43, lives in the Soyapango municipality in the San Salvador department. Mariana lives with her husband and their four children. Mariana and her husband have had a carpentry business for ten years. They offer a variety of wood products. Their average monthly sales are $300. Mariana wants to offer her products in domestic appliance stores. This way she will increase her earnings. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy raw material to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
La señora Martha es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos y estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Capana.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años es socia fundadora,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar a su capital en su negocio de pesca artesanal. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de redes para su negocio de pesca artesanal, y lo vende en Puno y Juliaca en las ferias de la semana, su esposo hace servicio de taxi.

Su mayor deseo es darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones en las cuales comparte con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the San Salvador Luminoso Community Bank, located in Capachica District, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 48 years old, married with 3 children, and she completed secondary school. Martha lives in the community of Capana.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years and was a founding member. Her first loan was for 300 New Sols to augment her fishing business.

At present, she requests a loan of 2,300 New Sols to invest in nets for her fishing enterprise. She sells fish in the weekly fairs of Puno and Juliaca. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Martha's greatest desire is to provide an education for her children. She enjoys saving and the meetings she shares with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY NETS FOR HER FISHING BUSINESS

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: L. Pascaline est mariée à BOTON Marcel, un chauffeur. Ce couple a à sa charge trois enfants tous scolarisés. La famille réside depuis treize ans à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè kpodji. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Pascaline vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Pascaline vend des produits cosmétiques de façon ambulante. C’est à Ikpilè à la frontière Bénino-nigériane que Pascaline achète ses produits et elle les vend chez elle à la maison. Pascaline a déjà huit ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Pascaline a eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Pascaline demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
L. Pascaline is married to BOTON Marcel, a driver. This couple takes care of three children, all in school. For thirteen years, the family has lived in PK10 in the district of Sèmè kpodji. Thanks to the income from her business, Pascaline helps the husband with the family expenses. She sells cosmetic products from door-to-door. Pascaline buys her products at Ikpilè at the Benin-Nigeria border and sells them at home. Pascaline already had eight years experience in this business. She had before two loans from ALIDE that she repaid correctly and with these loans, she was able to raise the level of her business. To continue to expand her business, Pascaline is requesting a third loan to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
United Women is a group of five borrowers led by Beatrice C., a 44-year-old single mother of four children. Her children are aged between 23 and 27 years old and have attained education from 12th grade up to university senior. Beatrice also cares for four grandchildren. Beatrice dropped out of school in 6th grade due to poverty. She and her family live in Virginia, a newly-built community north of the capital, Monrovia, for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lot.

Beatrice's business is selling fish. She buys fish wholesale from fishermen and sells it retail to residents of Virginia. She has been running this business for 27 years and hopes to establish a fish wholesale depot in the future. Beatrice talks to her customers in a good manner and sells good, fresh fish, in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. Beatrice dreams of giving her grandchildren a good education as preparation for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn R. is from the village of Burgos. She is 29 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Annalyn owns and operates a mango production business, planting and harvesting the fruit for sale. Annalyn has been engaged in her business for over six years.

In 2008, Annalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Annalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Luciana Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal LUCIANA está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona D. San Antonio, que están ubicados alrededor del mercado Modelo, las socias se dedican a la venta D. comida, arreglos para eventos sociales, venta D. víveres, procuradora D. cosméticos, tratamientos estéticos, repostería primer ciclo en la institución, siendo que las socias en un 50 % no tiene créditos.
Maria Elizabeth es la líder y presidente del banco,  socia fundadora que conformo el banco D. emprendimiento; en su banco  ha aprendido a ser  responsable y solidaria con sus compañeras, exigente con sus cuotas D. sus compañeras a la hora D. pago. Actualmente se dedica a la repostería siendo que no cuenta con créditos o prestamos en otras instituciones el crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. materia prima para la elaboración D. sus productos, pasteles, galletas, tortas. 
Pamela, la señora es la Tesorera del Banco es una D. las fundadoras que dio origen a la conformación del banco LUCIANA se dedica a la venta D. ropa y venta D. cosméticos no contaba con capital para emprender su propio negocio, sin embargo ahora con el préstamo que se le dará  ella podrá adquirir mercadería para  aumentar sus ingresos económicos familiares 
Soledad, es una Socia exigente es la secretaria del Banco, durante su preparación en el Banco demostró ser una líder mas del Banco D. Emprendimiento Luciana actualmente se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, el crédito solicitado, lo requiere para la compra D. cosméticos.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en el aumento D. mercadería, por la cantidad D. pedidos que tiene, durante este fin D. año.
texts.en:
The Luciana Community Bank is maD. up of 10 clients who belong to the San Antonio region, and are located around the Modelo market. The members are dedicated to selling food, party planning, cosmetics, beauty treatments, and confectionary. This is their first cycle with the institution since 50% of the members have not received loans. Maria Elizabeth is the leader and president of the bank. She is a founding member who formed the entrepreneurial bank. In her bank, she has learned to be responsible and united with her colleagues. She is strict with her colleagues about paying on time. Currently, she is dedicated to confectionary. Since she has no loans with other institutions, she will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients to make her products, including cakes, cookies and pies. Pamela is the treasurer of the bank and is one of the founders who established the Luciana bank. She is dedicated to selling clothing and cosmetics. She did not have the money to start her own business. Nevertheless, now, with the loan that she will be granted, she will be able to acquire merchandise to increase her economic income. Soledad is a demanding member and is the secretary of the bank. While preparing for the bank, she proved to be a leader. Currently, Luciana is dedicated to selling cosmetics. She needs the loan to buy cosmetics.She will invest the loan in expanding her merchandise to meet the quantity of orders that she has at this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An increase in capital

loans.name: Mrs. Seu Suon Village Bank Group

texts.en: A village bank loan that consists of ten people is located in Trapeang Chaeng village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Seu S. is the village bank president. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Sin Pao, is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. This couple has three children. One of the children is employed in a garment factory, one is a laborer and one attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Julias Juma

texts.en:
Julias Juma Kitenyo owns Mazoea Carving Suppliers, where he has been making and selling assorted wood carvings to wholesalers and retailers for the past 17 years. His business is located at Changamwe in a coastal town of Kenya. His business challenge is marketing his products, especially the with an export market and low awareness. The business also depends highly on tourism, which is cyclical. 

He will use the proceeds of 50,000 KES to buy raw materials for making carvings. Julias' dream is to have an international market for exporting his goods and to be able to invest in his business. He is married and has four children. Julias describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making wood carvings

loans.name: Betty Antonila

texts.es:
Betty C. de 51 años de edad, tiene una casa de ladrillos ubicada en la zona Fortín de Guayaquil, Betty comenzó su negocio cuando vio que en su sector necesitaban una tienda de víveres y le gustaba mucho la idea de implementarla.

Ahora Betty trabaja en su tienda desde las 08h00 hasta las 20h30 todos los días incluyendo los domingos en su tienda tienen aceites, arroz, azúcar, colas, etc. Una de las mayores complicaciones son los ladrones por lo que Betty puso por mayor seguridad  rejas en su tienda. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos familiares vendiendo caldo de salchicha, ellos tienen 2 hijos uno de 18 años y otro de 24 años ya todos en Universidad.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más aceites, arroz, azúcar, y más víveres para su negocio. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio poniendo otro en otro sector, y así darle un buen futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Betty C., 51 years old, has a brick house located in the Fortín neighborhood of Guayaquil. Betty began her business when she saw the need for a grocery store in her area, and she really enjoyed the thought of opening one. Now, Betty works in her store from 8:00 a.m. until 10:30 p.m. every day including Sundays. Her shop carries oil, rice, sugar, colas, etc. One of the major setbacks are burglars, so Betty has put bars on her store for better security. Her husband helps her with household expenses by selling sausage soup. They have 2 children, one 18-year-old and another 24-year-old, both in college. With this loan, she wants to buy more oil, rice, sugar, and more food products for her shop. In the future, she wants to expand her business, putting another one in another neighborhood, and that way give her family a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella J. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Annabella is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Annabella owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food products such as repacked "ginataang langka" or green jack fruit with coconut milk in the local community. Annabella has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Annabella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Annabella is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Annabella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Siham has been producing olive oil for 15 years. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase olives for her work and save money for her children's school tuition. This is the first time that Siham has requested a loan. Siham is special in her work because she does her best to produce the best quality of olive oil. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues and couldn’t produce as much as she does today. Siham decided on doing her business because she took over her family’s business. In the future, she plans to keep on expanding her work by producing more.

loans.use: To purchase olives for her work.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca Careaga is from San Estanislao and lives in the Colonel Vincente Mongelos neighborhood.  She is 55 years old and married to Julio Candia Portillo, who is 48.  They have two children together who are grown up and work on their own.  Francisca runs a retail store out of her home which she has named "Las Perlas" (The Pearl).  She has an established client base, good personal and professional references, and earns a good income.  She is very hardworking.  Now, Francisca would like to purchase another vehicle to use in selling her merchandise around the town.

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle to use in selling her merchandise around the town

loans.name: Agua De Illimani Group

texts.es: El grupo “Agua D. Illimani” esta representado por la señora Dora y conformado por 12 socios D. los cuales 11 son mujeres y 1 es varón, ellos son D. la misma zona y son personas sociables, amistosas, y muy unidas. La señora Dora es casada su esposo se llama Eusebio  y ambos tiene una niña por la cual trabajar todos los días, la socia se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda D. barrio venD. alimentos D. primera necesidad, además tiene cabinas telefónicas en su misma casa la cual es su vivienda propia y su esposo se dedica al transporte público D. pasajeros con un minibus D. su propiedad que se encuentran pagando poco a poco. Las demás socias también se dedican al comercio con productos como mubles, ropas, verduras, comida, algunas D. ellos se dedican a la artesanía que realizan tejidos D. mantas, chalinas, guantes, medias y cerrajería. El crédito será utilizado para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo con la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso para sus familias. Las socias tienen mucha experiencia en sus negocios a pesar D. que hay mucha competencia en el mercado, pero los socios se dan sus modos para acomodar o vender sus mercaderías ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia en grupos solidarios las socias van cursando un segundo ciclo con la institución por lo que saben el manejo D. los fondos y su buena administración para que el crédito sirva como un apoyo financiero para el crecimiento D. sus negocios.
texts.en:
Señora Dora represents the Agua D. Illiman group which has twelve members, eleven women and one man. They are from the same neighbourhood and are sociable, friendly, and very united. Señora Dora is married; her husband’s name is Eusebio. They have a daughter and work on a daily basis to support her. Dora is a businesswoman and runs a shop selling basic food items. She also has telephone booths in her home which she owns. Her husband works in transportation and has his own minibus which he is paying for in installments. Some members of the group run businesses selling furniture, clothing, vegetables, or food. Others make items such as ponchos, shawls, gloves, woollen stockings, and another is a locksmith. This loan will be used to buy merchandise, supplies, material, and tools which will help to generate more income for the members’ families. The members have a lot of business experience, and in spite of the stiff competition in the marketplace, they do their utmost to adapt and sell their products since their families depend on the money they make. As for their experience with group credit, they are on their second loan cycle with this institution so they know how to manage the funds. Their administrative skills mean that the loan will be used to support the expansion of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Alinyikira Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
John I. appearring in the small photo at the top left ,  also appears in the big photo. He is the leader of this lending group.

John I. is a hardworking 37-year-old married man with four children. Two are in primary and two are in secondary school. 

John is a boda-boda (a bicycle with a tailor-made seat over the rear wheel) driver who also does some produce sales. His biggest challenges are security in boda-boda driving and ensuring he has enough produce when he is working on his produce business.

John has been in his businesses for three years. Working at these businesses, John is able generate 70,000 USH in profits each week.

John dreams of owning the leading business in Ivunanba and also of educating his family very well. Today he is taking his 2nd loan from Pearl for 100,000 USH to increase the capital in his businesses.

loans.use: To buy more produce like fresh foods to sell

loans.name: Messan Sefako

texts.en: Messan Sefako K. is 31 years old, married, and has one child. He sells used clothing in the Hédzranawoé market in Lomé, Togo. Mr. K. began this business in 2000 and is now requesting his second loan from Kiva partner, WAGES. He will use his loan to restock his inventory of used clothing and keep up with the high demand in this busy location.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for resale

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao M., 23, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorian temples.

M. is a farmer who sells her rice products for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to buy cows to help plow the rice fields. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to raise pigs. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows to help plow the rice fields

loans.name: Zazay Group

texts.en:
Shah Kuku is the daughter of S. A.. She is 38 years old and the leader of 'Zazay' group. She is married and the mother of 5 children; they live in Kabul, Afghanistan. She wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a general store. With this loan he wants to buy beans, shampoo, pens and notebooks.

So she is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank those who support this process, especially Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: buy beans, shampoo, pens and notebooks for his shop

loans.name: Diana Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Diana Elisa P.  P., vive con su compañero de vida en el Barrio La Borgoña, su esposo labora como Maestro de Obra, apoyando con sus ingresos a los gastos que se incurre en el hogar, la señora se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene 16 años de trabajar en este rubro, siendo su madre quien la ayudo económicamente a ganarse la vida de esta manera.

Uno de los principales problemas que posee en su hogar, es la escases de agua que le abastece solamente 2 días a la semana, uno de los planes para contrarrestar esta dificultad, es la adquisición de  un tanque de almacén de agua para los días de racionamiento, a futuro comprara un tramo para lograr una ampliación y mayor ofrecimiento de sus productos, por ahora solicita este préstamo para la  compra un mayor inventario de abarrotes y utensilios con el fin de surtir un poco más la venta, este apoyo les ayudara a futuro para subsidiar proyectos que sean de beneficio para toda la familia. Ellos son una familia muy humilde, pero que gozan del prestigio ante su comunidad como una familia responsable que se ha ganado su sustento con el trabajo honesto del día a día.
texts.en:
Diana Elisa P. P. lives with her life partner in the La Borgoña neighborhood. Her husband is a master builder, and his income helps to support the family's household expenses. She sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in this line of work for 16 years; her mother helped her economically to be able to make a living in this way. One of the main problems they have in their house is the lack of water, which is supplied only 2 days a week. One plan to counter this difficulty is to acquire a water storage tank for the days of rationing. In the future she will buy a stand so that she can expand and offer more products. For now she requests this loan to buy a larger inventory of groceries and utensils with the objective of supplying more products for sale. This support will help them to afford future projects that will benefit the whole family. They are a very humble family, but they enjoy prestige in the community as they are a responsible family that has made its living with honest work, day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a larger inventory of products

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Six people make up a group loan located in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. Each member will use a small portion of the loan for a different purpose, in order to improve their business in the future.

Mrs. Sokha L., 40 years old, is the group leader selected by the other members in this group. She is a noodle seller in the local village, where she earns some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Saroeurn Khat, is a duck breeder and a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. Mrs. Sokha L.'s husband has a problem with his field having lots of mice and being infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Sokha L. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and plastic to protect the rice from the mice. She is the mother of three children; one attends the local public school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plastic to protect the rice from the mice

loans.name: Romy

texts.en:
Romy D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 33 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Romy raises rice for sale. Romy has been engaged in his business for over 15 years.

Romy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Romy is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds and to pay for the laborers who help at the farm. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Romy from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds and to pay for the laborers who help at the farm

loans.name: Jose Alcidez

texts.es: Jose Alcidez O. M. de 60 años de edad, es un hombre muy emprendedor, el cual posee 20 años de experiencia en trabajar como agricultor. Él reside en el hermoso pueblo de Suchitoto, el cual esta ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. José vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y tres hijos, los cuales a pesar que son bastante jóvenes le ayudan a su padre a sembrar la semilla, y así mismo a darle todos los cuidados necesarios para una excelente cosecha. José posee varias tierras en las cuales cultiva diferentes tipos de granos básicos, los cuales coloca en unos graneros de forma cilíndricas hechos de acero inoxidable, estos granos son los que luego comercializa  con sus diferentes clientes los cuales le compran por mayor, este es un negocio el cual le ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario durante 20 años, es por ello que José cuenta con una gran experiencia lo que lo hace más llamativos para los diferentes clientes. Él solicita  un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de abono, maíz, pesticidas, y así mismo pagar la mano de obra para desgranas el elote, esto le permite elaborar un mejor trabajo y obtener mayores ganancias, así mismo le permite brindarle fuentes de trabajo a otras personas lo cual es muy importante para José.
texts.en:
Jose Alcidez O. M., age 60, is a very hard-working man who has 20 years of experience working as a farmer. He lives in the beautiful village of Suchitoto, which is located in the department of Cuscatlan. Jose lives with his wife, who works as a housewife, and their three children, who, despite their young age, help their father to sow seeds and to provide all the necessary care for an excellent crop. Jose has several lands where he cultivates different kinds of basic grains, which he stores in a barn in stainless steel cylinders. These are the grains that he later sells to different customers who purchase the grain wholesale. This is a business that has allowed him to have all he needs for 20 years. This is why he has much experience which makes him stand out to his customers. He is requesting a loan through which he will be able to have the necessary money to purchase a greater quantity of fertilizer, corn, and pesticides, and to pay for labourers to harvest the corn. This will allow him to do better work and earn a better income, and also to offer jobs to other people, which is very important to him.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of pesticides, seeds for crops, and labour for corn harvesting

loans.name: Habinshuti

texts.en:
Habinshuti was born in 1982 and he is single. Habinshuti lives with his parents and he has to contribute to his home. Habinshuti is one of the family members who is old enough to provide some of the needs of the family. Habinshuti owns a small business selling bed sheets and other products in Kigali city. This business is well organized and profitable because he gets what he needs from this business. Habinshuti has two years of experience in his business and he employs one person from his community as a helper. The shop hours are from 7 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day except on Saturday.

Habinshuti is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business. Once his business expands his monthly profit will increase, which will allow him to buy land where he will build his own house so that he can get married.

loans.use: To purchase more bed sheets and other products

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa es soltera, tiene 25 años de edad y vive con sus padres en el distrito de Mórrope, un distrito caracterizado por estar conformado por un pueblo central y varios caseríos situados alrededor de la zona y que distan mucho entre sí, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y está ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene en su casa un pequeño negocio de venta de animales que ella misma cría (ovinos, porcinos y aves de corral), cuando sus animales han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos o negociantes que siempre frecuentan la zona. Este negocio le brinda los recursos necesarios para sostener a sus padres los acuales son de avanzada edad.

Su negocio ha ido prosperando y ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de ovejas, pero lo que percibe en ganancias no le basta para alimentarlas, por lo que está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 soles que invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus animales.

Su deseo es que el negocio siga creciendo y hacer una pequeña granja que le brinde a ella y a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva y con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. Rosa está agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella en su anterior préstamo
texts.en:
Rosa is single, 25 years old, and lives with her parents in Mórrope, a district made up of a central village with various rural settlements spread out around it. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She runs a small business out of her house, selling animals that she raises herself (sheep, pigs, and caged birds). When her animals have reached a good level of development, she puts them up for sale to her neighbors or the merchants who frequent the area. This business provides her with the necessary income to take care of her aging parents. Her business has been prospering and she now has a good number of sheep, but her earnings are not enough to feed them. This is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of feed for her animals. She hopes that her business will continue to grow, and would like to start a small farm to offer her and her family a better quality of life. She has worked with Kiva and Edpyme Alternativa before and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making her repayments. Rosa is grateful to the people who helped her with her previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase well-balanced feed and to improve her business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Las Flores De Galeana Group
loans.use: To expand her business with a variety of lunches and fast food

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María M. R., es muy trabajadora y responsable y a sus 29 años de edad, cuenta con su propia familia, junto a la cual vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán, su esposo se dedica a trabajar como comerciante de productos varios mientras que sus dos hijos uno de 5 años quien estudia y el menor de 1 año de edad, se encuentran al cuidado de Ana, quien debe dividirse entre sus responsabilidades en el hogar y como madre, como también con su trabajo. Ella posee su negocio propio, en el cual comercializa ropa para niños y adultos, su puesto se encuentra dentro del mercado regional de Ahuachapán, en donde tiene dos años de dedicarse a este trabajo. Ana solicita un préstamo con la iniciativa de mejorar sus ventas, comprando ropa para niños y mujeres, ya que es esta la cual posee mayor demanda en el lugar, la cual ella desea aprovechar, con esto Ana espera no solo mejorar su economía familiar, sino también poder realizarse aún más como comerciante.
texts.en:
Ana María M. R. is 29 years old and is very hard-working and responsible. She has a family of her own and they live together in the department of Ahuachapán. Her husband works as a merchant selling various products while Ana cares for their two children, one who is 5 years old and attends school and the younger child, who is a year old. Ana must divide her time between her responsibilities at home and as a mother, as well as her job. She owns her own business selling clothing for children and adults. Her stand is in the Ahuachapán regional market where she has been selling for two years. Ana is requesting a loan to buy women's and children's clothing to improve her sales since this is what is in high demand here and she wishes to take advantage of this. Ana not only hopes to improve her family's economic situation, but also to be even more fulfilled as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis R. is from the town of Talibon. Her business is a sari-sari store. She sells various kinds of products like soft drinks, shampoo, sugar and many others items. According to her, she has been running the store for more than four years now. It is the main source of income her family has and she hopes it will grow more. She hopes to acquire more kinds of products to serve her neighbors.

Flordelis joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordelis is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar I. is 56 years old.  Anvar has been raising sheep for the last five years.  Over the years of his activities, two of his children have become adults and now help him as well as his wife.  Currently, Anvar has 15 heads of the sheep in the household which help to generate stable profits. 

Now Anvar is planning to purchase more sheep and fodder for his family's business.  For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN.  He will use it to purchase 20 sheep.  This is the first loan for Anvar and he is grateful to everyone for trusting him and supporting him and promises not to let you down.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Ángela Guadalupe

texts.es: Ángela Guadalupe Z. M. de 24 años de edad, es una joven muy responsable con su hogar y en su trabajo. Ella vive en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposo y una pequeña hija de 7 años de edad, así mismo vive junto a sus padres y un hermano menor. Ángela se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo como: perfumes, maquillaje, ropa, zapatos, accesorios para la cocina y otros más, su negocio es bastante estable ya que cuenta con una cantidad bastante grande de clientes los cuales mes a mes consumen los productos que ella comercializa de forma ambulante, haciendo visitas de casa en casa mostrando los diferentes catálogos. De esta forma Ángela se gana la vida y es así como le brinda el apoyo necesario a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor variedad de zapatos y así mismo diferentes productos para ofrecer a sus clientes a los cuales en su mayoría compran a crédito por lo que Ángela necesita cierta cantidad de dinero para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela Guadalupe Z. M. is 24 years old and a responsible young woman at home and in her job. She lives in the Department of La Libertad with her husband and seven year old daughter. In addition, she lives with her parents and younger brother. Ángela sells products by catalog such as perfumes, makeup, clothing, shoes, cooking accessories, and many other items. Her business is stable since she has a large number of customers who buy products month after month. She sells merchandise as a traveling merchant, going house to house with different catalogs. Through this type of work, Ángela is able to earn a living and provide assistance to her husband with the household expenses.

For this reason, Ángela is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger variety of shoes as well as other products to offer to her customers. Most of her customers purchase on credit, so she needs a specific amount of money to invest in her business.

loans.use: Purchase catalog products to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene O. is from the village of Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Irene is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns and operates a transportation services business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating service-based services. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Irene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Irene is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair the existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Irene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita J. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juanita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Juanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Juanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Erenea

texts.en:
Erenea C. is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  pig-fattening and general store businesses. She lives in Prk. Yanog, Brgy. Tampalon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

 By working hard in her pig-fattening and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Erenea is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Erenea aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: working capital for her business

loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en:
Gulzat J., 34, leads this loan group and lives in Kadamjai, a small town in the southern part of Kyrgyzstan. For the last 15 years, she has made a living by taking orders for, and sewing, Kyrgyz national dress and blankets. In a typical month, she earns 4,000 soms, an income which has allowed her to save enough money to buy a one-room flat.  She has applied for this loan to buy the fabrics and materials she needs to continue her business. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to open her own sewing workshop.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials

loans.name: Dolores Beneranda

texts.es:
En la parroquia Alajuela del cantón  Portoviejo  se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Alajuela, este sector es conocido por ser una zona donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

Para la señora Dolores este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que estuvo en la creación del Banco pero tuvo un problema y no pudo tener un crédito pero luego soluciono el problema y nuevamente ingreso en el Banco. Tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos tres mayores y dos de 15 y 10 años, ellos estudian y viven aun en su casa. Su esposo es panadero.

Tienen una panadería en el centro de Alajuela en que hacen diversos tipos y sabores de pan, además de pasteles y tortas de cumpleaños, trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 13h00 en la venta pero desde la noche ellos preparan la masa para que en la madrugada ya este todo listo para hornear el delicioso pan, sus hijos le ayudan cuando no tienen muchas tareas que hacer.

Este crédito es para comprar harina, azúcar, sal, y otros ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración del delicioso pan. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "Alajuela" community bank meet in Alajuela parish, in Portoviejo canton.  This area is known for the fact that most of its inhabitants are farmers.

This is Dolores' fourth loan cycle with her community bank and she tells us that she was there when her community bank was founded but that she had a problem and couldn't take a loan.  However, she solved her problem and became a member of the bank again.

Dolores is 41 years old, married, and has 5 children.  Three of her children are already grown up and the other two are 15 and 10 years old and still live at home with her.  Her husband is a baker.

Dolores and her husband have a bakery in the center of Alajuela where they make different types and flavors of bread.  They also make cakes and birthday cakes.  They work every day from 5.00am to 1.00pm selling their products but they prepare their dough at night so that, early in the morning, they have everything ready to bake their delicious bread.  Their children help them when they don't have a lot of other work to do.

Dolores will use this loan to buy flour, sugar, salt and other ingredients they need to make their delicious bread.  Their dream is for their children to become good professionals.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, salt, eggs, butter, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, none of whom are currently in school. Mary has a small pharmacy business selling medicines, which she has run for over ten years.
To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicines for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Mary hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines for resale

loans.name: Twikuremubukene B Group

texts.fr: Léonile Ndagijemariya est agricultrice, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle a 50 ans, elle est mariée, et née a Rwanda.  Elle a 8 enfants entre 5 ans et 25 ans, 5 de qui vont à l’école, et elle a fini 6 ans d’école primaire.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 pompe pour l’insecticide, et 2 paquets de tomates pour les cultiver.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire et d’acheter les matériels de technicité, augmenter l’espace de l’agriculture en vue de réaliser beaucoup de récoltes dans son secteur.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande agricultrice dans de district de Rubavu, assurer le bien être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.  Pour gagner plus de revenue, Léonile est aussi élévatrice de poules et chèvres.
texts.en:
Léonile Ndagijemariya is a farmer and member of ACB since 2010. She is 50 years old, married, and was born in Rwanda. She has eight children ranging in age from 5 to 25 years old, five of whom attend school. She completed six years of primary school. 

She will use her loan to buy a pump for insecticide, and two packs of tomatoes seeds. Her business growth strategy is to buy specialized equipment and increase her cultivable area in order to achieve a high volume of crops. She would like to become a great farmer in the Rubavu district, ensure her family’s well-being, and pay for her children’s tuition. 

As a sideline, to increase her revenue, Léonile also works as a chicken and goat breeder.

loans.use: To purchase a pump and two packs of tomato seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more phone cards and add some cash to his foreign exchange business

loans.name: Laura Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Laura es cliente nueva de la institución ella vive con su esposo en Villa Salome tienen dos pequeños hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad la Sra. Laura brida el servicio de  juegos en red e internet los cuales atiende desde el medio día hasta las diez de la noche antes trabajaba todo el día con Internet, su esposo don Milton trabaja como profesor de computación de informática en el colegio de la zona el crédito que esta solicitando es para ampliar su negocio y la compra de una línea telefónica  ya que cuenta con una y su deseó de ella es colocar también sus cabinas telefónicas y así poder ayudar mas en los ingresos de la familia, es una joven muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Laura is a new client of Emprender. She lives with her husband in Villa Salome and has two children, ages 4 and 7. Sra. Laura provides computer games and Internet services at her business which is open from noon until 10pm. She used to work all day with the Internet. Her husband, Don Milton, is a computer science teacher at a local school.

The loan she is requesting will be used to expand her business and acquire another telephone line. She already has one line, but she wants to install another one for her phone booths to help generate more income for her family. Laura is a hardworking young woman who is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To install another phone line for her call center.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan B. is single. He is a private entrepreneur from Beregovo. He sells men’s clothing in a local mall called Image.  Stepan is an experienced vendor with good taste in quality clothing. He has been in this business for 14 years. Stepan has invested about 60,000 Grivnyas in inventory.  

Stepan is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to add seasonal merchandise to his stock. He is planning to buy jackets, jumpers, and sportswear for spring. Stepan is a devoted businessman who is seeking to expand his business, thereby bringing him stable profits.

loans.use: To purchase jackets, jumpers, and sportswear

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 45 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es padre de tres hijos de 14, 15 y 18 años, quienes viven con él y su madre, don José se dedica a la venta de artesanía, minutas en carretón y ruedas (juegos mecánicos), está enfocado en andar en ferias de los pueblos comunales.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería, para las artesanías y minutas, con esta compra está garantizando una mejor estabilidad al negocio.
Su aspiración es tener acceso a más carretones de minutas, administrar otro negocio, aumentado sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old and lives in San Miguel.  He is the father of three children aged 14, 15 and 18.  His children live with him and their mother.  José's business is selling handicrafts, snow cones from a cart and fairground rides.  He concentrates on going to village markets.

José is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, for his handicrafts and snow cones.  This purchase will guarantee him better stability for his business.

José's aspirations are to have access to more snow cone carts, to run another business and to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es: José Mario B. de treinta y siete años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en el departamento de La Libertad. El compra chatarra al detalle, la acumula y luego vende al por mayor en lugares en los cuales vuelven a ocupar este reciclaje para volver a hacerlo hierro, tiene mucha clientela pues trata de pagar los mejores precios, es un hombre entregado a su trabajo. José quiere salir adelante y siempre satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad de comprar más chatarra como trozos de metal, lata y aluminio, ya que a mayor volumen de entrega que hace a los depositos de reciclaje es mayor el porcentaje que pagan por quintal pesado. José quiere darle un mejor futuro a su familia y tiene esperanza que si su negocio crece les dará todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
José Mario B., 37 years old, lives with his wife and two children in the department of La Libertad. He buys scrap metal in pieces, accumulates it and later sells it in bulk to places where they use this recycled material to make more iron. He has a lot of clientele since he tries to pay the best prices. He is a man who is very dedicated to his work. 

José wants to get ahead and always to meet the needs of his customers. For that reason, he asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will give him the opportunity to buy more scraps like pieces of metal, tin and aluminum, since the larger the volume of his deposits, the better percentage that they pay him per hundred-weight. José wants to give his family a better future and has hope that if his business grows he will give them everything they need.

loans.use: to buy scrap pieces of metal, tin and aluminum

loans.name: Videkon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement VIDEKON est composé de trente membres qui se connaissent parce qu’elles habitent dans le même quartier à Womey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Elisabeth, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Elisabeth est mariée à un agent au Port nommé Robert et a trois enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont ses propres enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a environs cinq ans que Elisabeth et son mari se sont installés à Womey. Elisabeth n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Elisabeth mène comme activité depuis quatre ans environs, la vente de friperies de façon ambulante. C'est au marché de Missèbo à Cotonou que Elisabeth s'approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Elisabeth sollicite avec les autres membres de son groupe, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité.
texts.en: The Videkon group is composed of 30 members who know each other through being neighbors from the same district of Womey, in the community of Abomey Calavi. The group’s leader, by the name of Elisabeth, it the one raising her hand in the photo. With the goal of expanding their business and better meeting customer demand, the group is asking for financing from ALIDé. Elisabeth is married to Robert, a port agent, and has three dependent children, two of whom are her own, and all of whom are in school,. The spouses jointly take care of various family expenses. Elisabeth and her husband settled in Womey about five years ago. Elisabeth never attended school. In order to support herself and her family, she has been selling second-hand clothing as a street vendor for about four years. She stocks up at the Missèbo market in Cotonou. In order to strengthen her business and better meet her customers’ needs, Elisabeth and her group are seeking a loan from ALIDé. She would like to expand the scope of her business.

loans.use: to buy some bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 26 years.  She is 50 years old, married to Joseph Macharia and they have five children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan.  She paid all of her previous loans on time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and also a dairy cow.

In the future, Josephine hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.es: Sulpicia es socia del Banco Comunal los Claveles, tiene 57 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Sulpicia se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de corazón, pancitas y también a la venta de ganados. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá  en la compra de ganados. Comenzó con éste negocio hace 33 años con ello educó a sus hijos y esposo. Le gusta FINCA Perú, por la facilidad en los créditos, en la capacitaciones les enseñan a practicar lo valores, a mejorar en su familia y negocio, a tenido difilcutades su mamá sufrió un derrame cerebral. Ahora está educando a sus sobrinos que son huérfanos y su sueño es que ellos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sulpicia is a member of the communal bank "Los Claveles". She is 57 years old, married, and she has three children. 

Sulpicia sells heart kebabs, haggis, and she also sells livestock. 

The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of cattle. She started this business 33 years ago and through it she sent her children and husband to school. She appreciates Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for the easy loan process and for the training they receive on practicing sound values to improve their family and their business. She has had personal difficulties following her mother's stroke. She is now keeping her orphaned nieces and nephews in school and her dream is for them to earn a career.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Josie has a retail shop that sells t-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy additional t-shirts, blouses & underwear.

Josie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional t-shirts, blouses & underwear.

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en:
Nabeel is 35 years old. He is a hard working man who is also the owner of a padding shop for sofas, where he sells good quality sofa covers, fabric and pads.

Since his business field is not a service wanted every day by the same customer, he made sure to have a good reputation with his customers by giving them the best in terms of quality and service. Working on that helps him gain new customers all the time just from his older customer’s word of mouth.

Now, Nabeel has applied for this loan because he has found a good offer to buy a larger quantity of new design fabric at a lower price, which will help him add new fashionable fabric models for his sofas.

loans.use: To buy new fabric and pads for sofas

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: El señor Manuel es chofer, tiene un taxi de servicio de transporte de pasajeros. Manuel también estudia la carrera de Comunicación Social. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora que le servirá para continuar sus estudios, pues muchas veces necesita efectuar investigaciones a través de la Internet y actualmente tiene que buscar lugares públicos con este tipo de servicio. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicado en la zona Pasankeri en  la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y se canaliza este crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Manuel is a driver for a taxi company. He is also taking Social Communication courses.

He is seeking a loan to buy a computer which will help him with his studies as he often needs to do research on the internet. At the moment he has to go to public internet cafes to do this. 

Manuel lives in rented accommodation in the Pasankeri neighbourhood of La Paz. He is single and doesn’t have any children. This is the first loan he has taken out with Impro who are partnering with Kiva to provide the loan.

loans.use: to buy a computer so he can continue his studies

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.en:
Prudencio is 56 years old and married with six school-age children. Someday, Prudencio hopes to give all his children the education they need for a brighter future. As a farmer working in the Philippines, he earns the average net income of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each cropping season in April and November. 

Prudencio has been growing rice for almost 30 years now. Farming has been the only business his family has to battle against poverty. He is asking for a loan to pay the labor fees for preparing his land and to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his faming. This loan will allow Prudencio to increase his rice production.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees used in his land preparation and to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his farming.

loans.name: Doris Ynes

texts.es: La Sra. Doris, es madre soltera, tiene 02 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y viven independientemente de ella,  la Sra.  Doris tiene  un auto  el cual lo alquila desde  hace 03 años, percibiendo una rentabilidad diaria de 35 soles; su  desafío  es que a  las personas  que lo alquila no cuidan el vehículo  como debería ser; su sueño es comprar  un nuevo carro para alquilarlo también; el crédito lo va a invertir en reparar el motor y para la compra de repuestos. La Sra. Doris está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Doris is a single mother.  She has two children who are already adults and live independently from her.  Doris has a car that she’s leased out for the last three years earning a daily rental of 35 soles.  Her challenge is that the people she leases the car to don’t take care of it like they should.  Her dream is to buy a new car and to lease it out too.  She will use the loan to repair the car’s engine and to buy replacement parts.  Doris is very grateful for the loan she was granted.

loans.use: to repair her car's engine and to buy replacement parts.

loans.name: Blanca Ninosca

texts.es: Blanca Ninosca labora como docente de primaria desde hace 10 años, ella vive con su abuelita y con su unico hijo, solicita su 8vo crèdito el  cual lo invertira en compra de materiales para construir una habitaciòn para brindar mejores condiciones a su familia, es muy reconocida por ser responsable y cumplida con sus obligaciones,  su sueño es que su hijo estudie para que en el futuro sea un hombre de bien y tener estabilidad laboral para seguir apoyando a su linda familia.
texts.en: Blanca Ninosca has worked as an elementary school teacher for ten years.  She lives with her grandmother and her only son.  She is asking for her eighth loan, which she will use to purchase materials to build a room that will provide her family with better living conditions.  She is well known for being responsible and trustworthy in her obligations.  Her dream is for her son to get an education so that in the future he will be a good man with the job stability to keep helping his wonderful family.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Blanca Rita

texts.es: Blanca Rita tiene 57 años, tiene 4 hijos pero solamente 1 está bajo su cargo Su actividad económica una pulpería. Ha sido con la ayuda de sus hijos que Blanca ha podido establecer este negocio pues ellos la apoyan. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido el mantener este negocio pues tiene cierta competencia.  Es por eso que el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, enlatados y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Blanca Rita is 57, and has 4 children; only one of whom is her responsibility.  She has a general store.  It's because of her children's help that Blanca has been able to set up this business, since they support her. 

One of her greatest challenges has been keeping this business going, since she has a certain amount of competition. This is why the loan she is applying for is for working capital to buy basic grains, candy, fruit drinks, bread, cookies, canned goods, and soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, candy, fruit drinks, bread, cookies, canned goods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a 49-year old married mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Loan and her husband run a small general store selling food products and household necessities in their community. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Loan would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic foods to stock her general store. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy basic foods to sell.

loans.name: Purevlhagva

texts.en:
Purevlhagva is 40 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife sells Mongolian socks at the local market and his two children are high school students. He started his business in 2000 by driving a motorcycle for a taxi service. In 2007 he bought a car for taxi service. He has eleven years of work and business experience. 

Starting in 2011, he took three loans from XacBank and successfully expanded his business. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says: "I have many regular clients who ask for a taxi on a demand basis. My business is going well but I want to expand it and buy a truck for domestic transportation." He is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to buy gas and to increase his turnover capital.

loans.use: to buy gas.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra, de 46 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Estelí, es odontóloga, madre de dos hijos de 20 y 14 años de edad respectivamente, esta casada. Ella nos cuenta que el estudiar esta profesión fue todo un reto para ella, debido  su origen humilde con mucho sacrificio logro graduarse, ella combinaba su trabajo con sus estudios ,ahorrando para un día lograr poner su propia sala odontológica, así lo hizo, es humilde sencilla pero atiende las necesidades de su población. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar una turbina odontológica, ya que le es de gran necesidad, es parte de su material de trabajo. Esto le ayudara a ella a ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y complementara parte de su herramienta de trabajo. Ella desea remodelar su sala odontológica, acondicionarla mejor.
texts.en: Mayra is 46 years old and she lives in the cit of Esteli. She is a dentist and she is the mother of two children, aged 20 and 14 respectively. She is married.
